analyzed: 'dir ni 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: Here, this is what is being thought:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rtogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rtogs pa las gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the passage is that form, etc. are posited as causes from the understanding of the special nature of the effect, consciousness.

original: yang na gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa khyad par can yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa khyad par can yin pa de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Alternatively, the meaning of the passage is that form, etc. are causes because consciousness is special in that way, but not otherwise.

original: gzugs kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i tshig nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya ba'i tshig nye bar bkod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom the special nature of form‚Äù is a statement of the topic to be explained.

original: bshad pa ni yongs su gsal ba dga' ba dang mi gsal ba mi dga' ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa ni yongs su gsal ba dga' ba dang mi gsal ba mi dga' ba ste /
translated: The explanation is that the pleasant is the clear and the unpleasant is the unclear.

original: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la brten pa de dag la sogs pa gzugs nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la brten pa de dag la sogs pa gzugs nyid la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dag go //
translated: Those, such as the pleasant and unpleasant, are form, etc.

original: de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i gzugs kyi khyad par de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid de rang bzhin gang la yod pa'i gzugs kyi khyad par de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The special nature of form is that which has the characteristic of those, i.e., the nature of those.

original: ni'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan no //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan no //
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù is an ornament of the verse.

original: 'dis ni yul gyi khyad par las 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul gyi khyad par las 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the difference in the effect, i.e., consciousness, is due to the difference in the object.

original: yul can gyi khyad par las 'bras bu rnam par rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ston pa ni de bzhin du mig phyed btsums pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul can gyi khyad par las 'bras bu rnam par rnam par shes pa'i khyad par ston pa ni de bzhin du mig phyed btsums pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The difference in the effect, i.e., consciousness, is due to the difference in the subject, as when one half of the eye is paralyzed.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i khyad par de ni khyad par dang bcas pa'i mig la sogs pa dang / 'brel pas rgyu mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bur ni nga'o zhes bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par byed cing rang dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu yang rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i khyad par de ni khyad par dang bcas pa'i mig la sogs pa dang / 'brel pas rgyu mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bur ni nga'o zhes bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du rtogs par byed cing rang dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu yang rtog par byed do //
translated: The difference in the effect, i.e., consciousness, is due to the difference in the eye, etc., which are related to it. The self, i.e., the eye, etc., is the effect of the cause, i.e., the eye, etc., and it is the effect of the self.

original: gal te dbang phyug rgyu nyid du rtog pa la yang rigs pa 'di nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug rgyu nyid du rtog pa la yang rigs pa 'di nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If this very same reasoning is not applicable to the conception of ƒ™≈õvara as the cause,

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, ƒ™≈õvara, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar dbang phyug ni rang gi rnam par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug ni rang gi rnam par 'gyur pas /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to understand how ƒ™≈õvara, by his transformation,

original: 'bras bu rnam par bsgyur bar byed pa ni ji ltar yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par bsgyur bar byed pa ni ji ltar yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: transforms the effect.

original: bar skabs kyi brjod pa rdzogs nas skabs nyid brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste sngar bshad pas na'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi brjod pa rdzogs nas skabs nyid brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba ste sngar bshad pas na'o //
translated: Having completed the intermediate discussion, he states the point of the chapter: ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù as previously explained.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained in two parts, as before.

original: rnam pa 'di ni gnyi ga mang dbang phyug la @40a * //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di ni gnyi ga mang dbang phyug la @40a * //
translated: This aspect does not exist for both, i.e., for ƒ™≈õvara.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni rgyu las ldog pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni rgyu las ldog pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThat very nature which is the opposite of the cause.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'i phyogs la ni go sla'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyogs la ni go sla'o //
translated: The side of permanence is easy to understand.

original: khyad par bsam pa yang ci ltar sngar ma skyes pa de bzhin dud ltar yang yin pa'i phyir sdong du ma dang sha za la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyad par skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na'o //
analyzed: khyad par bsam pa yang ci ltar sngar ma skyes pa de bzhin dud ltar yang yin pa'i phyir sdong du ma dang sha za la sogs pa bzhin du rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyad par skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na'o //
translated: The difference is considered to be like the previous non-arising, and like the present non-arising. Therefore, like a stump and a ghost, etc., permanence and impermanence are the reasons for producing the difference.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ni de ltar dogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ni de ltar dogs par bya ba ma yin no zhes ston pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But this is not the case with form, etc.

original: lus pa'i dus na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rgyu skye pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyad par skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na'o //
analyzed: lus pa'i dus na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rgyu skye pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyis na khyad par skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na'o //
translated: The reason for impermanence is the production of the cause of the particular and the universal at the time of remaining.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore is the conclusion.

original: yon tan ni khyad par phul du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni khyad par phul du phyin pa'o //
translated: Excellence is the highest particular.

original: tshogs na zhes bya ba ni yon tan srid 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshogs na zhes bya ba ni yon tan srid 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: In the collection means in the collection of the excellences.

original: tshogs na de dag rgyu yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tshogs na de dag rgyu yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The excellences are the cause when they are collected.

original: khyad par med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference means because there is no difference in nature due to permanence.

original: bshad pa gnyis pa la ni yon tan 'bras bu la brten pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gnyis pa la ni yon tan 'bras bu la brten pa'o //
translated: In the second explanation, the excellences are based on the effect.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot from ƒ™≈õvara, etc.‚Äù means not from a non-cause.

original: khyad par med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa las 'bras bu la brten pa'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug la sogs pa las 'bras bu la brten pa'i khyad par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference‚Äù means that there is no difference established in the effect in dependence on ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes stsogs pa'i sgra ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes stsogs pa'i sgra ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara, etc.‚Äù includes such things as a nature and a person.

original: de ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba can bcom ldan 'das tshad mar grub pa'i skabs su tshad ma gzhan dgag pa byas pa na /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dbye ba can bcom ldan 'das tshad mar grub pa'i skabs su tshad ma gzhan dgag pa byas pa na /
translated: Thus, when the characteristic of valid knowledge is divided into the states of cause and effect, and when the BhagavƒÅn is established as valid knowledge, other forms of valid knowledge are refuted.

original: rtag pa'am / thog ma med pa'i skad cig brgyud pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu khyad par 'ga' zhig nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtag pa'am / thog ma med pa'i skad cig brgyud pa 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyes bu khyad par 'ga' zhig nyid tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Some say that a person who is permanent or who is a nature that is engaged in a continuum from beginningless moments is a certain kind of special valid knowledge.

original: sbyin pa dang brtse ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dgag par brtsams pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang brtse ba la sogs pa'i sgrub byed can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dgag par brtsams pas /
translated: It is not established by such means of establishment as generosity and love.

original: dbang phyug du smra ba bzlog pa na /
analyzed: dbang phyug du smra ba bzlog pa na /
translated: The refutation of the doctrine of the Lord is as follows:

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes smras so //
translated: If another were to say,üîΩThe cause of production is the cause of origination.

original: yongs su shes pa dang / stsogs pa'i sgras skyed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / stsogs pa'i sgras skyed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of complete knowledge, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: are respectively the cause of understanding and the cause of origination.

original: sgrub par byed pa rnams sun @40b phyung ba'i phyir dang brtag pa'i phyir med na'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa rnams sun @40b phyung ba'i phyir dang brtag pa'i phyir med na'o //
translated: If they do not exist, because the proofs are refuted and because of the analysis.üîΩBut if these two kinds of cause do not exist for the Lord,

original: 'o na ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis po de gzhan bcom ldan 'das la yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis po de gzhan bcom ldan 'das la yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: then existence is not possible.

original: srid pa ma yin no gal te yang rtag par khas blangs pa ma yin pa de ltan yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid khas blangs pa tsam gyis gdon mi za bar rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: srid pa ma yin no gal te yang rtag par khas blangs pa ma yin pa de ltan yang bsgrub par bya ba nyid khas blangs pa tsam gyis gdon mi za bar rgyu rnam pa gnyis yod par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: And if you do not accept that he is permanent, then how could it be that the mere acceptance of the probandum necessarily entails the existence of the two kinds of cause?

original: gang gi phyir med pa de'i phyir skye ba yang med la nges pa yang med pa des na tshad ma grub pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa de'i phyir skye ba yang med la nges pa yang med pa des na tshad ma grub pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin //
translated: Since they do not exist, origination and cessation do not exist. Therefore, what kind of valid cognition is this?

original: gnyis pa de med pa nyid brjod pa yin /
analyzed: gnyis pa de med pa nyid brjod pa yin /
translated: The second line states that they do not exist.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ni rnam 'grel na yod pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o//
analyzed: 'di ni rnam 'grel na yod pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o//
translated: this is the commentary on the commentary in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: de sgrub byed ni skye ba'am shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: de sgrub byed ni skye ba'am shes pa'i'o //
translated: The proof of that is the proof of arising or the proof of cognition.

original: skyed byed med na yang ga las 'grub par 'gyur ba gang gis rjes su sgrub /
analyzed: skyed byed med na yang ga las 'grub par 'gyur ba gang gis rjes su sgrub /
translated: If there is no cause of arising, then from what is there establishment? By what is there proof?

original: gal te 'bras bu de 'byung bar nges par nges pa yin na ni de'i tshe gus par rjes su sgrub pa dang / grub pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu de 'byung bar nges par nges pa yin na ni de'i tshe gus par rjes su sgrub pa dang / grub pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su sgrub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the effect is ascertained to arise, then at that time there is respectful proof and proof that is established.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa dang / dpyod pa pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The LokƒÅyatas, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, and so on say this.

original: de re zhig skyed byed med pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de re zhig skyed byed med pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that there is no cause of arising is as follows.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: First,

original: gal te gang gi rgyu rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: gal te gang gi rgyu rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
translated: if the cause is established, then the effect arises.

original: gal te mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /üîΩsngags la sogs pas de 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na ;
analyzed: gal te mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas na / sngags la sogs pas de 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na ;

original: sngags dang zhes smras so //
analyzed: sngags dang zhes smras so //
translated: then the statement ‚Äúmantra‚Äù and so on is made.

original: rgyud ni sman no //
analyzed: rgyud ni sman no //
translated: The continuum is the medicine.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes jewels and so on.

original: de'i lus thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lus thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are seen on the entire body.

original: gal te de sgrub byed yin na /
analyzed: gal te de sgrub byed yin na /
translated: If that is the proof,

original: de'i tshe byed pa thams cad thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe byed pa thams cad thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur na /

original: de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa rnam la 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i de kho na nyid ston par byed pa rnam la 'thad pa ma yin no //

original: da ni shes par byed pa med par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni shes par byed pa med par brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, in the absence of an awareness, the statement

original: de nges pa'i rgyu yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nges pa'i rgyu yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of that ascertainment‚Äù is meaningless.

original: ka ba la sogs pa la mi slu ba mthong ba'i phyir gzhan la yang shes par rjes su dpog go snyam na /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa la mi slu ba mthong ba'i phyir gzhan la yang shes par rjes su dpog go snyam na /
translated: If you think that because you see nondeception in pillars and so on, you infer awareness in other things,

original: phyogs gcig ces smos so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig ces smos so //

original: tshig ni lung ngo //
analyzed: tshig ni lung ngo //

original: yang skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir thams cad rig pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir thams cad rig pa mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to demonstrate that it is impossible for everything to be known because there is no creator,

original: thams cad yongs su shes pa'i rgyu dbang po shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad yongs su shes pa'i rgyu dbang po shes pa yin nam /
translated: is the cause of the complete knowledge of everything the awareness of the sense faculties,

original: dbang po dang don nam /
analyzed: dbang po dang don nam /
translated: or is it the sense faculties and objects,üîΩor is it the mind?

original: goms pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi shes pa'am rjes su dpag pa zhig yin zhes bya @41 * //
analyzed: goms pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi shes pa'am rjes su dpag pa zhig yin zhes bya @41 * //
translated: Or is it a mental consciousness that is accompanied by the habit of that, or is it an inference?

original: pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhe la bzhag nas rim gyis 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhe la bzhag nas rim gyis 'gog pa ni /
translated: Having placed such a thought in his mind, he gradually refutes it.

analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúthe object that is hidden‚Äù and so on refer to this.

original: gnyis pa zlog pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa zlog pa ni /
translated: The second refutation is

original: dbang don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: dbang po la ni khyad par 'ga' yang ma mthong ba kho na la /
analyzed: dbang po la ni khyad par 'ga' yang ma mthong ba kho na la /
translated: The sense faculty is not seen to have any difference.

original: don yang rgyang ring ba dang phra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
analyzed: don yang rgyang ring ba dang phra ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos gnas skabs de nyid yin no //
translated: The object is also in that very situation, with a nature that is distant, subtle, and so on.

original: gal te de ltar na yang de gnyis thams cad rig pa'i rgyu yin na de'i tshe skyes bu mtha' dag thams cad rig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang de gnyis thams cad rig pa'i rgyu yin na de'i tshe skyes bu mtha' dag thams cad rig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: Even if that is so, if both of those are the cause of knowing everything, then at that time all people would know everything. This is an absurd consequence.

original: dbang po'i shes pas thams cad rig par khas blangs nas nyes pa gzhan smras pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas thams cad rig par khas blangs nas nyes pa gzhan smras pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that the sense consciousness knows everything, he states another fault:

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúImpure‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te dbang po rnams ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po rnams ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that this fault does not occur because the sense faculties apprehend their objects by coming into contact with them,

original: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin ba na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin ba na zhes gsungs te /
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúIf the sense faculties apprehended their objects by coming into contact with them. . . . ‚Äù

original: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin par gnas pa na /
analyzed: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin par gnas pa na /
translated: If the sense faculties apprehended their objects by coming into contact with them,

original: thams cad rig par ji ltar brjod de //
analyzed: thams cad rig par ji ltar brjod de //
translated: then how could it be said that they are aware of everything?

original: gang zhig ma phrad pa de nyid du rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig ma phrad pa de nyid du rnam par shes pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness does not arise in relation to what is not present.

original: des na dbang po ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: des na dbang po ma phrad par 'dzin pa ni khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should not accept that the sense faculties apprehend their objects without coming into contact with them.

original: des na nyes pa snga ma kho na'o //üîΩgsum pa sel ba ni /
analyzed: des na nyes pa snga ma kho na'o // gsum pa sel ba ni /
translated: In that case, the previously stated fault still applies.

original: de'i yid kyis zhes bya ste /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i yid kyis zhes bya ste / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i'o //
translated: The third fault is stated in the line, ‚ÄúThe mind that is asserted to be omniscient. . . . ‚Äù

original: sngar ni dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i yid kyi shes pa yang med pa kho na te /
analyzed: sngar ni dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i yid kyi shes pa yang med pa kho na te /
translated: The mind that is asserted to be omniscient, that is, to know everything, does not exist at all, because it does not engage in the manner of following the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba kho nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su 'gro ba kho nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It engages only in the manner of following the sense faculties.

original: 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: Where is this taught?

original: yid kyi shes pa rang dbang ni zhes smra ste /
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa rang dbang ni zhes smra ste /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind that is asserted to be omniscient. . . . ‚Äù

original: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It does not follow the sense faculties.

original: des na goms pa las gsal ba yin yang yid kyi shes pa de'i yul du thams cad 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na goms pa las gsal ba yin yang yid kyi shes pa de'i yul du thams cad 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is clear due to practice, not everything becomes the object of that mental consciousness.

original: de dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs pas na nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs pas na nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows the sense faculties, it has a definite object.

original: 'on lung la brten pa yin gyi rnam shes gsal ba las ni thams cad yul du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on lung la brten pa yin gyi rnam shes gsal ba las ni thams cad yul du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that it is based on scripture, then everything would become the object of clear consciousness.

original: lung la brten ba khas len na /
analyzed: lung la brten ba khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that it is based on scripture,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di thams cad kyi yul can ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di thams cad kyi yul can ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: then not only is this mental consciousness not the universal object of all,

original: 'khrul ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrul ba nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would also follow that it is mistaken.

original: phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to external objects.

original: lung gis ni khams gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i rigs mtha' dag ston pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lung gis ni khams gsum gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i rigs mtha' dag ston pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, scripture does not teach all the types of beings included in the three realms,

original: 'on kyang nye @41b bar mkho bas 'ba' zhig kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nye @41b bar mkho bas 'ba' zhig kho na yin no //
translated: but rather only what is necessary.

original: des na de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas goms pa las tshad ma'am /
analyzed: des na de la brten pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas goms pa las tshad ma'am /
translated: Therefore, how could the mental consciousness that is based on it generate the valid knowledge or

original: yul thams cad gsal ba nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
analyzed: yul thams cad gsal ba nyid ji ltar skyed par byed /
translated: the clarity of all objects through cultivation?

original: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness is also not the cause.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas thams cad bzung nas bsgom par 'gyur ba ni 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas thams cad bzung nas bsgom par 'gyur ba ni 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúBut it is not a mistake to cultivate having apprehended everything through inference,‚Äù

original: snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas /
analyzed: snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas /
translated: in order to dispel that doubt,

original: bzhi pas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: bzhi pas sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: the fourth line refutes it.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni rang nyid kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don grub ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni rang nyid kyi lkog tu gyur pa'i don grub ma yin te /
translated: Inference does not establish its own hidden object because

original: rtags med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: there is no reason. That is the meaning.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thams cad bsgrub pa'i rjes dpag med pa dang / thams cad kyi yul can gyi bsgom pa med pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thams cad bsgrub pa'i rjes dpag med pa dang / thams cad kyi yul can gyi bsgom pa med pas so //
translated: Therefore means because there is no inference that establishes everything and because there is no cultivation that has all objects.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang rgyu ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, inference is also not the cause.

original: de ltar rgyu mi dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa med pa pa nyid du bsgrubs nas mi bzod pas ci rung ba smros shig /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu mi dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa med pa pa nyid du bsgrubs nas mi bzod pas ci rung ba smros shig /
translated: Thus, having established that omniscience does not exist because its cause is not observed, state what is appropriate for an impatient person!

original: bstan bcos dang mtshon cha'i thabs dang / bzo la sogs pa dang / der rab kyi mthar thug pa'i blo can ni re zhig mthong ba yin pa de bzhin du don gzhan la yang 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang mtshon cha'i thabs dang / bzo la sogs pa dang / der rab kyi mthar thug pa'i blo can ni re zhig mthong ba yin pa de bzhin du don gzhan la yang 'gyur ba yin no snyam pa'i dogs pa sel bas /
translated: The treatise, the means of weapons, the means of arts, etc., and the one who is the best of the intelligent, are seen.üîΩThe response to that is:

original: des ni srid pa tsam yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: des ni srid pa tsam yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not even possible that they exist.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The treatise, etc.,

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: mthong ba'i bstan bcos la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bstan bcos la sogs pa ni /
translated: The treatise, etc., that are seen

original: ngo mtshar la sogs pas goms par byed pa srid pas blo rab tu 'gyur ba yang srid kyi ma mthong ba la re ba su yod /
analyzed: ngo mtshar la sogs pas goms par byed pa srid pas blo rab tu 'gyur ba yang srid kyi ma mthong ba la re ba su yod /
translated: are possible because of the cultivation of the amazing, etc., and it is possible that the mind is transformed. But who hopes for that which is not seen?üîΩThe response to that is:

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang de nges pa med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang de nges pa med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not even possible that they exist.‚Äù

original: de'i shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:üîΩThe treatise, etc., that are seenüîΩare possible because of the cultivation of the amazing, etc., and it is possible that the mind is transformed. But who hopes for that which is not seen?

original: de nges pa'i rgyu'i tshig kyang med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nges pa'i rgyu'i tshig kyang med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: There is also no statement of a cause for that.

original: gang zhig chags pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chags pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat which is attached‚Äù shows that.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: tshig rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rnam par rnam pa dang / 'brel pa yin la thams cad mkhyen pa ni khyed nyid kyis de dang bral bar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rnam par rnam pa dang / 'brel pa yin la thams cad mkhyen pa ni khyed nyid kyis de dang bral bar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Words are related to attachment, etc., and you yourself assert that the Omniscient One is free from that.

original: des na de la tshig srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de la tshig srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, words are not possible for him.

original: g-yar po ni brnyas pa ste /
analyzed: g-yar po ni brnyas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBorrowed‚Äù means ‚Äúdisparaged.‚Äù

original: des byas pa ni g-yar po'o //
analyzed: des byas pa ni g-yar po'o //
translated: That which is done by that is ‚Äúborrowed.‚Äù

original: des sam de brgyan pa'i de ltar byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des sam de brgyan pa'i de ltar byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no agent or knower who acts in that way or who adorns that,

original: med pa dang ma nges par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa dang ma nges par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: it is established that he is nonexistent and indeterminate.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa med kyang thams cad rig pa mi @42a * //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa med kyang thams cad rig pa mi @42a * //
translated: Even though there is no non-observation of a cause, it is not tenable that the Omniscient One knows everything.

original: 'thad do // de ltar rim gyis sam cig car thams cad shes par 'gyur na /üîΩde la re zhig rim gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'thad do // de ltar rim gyis sam cig car thams cad shes par 'gyur na / de la re zhig rim gyis ni ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If he knows everything gradually or instantaneously,üîΩfirst, he does not know gradually.

original: byung gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byung gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf he were to arise‚Äù shows that.

original: so sor zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: so sor zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Each means by the intrinsic reality of their own characteristics.

original: re res zhes bya ba ni gcig gcig go //
analyzed: re res zhes bya ba ni gcig gcig go //
translated: Each means one by one.

original: rgya mtsho la sogs pa re re nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya mtsho la sogs pa re re nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate each of the oceans, etc.,

original: de yongs su shes pa nyid yin la de bzhin du yang nges par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa nyid yin la de bzhin du yang nges par bya'o snyam na /
translated: if one thinks, that very thorough knowledge is just so, and should be ascertained,

original: phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa ni zhes smras te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa ni zhes smras te /
translated: he says, the thorough knowledge of one part,

original: tshig las phyogs gcig yongs su shes par rjes su dpog par ni sul med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: tshig las phyogs gcig yongs su shes par rjes su dpog par ni sul med pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te ;
translated: because from the words, the inference of the thorough knowledge of one part is without a flaw.

original: thams cad la yod pa lo na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa lo na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said, it is so in all cases, meaning that it is so in all cases.

original: 'on te gzhan la rnam pa de 'dra ba'i tshig med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la rnam pa de 'dra ba'i tshig med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that there is no such word in the other?

original: des na ji ltar phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa rjes su dpog ce na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa rjes su dpog ce na /
translated: Then how is the thorough knowledge of one part inferred?

original: skyes bu zhes smras so //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes smras so //
translated: He says, the person,

original: des na phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa yod pas thams cad thams cad rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa yod pas thams cad thams cad rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and so, because the thorough knowledge of one part exists, it is the thorough knowledge of all.

original: gal te bstan bcos la sogs pa gcig nyid goms par byed pa na /
analyzed: gal te bstan bcos la sogs pa gcig nyid goms par byed pa na /
translated: If one cultivates just one treatise,

original: 'don pa po rnams kyi shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'don pa po rnams kyi shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: is it not seen that the wisdom, intelligence, etc. of those who recite it are not different, i.e., are equal?

original: de bzhin du rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i shes pa yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i shes pa yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: In the same way, there would be the knowledge of one who has reached the highest perfection.

original: khyad par dang ldan pa zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúendowed with a special quality.‚Äù

original: shin tu zhes bya ba tshig phrad kyi tshogs ni lhags pa'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba tshig phrad kyi tshogs ni lhags pa'i don to //
translated: The collection of words ‚Äúvery‚Äù and ‚Äúmuch‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúabundant.‚Äù

original: 'on te phyogs gcig yongs su shes pas ni /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gcig yongs su shes pas ni /
translated: But if one knows one part,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: one is not omniscient.

original: 'on kyang phyogs gcig gi de kho na mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyogs gcig gi de kho na mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: However, it is because one has realized the reality of one part.

original: phyogs gcig de nyid ces smras so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig de nyid ces smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe reality of one part.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba phyogs gcig gi kho na shes pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba phyogs gcig gi kho na shes pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the knowledge of just one part.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ri rab la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ri rab la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn other places‚Äù refers to Mount Meru, etc., which are the cause of error.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yod pa la nges ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩcig car gyi phyogs la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa yod pa la nges ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // cig car gyi phyogs la brjod pa ni /
translated: because it does not generate certainty about the existence of the consciousness that is its subject.üîΩThe objection from the standpoint of simultaneity is stated in the following:

original: cig car zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cig car zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: don gang la shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i don de 'khor pa 'dir thog ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: don gang la shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i don de 'khor pa 'dir thog ma yin par brjod do //
translated: The object in regard to which the object of knowledge is complete is called the beginning of this cyclic existence.

original: 'di la don 'di yin te /üîΩgal te 'khor pa thog ma med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di la don 'di yin te / gal te 'khor pa thog ma med pa nyid yin na /
translated: The point of this is as follows.

original: de'i tshe thams cad @42b rig pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad @42b rig pa med do //
translated: If cyclic existence is beginningless, then all would be omniscient.

original: 'on te thams cad rig pa yod na de'i tshe rang gi gzhung las grub pa'i thog ma med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad rig pa yod na de'i tshe rang gi gzhung las grub pa'i thog ma med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if all were omniscient, then the beginninglessness established by your own scriptures would be undermined.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of the philosophical standpoint is as follows.

original: ci 'dra ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa la skyon 'di dag yod pa de 'dra ba ni bsgrub par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa la skyon 'di dag yod pa de 'dra ba ni bsgrub par mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not accept the establishment of an omniscient being who has these faults.

original: kho bo cag ni ngan 'gro dang 'khor bas 'jigs pas /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni ngan 'gro dang 'khor bas 'jigs pas /
translated: We are afraid of the lower realms and cyclic existence.

original: de spong ba la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nye bar ston pa po mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de spong ba la nye bar mkho ba'i dngos po thams cad yongs su shes pa'i nye bar ston pa po mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: and the one who teaches the complete knowledge of all the things necessary for the abandonment of that is the one who is truly desired.

original: de la ni 'di 'dra ba'i sun 'byin pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la ni 'di 'dra ba'i sun 'byin pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But in that case, there is no such refutation.

original: de la ni byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni byed pa po dang / shes par byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyang grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And in that case, the reason that proves the agent and the one who causes the knowledge is established.

original: thams cad thams cad rig pa rig pa'i phyogs la ni sun 'byin pa 'di dag yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad rig pa rig pa'i phyogs la ni sun 'byin pa 'di dag yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And later on, it will be shown that in the position of the one who knows everything, all things, these refutations do not exist.

original: nges bshad nan tan byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nges bshad nan tan byas pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the practice of the explanation

original: zhes bya ba de ni des bshad pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni des bshad pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of accomplishing what was explained by him.üîΩThe one who desires to accomplish the other

original: gzhan rjes su bsgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni thar pa la sogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su bsgrub par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni thar pa la sogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: is the path of liberation, and so on.üîΩThe knowledge of the other

original: gzhan shes pa zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan shes pa zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the number of the atoms of the ocean, and so on.

original: gang gi de'i nye bar ston pa brjod par 'gyur pa /üîΩde yongs su shes pa na gdon mi za bar thar pa'i shes pa grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de nges kyang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi de'i nye bar ston pa brjod par 'gyur pa / de yongs su shes pa na gdon mi za bar thar pa'i shes pa grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de nges kyang zhes bya ste /
translated: What is the point of teaching that?üîΩAnd when that is known, it is not necessarily the case that the knowledge of liberation is established.

original: grangs de las kyang de gdon mi za bar nges pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs de las kyang de gdon mi za bar nges pa ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But even if that is so, it is not tenable that liberation is necessarily known from that.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i grangs la sogs pa kho na shes ba bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni srin bu'i grangs la sogs pa kho na shes ba bya dgos so zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci yod /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of knowing the number of worms and so on?‚Äù

original: thams cad shes pa na mngon par 'dod pa yang shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa na mngon par 'dod pa yang shes par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: When everything is known, the desired object is also known.

original: sun 'byin pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste nges pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste nges pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo, it is not so,‚Äù that is, it is not definite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: srin bu'i grangs la sogs pa thams cad du 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pas shes pa ste /
analyzed: srin bu'i grangs la sogs pa thams cad du 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pas shes pa ste /
translated: Because there is no definite knowledge of everything, such as the number of worms and so on.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir te rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir te rtags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no definite knowledge because there is no evidence.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means ‚Äújust that.‚Äù

original: shes par bya ba ni gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i don du shes par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: shes par bya ba ni gzhan la nye bar bstan pa'i don du shes par 'os pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be known‚Äù means to be known by others, to be an object to be taught.

original: gal te ston pa po la 'dod pa'i shes pa yod mod /
analyzed: gal te ston pa po la 'dod pa'i shes pa yod mod /
translated: If the teacher has the desire to know,

original: 'di tshad ma gang gi tshe yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma gang gi tshe yin zhe na /
translated: at what time is this a valid cognition?

original: gal te de shes pa na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te de shes pa na zhes smos so //
translated: If he says ‚Äúwhen he knows that,‚Äù

original: de las de nye bar ston pa po'i thad nas @43a * //
analyzed: de las de nye bar ston pa po'i thad nas @43a * //
translated: then from the teacher‚Äôs perspective

original: mi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis de'i tshe de'i yul gyis shes ba shes pas na ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis de'i tshe de'i yul gyis shes ba shes pas na ste /
translated: those who do not know that at that time know it through the object of his knowledge.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yongs su shes bas na 'di mi shes pa rnams kyi tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yongs su shes bas na 'di mi shes pa rnams kyi tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: Through the knowledge of the object of his desire to know, this is a valid cognition for those who do not know.

original: gal te de ltar shes na gdul bya rnams kyi tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te de ltar shes na gdul bya rnams kyi tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he knows in that way, it is a valid cognition for the disciples. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFor others‚Äù means for the number of atoms and so on.

original: gal te 'di mngon par 'dod pa tsam rig pas tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mngon par 'dod pa tsam rig pas tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the valid cognition is the awareness of mere what is desired,

original: de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa rig pa gzhan dag kyang tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mngon par 'dod pa rig pa gzhan dag kyang tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: then at that time, the awareness of what is desired would be valid cognition.

original: skyes bu'i don gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyis zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúpurpose‚Äù is stated.

original: skyes bu'i don gyis gtso bo shes pa zhes bya bas ni byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub bya shes ba brjod do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyis gtso bo shes pa zhes bya bas ni byang grol gyi mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub bya shes ba brjod do //
translated: The awareness of the principal purpose is stated by the phrase ‚Äúfor the sake of a person.‚ÄùüîΩThe awareness of reality, which is the general characteristic of all that is purified by valid cognition, such as momentariness, selflessness, and so on, is stated by the phrase ‚Äúthe awareness of reality.‚Äù

original: skad cig 'jig pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa tshad mas yongs su dag pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i de kho na shes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang grol gyi lam de kho na yongs su shes pa brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa tshad mas yongs su dag pa thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i de kho na shes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni byang grol gyi lam de kho na yongs su shes pa brjod do //
translated: This expresses the complete knowledge of the path to liberation and omniscience.

original: de nyid tshad ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid tshad ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat alone is valid cognition‚Äù means that the awareness of mere what is desired is not valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa kho na tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta bur gyur pa kho na tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only that which is like that is valid cognition?

original: 'di de tsam gyi zhes bya ba skyes bu'i don dang tshad mas yongs su dag pa thams cad kyi de kho na yongs su shes pa tsam gyis nye bar brten par bya ba yin gyi sa'i dbyibs la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa tsam shes pas ni ma
analyzed: 'di de tsam gyi zhes bya ba skyes bu'i don dang tshad mas yongs su dag pa thams cad kyi de kho na yongs su shes pa tsam gyis nye bar brten par bya ba yin gyi sa'i dbyibs la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa tsam shes pas ni ma
translated: This is the extent of it means that it is to be relied upon merely by knowing the reality of all the purposes of a person and of valid cognition. It is not by merely knowing the shape of the earth, etc., which are merely desired.

original: yin no // lhag ma zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam shes pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // lhag ma zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa tsam shes pa'o //
translated: The remainder is the knowledge of what is merely desired.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo dang ; tshad mas yongs su dag pas thams cad kyi de kho na dag shes par byed pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo dang ; tshad mas yongs su dag pas thams cad kyi de kho na dag shes par byed pa kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, valid cognition is that which causes the knowledge of the reality of all the primary purposes of a person and of valid cognition.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis shes pa nyid do //
translated: And that means the knowledge of the two.

original: gang la srid ce na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang la srid ce na zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: The question is Where is it possible?

original: lan ni gang gis nye bar bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gang gis nye bar bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is By what is indicated.

original: tshig med par ni gzhan gyis yongs su shes pa'i spyod yul nges par bzung ba la yang dag pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig med par ni gzhan gyis yongs su shes pa'i spyod yul nges par bzung ba la yang dag pa'i thabs gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without words, there is no other means to ascertain the object of knowledge of others.

original: tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don de kho na'o //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don de kho na'o //
translated: The seeing by means of a valid cognition is the only purpose of the world.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other is the shape of the world, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa de la yang @43b mi shes pa zhes bya ba mngon du ma byas pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa de la yang @43b mi shes pa zhes bya ba mngon du ma byas pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in regard to the shape of the world, etc., it is possible that there is ignorance, i.e., non-manifestation.

original: med ba'i blo gang la yod ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: med ba'i blo gang la yod ba ni med pa'o //
translated: The cognition of non-existence is that which exists in regard to non-existence.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni thar pa la sogs pa'i lam la yang ste /
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni thar pa la sogs pa'i lam la yang ste /
translated: In all, i.e., in the path of liberation, etc.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su shes pa ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is admitted that there is no complete knowledge of all the aspects of entities.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la yang ngo //üîΩ'di la yang zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i lam la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la yang ngo // 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i lam la yang ngo //
translated: In others, i.e., in the Lord.üîΩIn this, i.e., in the path of liberation.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning in the philosophical system.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i de kho na dang / rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i gzhal bya la ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod par nges dpa'i phyir de dag nye bar ston pa brgyud pa nyid skyabs yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i de kho na dang / rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i gzhal bya la ni tshad ma'i gnod pa yod par nges dpa'i phyir de dag nye bar ston pa brgyud pa nyid skyabs yin no //
translated: But in regard to the objects of knowledge such as permanence, etc., and substance, quality, etc., the objection of the valid cognition is certain, therefore, the teaching of that is itself the refuge.

original: des na 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa la yang de nyid dogs par bya ba yin no //üîΩbcom ldan 'das la ni gal te dngos po thams cad yongs su shes par the tshom zar bcug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i de kho na dang / gzhal bya'i spyi phung po lnga la sogs pa la tshad ma grub pa'i stobs kyis gzhal bya'i khyad par 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa la yang de nyid dogs par bya ba yin no // bcom ldan 'das la ni gal te dngos po thams cad yongs su shes par the tshom zar bcug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i de kho na dang / gzhal bya'i spyi phung po lnga la sogs pa la tshad ma grub pa'i stobs kyis gzhal bya'i khyad par 'jig rten gyi dbyibs la sogs pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the shape of the world, etc., should be doubted.

original: rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa srid pa mi 'gal te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi grangs la sogs pa yongs su shes pa srid pa mi 'gal te /
translated: But in regard to the Lord, even if one were to doubt that he knows all things, it is not contradictory that he knows the particular objects of knowledge such as the shape of the world, etc., and the number of atoms, etc., by the power of the valid cognition that establishes the general object of knowledge such as the five aggregates, etc., and the reality of selflessness, etc.

original: gtso bo'i don mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i don mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the primary object is not deceived.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the Lord is the authority.

original: dngos po ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The thing is the teaching of momentariness, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni tshad mas yongs su dpyad pa la'o //
translated: There means in the investigation by the authority.

original: ma shes pa yin par dogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa po ma shes pa yin par dogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma shes pa yin par dogs pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa po ma shes pa yin par dogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The doubt that he does not know means the doubt that the teacher does not know.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ste de la nye bar ston pa po yongs su shes pa po yin par nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ste de la nye bar ston pa po yongs su shes pa po yin par nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How? means the negation, which means that it is certain that the teacher knows.

original: 'di la shes pa yin par ma nges kyang ston pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ston pa ni de la nye bar ston pa po ma shes pa yin par dogs su chug pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di la shes pa yin par ma nges kyang ston pa ma yin no zhes bya bar ston pa ni de la nye bar ston pa po ma shes pa yin par dogs su chug pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: To show that even though he is not certain that he knows, he is not a teacher, it is connected with Let us suppose that the teacher is doubted to not know.

original: ma shes pa yin par dogs pa de lta na yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de la'o //
analyzed: ma shes pa yin par dogs pa de lta na yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de la'o //
translated: Even though there is doubt that he does not know, it is in regard to that impermanence, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why? he says.

original: tshad mas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: tshad mas zhes gsungs te /
translated: By the authority, he says.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la ni 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la ni 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one does not engage in the teaching of permanence, etc. by another.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //üîΩgal te de skad cig ma nyid la @44a * //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o // gal te de skad cig ma nyid la @44a * //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: sogs pa nye bar bstan pa tshad mas mthong du chug pa de lta na yang nye bar ston pa po la de mngon du byed pa yod do zhes bya ba ni nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa nye bar bstan pa tshad mas mthong du chug pa de lta na yang nye bar ston pa po la de mngon du byed pa yod do zhes bya ba ni nges pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú If one grants that the teaching of momentariness, etc. is seen by a valid cognition, even so, it is not certain that the teacher has that realization,üîΩbecause his teaching could be like the writing of a worm.‚Äù

original: de'i nye bar bstan pa ni srin bu'i yi ge bzhin du 'gyur srid pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i nye bar bstan pa ni srin bu'i yi ge bzhin du 'gyur srid pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: To this, the reply is set forth:

original: 'di la / shes pa yongs su dag med par //
analyzed: 'di la / shes pa yongs su dag med par //
translated: Without a completely pure cognition,

original: brjod pa yongs su dag pa med //
analyzed: brjod pa yongs su dag pa med //
translated: there is no completely pure expression.

original: ces 'chad par gyur pa'i lan bzhag ste gzhan gsungs pa ni de ni 'dir 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces 'chad par gyur pa'i lan bzhag ste gzhan gsungs pa ni de ni 'dir 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other reply is stated: ‚ÄúThis is the case here,‚Äù etc.

original: tshad mas mthong ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú What is seen by a valid cognition‚Äù

original: ston pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äúthe teacher.‚Äù

original: zhi bas lha zhes pa skyes pa gang gis so //
analyzed: zhi bas lha zhes pa skyes pa gang gis so //
translated: The word god refers to a man.

original: gzhan de'o // khyab 'jug dang / bde byed dang / dbyig gis snying po la sogs pa'i mu steg pa dag la yongs su shes pa btsir yang ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan de'o // khyab 'jug dang / bde byed dang / dbyig gis snying po la sogs pa'i mu steg pa dag la yongs su shes pa btsir yang ci yod /
translated: What is the use of pressing the heretics, such as Visnu, Brahma, and Dhanvantari, etc., to know the rest?

original: de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de med pa kho na'o //
translated: They do not have it.

original: de dag la ni khyad par du yang yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la ni khyad par du yang yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not have it, especially.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o ;
translated: Therefore is a conclusion.

original: / gal te yang bcom ldan 'das dang gzhan la mngon du byed par the tshom za ba khyad par med pa de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: / gal te yang bcom ldan 'das dang gzhan la mngon du byed par the tshom za ba khyad par med pa de lta na yang bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma yin te /
translated: Even if there is doubt about the difference between the Lord and others in being manifest, still the Lord alone is authoritative,

original: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has declared the meaning of the scriptures with authority.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Others are not, because they are the opposite. This is the difference.

original: 'o na da ni gang gis bsten par bya bar 'gyur ba 'di las 'bras bu lhag pa ci zhig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: 'o na da ni gang gis bsten par bya bar 'gyur ba 'di las 'bras bu lhag pa ci zhig 'thob ce na /
translated: Now, what is the special result obtained from this, which should be relied upon?

original: bden te / byas pa shes pas sam /
analyzed: bden te / byas pa shes pas sam /
translated: True, but they are not in error, because they know what has been done,

original: bsod nams mngon par 'dod pas yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'dod pas yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: or because they desire to manifest merit.

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúheavenly path‚Äù is a summary.

original: gal te mtho ris kyi lam la chad ma'i byed pa med pa de lta na yang de yongs su shes pa srid pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mtho ris kyi lam la chad ma'i byed pa med pa de lta na yang de yongs su shes pa srid pa bstan pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even though the heavenly path is not the function of the Buddha, it is possible to teach the knowledge of that path.üîΩEven though the other measurements, such as the size of a drop, are not known, it is possible to know the heavenly path, etc.

original: thigs pa'i tshad la sogs pa gzhan ni yongs su shes pa med kyang bcom ldan 'das de'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i lam shes pa de ni srid pa yin no //
analyzed: thigs pa'i tshad la sogs pa gzhan ni yongs su shes pa med kyang bcom ldan 'das de'i mtho ris la sogs pa'i lam shes pa de ni srid pa yin no //
translated: of the Lord.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i mi tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i ye shes ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel lo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i mi tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i ye shes ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel lo //
translated: Since that is so, the knowledge of the Lord is not a means of knowing the size of a drop, etc.

original: chos kyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid dam /
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid dam /
translated: The knowledge of the reality of things,

original: blang bya dang spang bya'am /
analyzed: blang bya dang spang bya'am /
translated: or of what is to be accepted or rejected,

original: mngon par mtho ba'i sgrub byed shes pa ni chos mkhyen no //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i sgrub byed shes pa ni chos mkhyen no //
translated: or of the means of achieving high status, is knowledge of phenomena.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni sbas pa shes pa la sogs pa'o de nyid kyi phyir thams cad thams @44b cad rig pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon ni khas ma blangs pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni sbas pa shes pa la sogs pa'o de nyid kyi phyir thams cad thams @44b cad rig pa'i phyogs la brjod pa'i skyon ni khas ma blangs pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The all refers to the knowledge of the hidden and so on. For this very reason, the fault stated in the position of knowing all things is removed by the fact that it is not accepted.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rigs byed pa po'i thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa gcig nyid du rnam par gnas par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rigs byed pa po'i thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa gcig nyid du rnam par gnas par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the fault of the regress of the creator of the reasoning would occur. The meaning is that it would not be established that the omniscient one is a single entity.

original: de lta yin pa la nyes pa brjod pa ni de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin pa la nyes pa brjod pa ni de ltar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te zhes bya'o //
translated: The statement of the fault in that case is But that is not so.

original: grub pa'i mtha' thams cad ces skabs su bab pa phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin te gang su yang rung ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' thams cad ces skabs su bab pa phyogs gcig gi khyad par yin te gang su yang rung ste /
translated: All philosophical systems is a particular of one part of the context. Whoever is suitable,

original: shes bya'i phyogs gcig rig par byed pa de thams cad ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes bya'i phyogs gcig rig par byed pa de thams cad ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that whatever is a knower of one part of the object of knowledge is a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du dogs pa sel bas rnam 'grel rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin snyam du dogs pa sel bas rnam 'grel rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: To remove the doubt of why that is not so, the commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava states,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor what reason?‚Äù

original: blang ba dang dor ba la phyogs gcig nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba la phyogs gcig nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that there is only one side to accepting and rejecting,

original: skyes bu'i don gyis mtshan nyid phyogs gcig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyis mtshan nyid phyogs gcig ces gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúOne side of the characteristics of human goals.‚Äù

original: dgag pa ni 'phen pa'i don nam chung ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa ni 'phen pa'i don nam chung ba'i don to //
translated: The negative is for the purpose of exclusion or for the purpose of emphasis.

original: gang la skyes bu'i don tsam med par blang bya dang dor bya'i de kho na nyid de yang gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: gang la skyes bu'i don tsam med par blang bya dang dor bya'i de kho na nyid de yang gang yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is that reality which is to be accepted and rejected, without which there is no human goal?‚Äù

original: de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that regard.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i rgyu dang / 'khor ba zhi ba dang zhi ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i rgyu dang / 'khor ba zhi ba dang zhi ba'i thabs bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the suffering of cyclic existence, its cause, the peace of cyclic existence, and the means of achieving that peace.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brjod pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i thabs dang de 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu brjod pa ni rab tu zhi ba'i thabs dang de 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the statement of the cause of suffering is for the purpose of teaching the means of achieving peace and for the purpose of teaching what is incompatible with it.

original: des na skyes bu'i don mchog bstan to //
analyzed: des na skyes bu'i don mchog bstan to //
translated: Thus, the supreme human goal is taught.

original: de bas ni mngon par mtho ba dman la /
analyzed: de bas ni mngon par mtho ba dman la /
translated: Therefore, the higher realms are inferior,

original: de bas kyang ches 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dman pa'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang ches 'jig rten 'di'i bde ba dman pa'o //
translated: and even more inferior is the happiness of this world.

original: de la dang po la ni tshad ma'i byed pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dang po la ni tshad ma'i byed pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The first is the presentation of the function of valid cognition.

original: gnyis pa la tshul ji ltar 'gyur snyam na mtho ris kyi lam yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la tshul ji ltar 'gyur snyam na mtho ris kyi lam yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The second is the presentation of the path to heaven.

original: gang zhig tshad mas gcod par srid pa de gang gis rig par byed pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: gang zhig tshad mas gcod par srid pa de gang gis rig par byed pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes 'brel te /
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: Whatever is possible to be ascertained by valid cognition, that which makes it known is valid cognition.

original: tshad ma srid par brjod pa ni yod par lhag par mos pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma srid par brjod pa ni yod par lhag par mos pa'i don du yin no //
translated: The statement that valid cognition is possible is for the purpose of generating belief in its existence.

original: dngos po yod pa kho na las 'ga' zhig gi tshe tshad ma rnyed par srid kyi med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa kho na las 'ga' zhig gi tshe tshad ma rnyed par srid kyi med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: Valid cognition is possible only in regard to existent things, not nonexistent things.

original: yod par yid ches pa de yang skyes bu'i don mchog tu 'gyur ba nges par legs pa'i yan lag la bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' slu ba med par mthong ba las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par yid ches pa de yang skyes bu'i don mchog tu 'gyur ba nges par legs pa'i yan lag la bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' slu ba med par mthong ba las 'gyur ro //
translated: That belief in existence is generated from seeing the infallible word of the BhagavƒÅn, which is a limb of the definite goodness that is the highest human aim.

original: gal te 'jig rten 'di pa yang 'bras bur 'dod pa ma yin nam /üîΩbcom @45a * //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten 'di pa yang 'bras bur 'dod pa ma yin nam / bcom @45a * //
translated: But isn‚Äôt worldly happiness also accepted as a result?

original: ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de med pa yin nam ci zhe na /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de med pa yin nam ci zhe na /
translated: Is it not the case that the BhagavƒÅn taught that?

original: bud med dang dmangs rigs zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bud med dang dmangs rigs zhes gsungs te /
translated: and woman and outcaste.

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang mi ldan pa mtshon ba lhur byed pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang mi ldan pa mtshon ba lhur byed pa tsam mo //
translated: It is merely an indication of the lack of analysis.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dug sel ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni dug sel ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And also means such things as the removal of poison.

original: med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir na 'di ni 'dod rgyal du yang bya'o //
analyzed: med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir na 'di ni 'dod rgyal du yang bya'o //
translated: By not nonexistent he excludes non-possession, and so this is also not accidental.

original: 'bras bu snga ma dag kho na la 'bad ltos nas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga ma dag kho na la 'bad ltos nas so //
translated: It is in dependence on the previous results that one strives.

original: gang phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rigs pa bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rigs pa bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: It is in order to show that one should practice reasoning, the principal human goal.

original: zhi'i sgra ni khyad par la ltos nas so //
analyzed: zhi'i sgra ni khyad par la ltos nas so //
translated: The word peace is used in dependence on a distinction.

original: gang phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rigs pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rigs pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'thad pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that reasoning, the principal human goal, is not a valid cognition, therefore, etc.

original: ae ta zhes bya ba ni tshur shog cig pa'o //
analyzed: ae ta zhes bya ba ni tshur shog cig pa'o //
translated: The word eta means come here.

original: ring po mthong ba nyid las thams cad mthong bar grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ring po mthong ba nyid las thams cad mthong bar grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it established that one sees everything by seeing just one thing?

original: des na khyed ji ltar ring po mthong ba la mi rtsi snyam na /
analyzed: des na khyed ji ltar ring po mthong ba la mi rtsi snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how can you not accept that it sees long?

original: ring po mthong pa yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ring po mthong pa yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it sees long.

original: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te ring po mthong bas thams cad rig par 'grub na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te ring po mthong bas thams cad rig par 'grub na /
translated: If it is like that, that is, if it is established that it sees long and it sees everything,

original: de'i tshe bya rgod la sogs pa yang thams cad rig pa de yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bya rgod la sogs pa yang thams cad rig pa de yin te /
translated: then a vulture and so on would also be omniscient,

original: ring po mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring po mthong ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it sees long.

original: thams cad shes so snyam pa'i blo ni thams cad shes pa'i shes bya shes pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad shes so snyam pa'i blo ni thams cad shes pa'i shes bya shes pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The cognition that thinks I know everything arises from the knowledge of the object of omniscience.

original: thams cad shes pa'i shes bya ma shes na ni 'dis thams cad shes so zhes bya ba 'di la bdag cag la thabs yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa'i shes bya ma shes na ni 'dis thams cad shes so zhes bya ba 'di la bdag cag la thabs yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If the object of omniscience is not known, then it is impossible for us to say I know everything.

original: gzhal bya'i phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa las kyang mtha' dag shes pa nyid du srid pa yang bdag cag la med do zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩde yi phyogs gcig rnam shes pas //
analyzed: gzhal bya'i phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa las kyang mtha' dag shes pa nyid du srid pa yang bdag cag la med do zhes bshad pa ni / de yi phyogs gcig rnam shes pas //
translated: It is also impossible for us to say that one who knows one part of the object of knowledge knows everything.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to that is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause it is impossible to know one part of that.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is stated in the line ‚Äúbecause it is impossible to know one part of that.‚Äù

original: shes bya mang po de'i phyogs gcig shes par gyur pas rnam shes zhes bya ba srid pa'i ming can shes bya gzhan thams cad kyi yul can ni de'i shes bya nyid la ste /
analyzed: shes bya mang po de'i phyogs gcig shes par gyur pas rnam shes zhes bya ba srid pa'i ming can shes bya gzhan thams cad kyi yul can ni de'i shes bya nyid la ste /
translated: Since one part of that multitude of objects of knowledge is known, the consciousness is called ‚Äúpossessing the name of existence.‚Äù The subject of all other objects of knowledge is its object of knowledge.

original: ring po mthong ba'i shes pa can nyid la 'grub pa yin gyi bdag cag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ring po mthong ba'i shes pa can nyid la 'grub pa yin gyi bdag cag la ni ma yin no //
translated: The one who has the consciousness that sees a long object is established in that, but not in us.

original: 'grel pa ni bud med dang bzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni bud med dang bzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary is ‚Äúwoman,‚Äù etc.

original: gal te de shes na shing la sogs pa nyid shes par 'gyur mod gzhan dang 'brel pa'i de shes pa go ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te de shes na shing la sogs pa nyid shes par 'gyur mod gzhan dang 'brel pa'i de shes pa go ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: If that is known, then indeed wood, etc. are known. But how is the knowledge of that which is related to another understood?

original: shing la sogs pa ni gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par can du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa ni gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khyad par can du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because wood, etc. are understood as the special consciousness related to another.

original: gzhan du na 'di 'dis rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes sngar @45b brjod zin to //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di 'dis rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes sngar @45b brjod zin to //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be said ‚Äúthis is understood by that.‚Äù This was said before.

original: 'di nyid bshad pas ni rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pas ni rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By explaining this, it is said ‚Äúby itself.‚Äù

original: phyed phyi ma 'grel ba ni gzigs pa ring du song ba'i chen po gang yin pa ste sh'ari'i bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'grel ba ni gzigs pa ring du song ba'i chen po gang yin pa ste sh'ari'i bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great ones who have gone far in their vision are ≈öƒÅriputra and so on.

original: gzigs ba ring du song bas zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa'i khyad par can /
analyzed: gzigs ba ring du song bas zhes bya bas ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa'i khyad par can /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving gone far in their vision‚Äù indicates the special knowledge of the Blessed One.
