original: shes bya'i phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: shes bya'i phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan to //
translated: It shows the reason for knowing one part of the knowable.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mtha' dag mkhyen pa srid par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa'i khyad par can gyi phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mtha' dag mkhyen pa srid par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen pa'i khyad par can gyi phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin gyi /
translated: That the Blessed One has the knowledge of all things is understood from the fact that he knows one part of the knowable.

original: de dag gis kyang don dam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang don dam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not understand ultimate omniscience.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid chen po rgya chen po ni rig la zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid chen po rgya chen po ni rig la zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is why it is said that the great beings have knowledge of the vast.

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa de dag gi yang thams cad shes pa nyid de nyid srid pa de yang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa de dag gi yang thams cad shes pa nyid de nyid srid pa de yang /
translated: And the existence of that very state of omniscience of Sariputra and the others

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa bas dman pa gzhan gyis yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa bas dman pa gzhan gyis yin no //
translated: is inferior to that of others.

original: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni nye bar mkho ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni nye bar mkho ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of both is the characteristic of the necessary omniscience and the omniscience of the Buddha.

original: gal te thams cad thams cad rig pa nyid spangs pa kho na ma yin nam 'di'i rgyu btsal bas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad thams cad rig pa nyid spangs pa kho na ma yin nam 'di'i rgyu btsal bas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If it is not the case that everything is abandoned by the state of omniscience, what is the use of seeking the cause of that?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: de 'dra ba bla na med pa'i yon tan can la mi 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba bla na med pa'i yon tan can la mi 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no desire for such a state of unsurpassed qualities.

original: 'on kyang de nges pa tsam spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nges pa tsam spangs pa yin no //
translated: However, that is merely the abandonment of certainty.

original: dper na phyogs dang po la tshad ma sa mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i nye bar bstan pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na phyogs dang po la tshad ma sa mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i nye bar bstan pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, in the first case, there is a cause for the ascertainment of the non-deceptive valid cognition that is taught,

original: rdul phra rab so sor rig pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab so sor rig pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for the individual awareness of atoms.

original: gal te don thams cad nye bar ston pa mi slu ba dang ldan pa yod na ni phyogs dang po la ji lta bar 'di nyid rgyu srid pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te don thams cad nye bar ston pa mi slu ba dang ldan pa yod na ni phyogs dang po la ji lta bar 'di nyid rgyu srid pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If there were an omniscient being who nondeceptively revealed all objects, then just as in the first case, this would be the cause.

original: sgrub pa gang las yin te rgyu med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir grub pa skyes pa gang las yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa gang las yin te rgyu med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa khas ma blangs pa'i phyir grub pa skyes pa gang las yin te /
translated: What is the proof? What is the established fact? Because you do not accept an omniscient being without a cause.

original: rgyu gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam tha dad par zad kyi so sor don gnyis nye bar bzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam tha dad par zad kyi so sor don gnyis nye bar bzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: What is the cause? This is just a verbal distinction; it does not refer to two different objects.

original: rnam 'grel gyi cha la 'di ltar ram 'di ltar yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi cha la 'di ltar ram 'di ltar yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Commentary on the first chapter of the Prajfiiimula says, ‚ÄúIt is to be interpreted in this way or that way.‚Äù

original: dri ba dang po la lan du /üîΩsgrub byed thugs rje goms pa las //
analyzed: dri ba dang po la lan du / sgrub byed thugs rje goms pa las //
translated: In response to the first question,üîΩthe root text says,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe proof is the cultivation of compassion.‚Äù

original: tshad ma grub pa ni thugs rje goms pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa ni thugs rje goms pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The establishment of valid cognition comes from the cultivation of compassion.

original: de zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni thugs rje'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to compassion.

original: blo lus te blo'i @46a * //
analyzed: blo lus te blo'i @46a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind‚Äù is the body of the mind.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de la brten pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de la brten pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs 'thob pa yin no //
translated: Because it is based on that nature, one attains the desired state.

original: 'di ni 'dri ba dang po nyid kyi lan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas na 'chad ba ni tshad ma de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dri ba dang po nyid kyi lan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas na 'chad ba ni tshad ma de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it clarifies that this is the answer to the first question, the commentary says, The answer to the question about the valid knowledge of that.

original: goms pa'i yan lag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i yan lag dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: Together with the branch of cultivation means together with cultivation.

original: 'dri ba gnyis pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba gnyis pa la yang lan 'di nyid yin no //
translated: This is also the answer to the second question.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed ni rgyu ste /
translated: Or means the proof is the cause.

original: skabs kyis na tshad ma'i yin no //
analyzed: skabs kyis na tshad ma'i yin no //
translated: In the context, it is the valid knowledge.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes so //
translated: Therefore means through compassion.

original: thugs rje tsam gyi gzhan gyi don ston pas gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rje tsam gyi gzhan gyi don ston pas gzhan la tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it shows the purpose of others through mere compassion, it becomes valid knowledge for others. The explanation of this is The compassionate one.

original: thabs ni gzhan gyi don ston pa'i thabs la'o //
analyzed: thabs ni gzhan gyi don ston pa'i thabs la'o //
translated: Skill means in the method of teaching the purpose of others.

original: thabs de yang rang nyid tshad mar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang nyid shes bya thams cad la mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid du grub pa ste /
analyzed: thabs de yang rang nyid tshad mar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang nyid shes bya thams cad la mngon sum gyi rang bzhin nyid du grub pa ste /
translated: The method is the establishment of oneself as an authority.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúperfection of one‚Äôs own aim‚Äù is the establishment of oneself as having the nature of direct perception with respect to all objects of knowledge.

original: thugs rje de nyid ces bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i gnas kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thugs rje de nyid ces bya ba ni brjod par 'dod pa'i gnas kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat compassion itself‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúthe basis that is desired to be expressed.‚Äù

original: thams cad shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not omniscience‚Äù means

original: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: that it is not the omniscience that is desired to be known.

original: de'i thabs goms pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs goms pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs goms pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs goms pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cultivation of the method of that‚Äù is the cultivation of the method of omniscience.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshu rol mdzes pa pa phyir zlog pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshu rol mdzes pa pa phyir zlog pa byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù and so on is the response to the CƒÅrvƒÅka.

original: gang gi lus med pas goms pa mi 'grub pa /
analyzed: gang gi lus med pas goms pa mi 'grub pa /
translated: Since it has no body, how can it be cultivated?

original: blo lus la brten pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: blo lus la brten pa yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How can the mind, which is based on the body, be cultivated?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is the response.

original: lus kyi bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yang rang bzhin can la brten pa zhes brjod par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: lus kyi bdag nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin yang rang bzhin can la brten pa zhes brjod par 'dod pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe body itself‚Äù is intended to mean ‚Äúthe nature itself.‚Äù

original: yon tan ni chos so //
analyzed: yon tan ni chos so //
translated: ‚Äú Qualities‚Äù means ‚Äúattributes.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni gnas pa nyid rnam pa gsum du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas pa nyid rnam pa gsum du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the three types of endurance.üîΩThe author of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika says this in response to the CƒÅrvƒÅka‚Äôs

original: gang gi phyir tshu rol mdzes pa pa de ltar rtsod pa de'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad ba ni'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshu rol mdzes pa pa de ltar rtsod pa de'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas bshad ba ni'o //
translated: argument.

original: de la bshad pa dang po'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: de la bshad pa dang po'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the first of these explanations,

original: blo ni lus la brten phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten phyir ro //
translated: the mind is dependent on the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa gnyis ka la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa gnyis ka la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied to both of the two different meanings.

original: gnyis pa la ni phyi ma kho na dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //üîΩphyogs snga ma'i cha ni rnam par bkral zin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni phyi ma kho na dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro // phyogs snga ma'i cha ni rnam par bkral zin pa'i phyir na /
translated: In the second, it is only the latter that is the distinction.üîΩSince the first part of the opponent‚Äôs position has already been explained,

original: grub ba'i mtha'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni snga ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub ba'i mtha'i cha rnam par 'grel ba ni snga ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the part of the conclusion that is to be explained is ‚Äúthe former.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni blo ni phyi ma la rgyu nyid kyis @46b khyad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni blo ni phyi ma la rgyu nyid kyis @46b khyad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubsequent‚Äù means that the mind is subsequent because it is the cause of the later.

original: rjes su 'gro ba yang yin la blo yang yin zhes bya ba nas phyis snga ma yang 'di yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yang yin la blo yang yin zhes bya ba nas phyis snga ma yang 'di yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It is both subsequent and a mind, and so on, up to ‚Äúit is also the earlier.‚Äù

original: lus 'ba' zhig blo'i rten yin pa gang yin pa de bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'ba' zhig blo'i rten yin pa gang yin pa de bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the refutation of the idea that the body alone is the basis of the mind.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin nyid du gyur pa yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means that it is the nature itself.

original: gzhan dag 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi phyogs sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi phyogs sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir gal te zhes brjod do //
translated: Others say ‚Äúif‚Äù in order to connect the result and the nature.

original: lus la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la yang brten pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir na lus kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin la yang brten pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir na lus kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBased on the body‚Äù means that it is also based on the nature, and the meaning is that it is the nature of the body.

original: ci ltar lus la brten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar lus la brten pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it based on the body?

original: pha ma'i lus la brten par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pha ma'i lus la brten par zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said to be based on the body of the parents.

original: gzugs dang / kun du spyod pa dang / sems gsal ba dang / stsogs pa'i sgras so sor nges ba'i dngos po'i sred pa la sogs pa de ni pha ma de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba ste rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / kun du spyod pa dang / sems gsal ba dang / stsogs pa'i sgras so sor nges ba'i dngos po'i sred pa la sogs pa de ni pha ma de dag gi rjes su 'gro ba ste rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The form, the conduct, the clarity of mind, and so on, of the child who is born is in conformity with, i.e., follows, the form, the conduct, and the clarity of mind, etc. of the parents.

original: bskyed par bya ba lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi phyogs so ;
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi phyogs so ;
translated: The body is what is to be produced.

original: / gnyi ga la dpe ri mo'o //
analyzed: / gnyi ga la dpe ri mo'o //
translated: The example for both is a painting.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni du ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to smoke, etc.

original: ri mo byed pa'i gzugs 'dri ba la bzo bo'i shes pa ni gzugs shes pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo byed pa'i gzugs 'dri ba la bzo bo'i shes pa ni gzugs shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of the painter is the consciousness of form.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mdog la sogs pa'i shes bas te de'i rjes su 'gro ba can no //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni mdog la sogs pa'i shes bas te de'i rjes su 'gro ba can no //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the consciousness of color, etc.

original: ci ltar gnyi ga'i dpe yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar gnyi ga'i dpe yin snyam na /
translated: How is it an example for both?

original: smras pa rtsig pa la brten pa ste rtsig pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩde la 'jig rten 'di'i lus ni /
analyzed: smras pa rtsig pa la brten pa ste rtsig pa'i rang bzhin no // de la 'jig rten 'di'i lus ni /
translated: It is said: It is based on the wall, i.e., it is of the nature of the wall.

original: rtsig pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa lta bu yin no //
translated: In this example, the body of this world is like the wall.

original: pha ma ni ri mo byed pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: pha ma ni ri mo byed pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The parents are like the painter.

original: dpe dang mthun pa lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dpe dang mthun pa lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The remaining examples are easy to understand.

original: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i phyogs gnyis nyid yin yang dpe gzhan gyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i phyogs gnyis nyid yin yang dpe gzhan gyis bstan pa ni /
translated: Although the two sides of the example are the nature and the effect, another example is taught.

original: yang na aa mra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na aa mra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, like the mango, etc.

original: rtsig pa la ni ri mo'i rang bzhin nyid rtsol ba las ltos pa yin gyi aa mra la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la ni ri mo'i rang bzhin nyid rtsol ba las ltos pa yin gyi aa mra la ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the painting on the wall depends on the effort, but not the mango.

original: de bzhin rtsig pa la ni pha'i gnas lta bu'i ri mo mkhan gzhan kho na las ri mo byung ba yin gyi lus gzhan gyi dod po'i rtsig ba'i gzhan nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin rtsig pa la ni pha'i gnas lta bu'i ri mo mkhan gzhan kho na las ri mo byung ba yin gyi lus gzhan gyi dod po'i rtsig ba'i gzhan nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the painting on the wall arises from the painter, who is like the father, but not from another place, like the wall, which is like another body.

original: du ba ni me las skyes pa yin gyi 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: du ba ni me las skyes pa yin gyi 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: Smoke arises from fire, but not from somewhere else. This is the difference.

original: phyogs gsum ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gsum ba brjod pa ni /
translated: The third side is stated:

original: chang la brten pa'i mos pa'i nus pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chang la brten pa'i mos pa'i nus pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The power of the desire that is based on the beer, etc.

original: chang la brten pa ni chang gi chos so //
analyzed: chang la brten pa ni chang gi chos so //
translated: That which is based on the beer is the quality of the beer.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa na gzhan la brten pa ma yin pa la @47a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa na gzhan la brten pa ma yin pa la @47a * //
translated: So too, when it is destroyed, it does not depend on another.

original: 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Nor does it come from anywhere.

original: 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten dag med bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten dag med bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that there is no prior world and no subsequent world.

original: 'dir rang bzhin dang chos kyi phyogs dag la khad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin dang chos kyi phyogs dag la khad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the two positions, that of intrinsic nature and that of the elements?

original: de kho nar ni 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de kho nar ni 'ga' yang med mod kyi /
translated: In reality, there is no difference.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad tsam gyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad tsam gyis byas pa yin no //
translated: However, it is made by mere verbal designation.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni tha dad par lhag par zhen pas yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni tha dad par lhag par zhen pas yin la /
translated: The designation of difference is due to the adherence to difference.

original: tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen pas ni rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen pas ni rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The designation of intrinsic nature is due to the adherence to non-difference.

original: bum pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni tha dad par brjod par 'dod pa yin yang tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: bum pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni tha dad par brjod par 'dod pa yin yang tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen pa nyid do //
translated: Although the expression ‚Äúthe intrinsic nature of a pot‚Äù suggests difference, it is due to the adherence to non-difference.

original: de bzhin du aa mra'i dmar po //
analyzed: de bzhin du aa mra'i dmar po //
translated: So too, the redness of the mango.

original: rtsig pa'i ri mo zhes bya ba yang rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa'i ri mo zhes bya ba yang rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe design on the wall‚Äù is also just an intrinsic nature.

original: nus pa'i lugs tha dad pas tha mi dad pa nyid du tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: nus pa'i lugs tha dad pas tha mi dad pa nyid du tha snyad du byed do //
translated: because of the difference in the system of potency, they are conventionally designated as non-different.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa yang nus pa can gyis rang bzhin nyid do zhes de kho na'i rjes su 'brang ba dang rtsig pa la ri mo aa mra'i dmar po zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe rang bzhin dang / chos kyi phyogs dag bzlog pa yang yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa ni de kho na ma yin pa spros pa tsam gyi don yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa yang nus pa can gyis rang bzhin nyid do zhes de kho na'i rjes su 'brang ba dang rtsig pa la ri mo aa mra'i dmar po zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe rang bzhin dang / chos kyi phyogs dag bzlog pa yang yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa ni de kho na ma yin pa spros pa tsam gyi don yin no //
translated: When potency is the intrinsic nature of the potent, and one wishes to say ‚Äúthe painting on the wall is the color of the mango,‚Äù then the position of intrinsic nature and the position of the property are reversed, and the difference is not the reality, but merely a conceptual superimposition.

original: yang na gzhan gyi lugs ni 'di 'dra ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi lugs ni 'di 'dra ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, because the other system is merely of this kind, there is no fault.

original: de skad du bshad pa yang zhes bya ba ni phur bus so //
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa yang zhes bya ba ni phur bus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus it is said‚Äù refers to the stake.

original: de kho na'i sgra ni chos brjod pa yin yang 'dir grags pas tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i don la brjod do //
analyzed: de kho na'i sgra ni chos brjod pa yin yang 'dir grags pas tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i don la brjod do //
translated: Although the word ‚Äúreality‚Äù expresses a property, here it expresses the meaning ascertained by valid cognition through renown.

original: sa la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba 'di rnam par bcad pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa nyid ces bya ba 'di rnam par bcad pa brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEarth, etc., itself‚Äù expresses the exclusion.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not space, etc.

original: de nyid yin gyi de nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin no //üîΩsa la sogs pa de nyid ma yin na rnam par shes pa tsam mam /
analyzed: de nyid yin gyi de nyid ma yin pa ni ma yin no // sa la sogs pa de nyid ma yin na rnam par shes pa tsam mam /
translated: It is that, not something other than that.

original: chos thams cad stong pa de kho na yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa de kho na yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If earth, etc. were not that, consciousness-only or the emptiness of all dharmas would be that.

original: 'di gnyis de kho na yin na ni de kho na nyid yin pa nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis de kho na yin na ni de kho na nyid yin pa nyid do zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir gsal ba yin no //
translated: If these two were that, then it would be ascertained that that is reality, and thus it would be clear.

original: de'i tshogs la zhes bya ba ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi tshogs la'o //
analyzed: de'i tshogs la zhes bya ba ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi tshogs la'o //
translated: The collection of those is the collection of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is explained as immeasurable.

original: phabs ni chang gi rtsi'o //
analyzed: phabs ni chang gi rtsi'o //
translated: Yeast is the essence of wine.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni chu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni chu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes water, etc.

original: ri mo bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: ri mo bzhin dang zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la ltos nas so //
translated: Like a painting means in dependence on a wall.

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir aa mra'i dmar po yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir aa mra'i dmar po yang rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The redness of the mango is to be understood as natural.

original: du ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin pas so//
analyzed: du ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yin pas so//
translated: Like smoke means because it is a result.

original: @47b ri mo mkhan la ltos pa'i ri mo yang rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @47b ri mo mkhan la ltos pa'i ri mo yang rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The picture is also to be understood in relation to the painter.

original: 'pho bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgzhan nas 'di'am /
analyzed: 'pho bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni / gzhan nas 'di'am /
translated: Seeing transmigration meansüîΩseeing that it goes from there to here,

original: 'di nas gzhan du 'pho bar mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nas gzhan du 'pho bar mthong ba ste /
translated: or from here to there.

original: de med pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skye ba dag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma'i skye ba dag med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because that does not exist, the prior and subsequent births do not exist.

original: de la sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni de nyid do zhes bya ba'i mdo re zhig sun 'byin pa ni de nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni de nyid do zhes bya ba'i mdo re zhig sun 'byin pa ni de nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The sutra says, Earth, water, fire, and wind are the same. The refutation is, They are not the same.

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid de nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid de nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, Form and so on are the same,

original: de dag kyang lnga zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang lnga zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, They are also five.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par ro //
translated: The phrase in another way means that they are different from form and so on.

original: sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i gtsor byas pa'i don sun 'byin pa ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa nyid do zhes nges par gzung ba'i gtsor byas pa'i don sun 'byin pa ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the meaning of the primary assertion that ‚Äúearth, etc. are just those‚Äù is the proof of momentariness, etc.

original: de'i phyir de nyid ni rnam pa bzhi kho na'o zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid ni rnam pa bzhi kho na'o zhes bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that ‚Äújust those are the four.‚Äù

original: grangs nges par gzung ba nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: grangs nges par gzung ba nyid la sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o//
translated: Another refutation of the assertion of a specific number is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúMoreover, if all is empty, your words are meaningless.‚Äù

original: blta bya zhes bya ba ni myong bya'o //
analyzed: blta bya zhes bya ba ni myong bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the objects of experience.

original: rten lnga ni dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: rten lnga ni dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The ‚Äúfive bases‚Äù are the five sense faculties.

original: de nyid yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúJust those‚Äù refers to

original: sun dbyung ba'i phyir thams cad stong pa la gang brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i phyir thams cad stong pa la gang brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to refute that, it is said, ‚ÄúIf all is empty, your words are meaningless.‚Äù

original: gal te thams cad stong pa la tshad ma yod na de'i tshe thams cad stong pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te thams cad stong pa la tshad ma yod na de'i tshe thams cad stong pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: If all is empty and there is valid cognition, then all is not empty,

original: de sgrub pa'i tshad ma nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i tshad ma nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is valid cognition that proves that.

original: gal te stong nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma yang stong na'o //
analyzed: gal te stong nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma yang stong na'o //
translated: If emptiness is empty of valid cognition,

original: de'i tshe tshang ma med pa de chos thams cad stong pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshad ma med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshang ma med pa de chos thams cad stong pa nyid du sgrub pa'i tshad ma med do //
translated: then there is no valid cognition, and there is no valid cognition to establish the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: des na ba di gnyis ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na ba di gnyis ni 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, these two are contradictory.

original: chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'phangs ba'i rtsod pa de yang med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'phangs ba'i rtsod pa de yang med do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The argument that is implied by the statement ‚Äúall phenomena are empty‚Äù is also nonexistent. This is the meaning.

original: tshad ma med par ni bsgrub bya mi 'grub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma med par ni bsgrub bya mi 'grub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that without valid cognition, the probandum is not established.

original: 'on te kun rdzob ba'i tshad ma la brten nas stong ba nyid la grub ce na /
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob ba'i tshad ma la brten nas stong ba nyid la grub ce na /
translated: But if you say that emptiness is established on the basis of conventional valid cognition,

original: 'o na ni nyams su myong ba las stong ba nyid ma yin par ci ste nges par mi byed /
analyzed: 'o na ni nyams su myong ba las stong ba nyid ma yin par ci ste nges par mi byed /
translated: then why do you not ascertain that it is not emptiness on the basis of experience?

original: 'di la kun rdzob nyid las skyon gzhan ni brjod par byar med do //
analyzed: 'di la kun rdzob nyid las skyon gzhan ni brjod par byar med do //
translated: In this regard, there is no fault other than the fact that it is conventional.

original: kun rdzob par sgrub pa ni 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar thams cad stong ba nyid du 'grub /
analyzed: kun rdzob par sgrub pa ni 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ci ltar thams cad stong ba nyid du 'grub /
translated: Since it is accepted that it is established as conventional, how is it established that everything is empty?

original: gal te rnam par shes ba tsam yang ma yin te zhes dang po kho nar smras pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes ba tsam yang ma yin te zhes dang po kho nar smras pa ma yin nam /
translated: But didn't you say at the very beginning that it is not even consciousness-only?

original: ci ltar na de la la bar dor nas dbu ma nyid nye bar dang bkod ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de la la bar dor nas dbu ma nyid nye bar dang bkod ce na /
translated: How can you now set forth the middle way in the intermediate stage?üîΩIt is said: All is emptiness and illusion,

original: thams cad stong nyid cing dra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa @48a * //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid cing dra dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa @48a * //
translated: and so forth.

original: gsungs te / thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsungs te / thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the emptiness of all?

original: rtag ba'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag ba'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that all permanent phenomena are empty.

original: ji skad chos kyi rgyal tshab kyis //
analyzed: ji skad chos kyi rgyal tshab kyis //
translated: As it is said by the regent of the doctrine:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: There is imagination of what is unreal;

original: de la gnyis bo yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gnyis bo yod ma yin //
translated: there is no duality there,

original: stong pa nyid ni de la yod //üîΩces bya ba /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de la yod // ces bya ba /
translated: but emptiness exists there.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: It is said: The imagination of what is unreal

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //üîΩzhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa // zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: 'di la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kun du brtags pas zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'di la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kun du brtags pas zhes bya bas so //
translated: Here, the imagination of what is unreal means the imagination of the unreal object and subject.

original: des na 'di 'dra ba'i stong bar smra ba la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di 'dra ba'i stong bar smra ba la brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should rely on the emptiness that is like this.

original: de ltar yang slob dpon zhi ba mtsho'i bzhed ba bkod nas sna tshogs gnyis med kyi rgyas btab pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang slob dpon zhi ba mtsho'i bzhed ba bkod nas sna tshogs gnyis med kyi rgyas btab pas /
translated: Thus, having set forth the position of Master ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita, the seal of nonduality is applied.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis de kho na nyid du spangs ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshul nyid dbu ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis de kho na nyid du spangs ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshul nyid dbu ma yin par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the two extremes of superimposition and denial are abandoned in reality, one should understand that the mode of consciousness itself is the middle way.

original: ji skad du mgon po de nyid kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du mgon po de nyid kyis /
translated: As the protector himself said:

original: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
translated: Not empty, not nonempty,

original: de lta bas na thams cad brjod //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad brjod //
translated: therefore all is expressed.

original: yod pas med pas yod pa na //
analyzed: yod pas med pas yod pa na //
translated: Because of existence, because of nonexistence,

original: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no //üîΩzhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no // zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: that is the middle way.

original: des na lugs 'di gnyis de kho nar tha dang med pa'i phyir gcig bstan pa kho nas gnyis pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na lugs 'di gnyis de kho nar tha dang med pa'i phyir gcig bstan pa kho nas gnyis pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because these two systems are not different in reality, by teaching one, the other is also taught.

original: 'di la ni nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba yang med de gsal ba'i rang bzhin mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la ni nyams su myong ba dang 'gal ba yang med de gsal ba'i rang bzhin mi 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And in this system there is no contradiction with experience, because the nature of clarity is not refuted.

original: 'on te mi 'gal mod /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'gal mod /
translated: But how can this be, since it is not contradictory?

original: 'di 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i stong pa nyid la yang sgrub par byed pa ci yod ce na /
translated: And what is the proof of this kind of emptiness?

original: de la tshad ma ci 'dra ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la tshad ma ci 'dra ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: What kind of valid cognition is there?

original: shes pa nyid dang gsal bzhin pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa nyid dang gsal bzhin pa nyid la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is just consciousness, just manifestation, and so on.

original: de la 'jig rten snga ma sun 'byin pa'i skabs kyis dang po'i phyogs gnyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir rtsod pa la tha snyad btags nas rjes su rjod par byed ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩpha ma'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten snga ma sun 'byin pa'i skabs kyis dang po'i phyogs gnyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir rtsod pa la tha snyad btags nas rjes su rjod par byed ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // pha ma'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: In this regard, in order to refute the first position by refuting the prior world, he raises the objection and then responds: ‚ÄúIf you say . . . ‚Äù

original: zas la sogs pa'i mthong ba nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa'i mthong ba nyid gzung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body of the parents, and so on‚Äù ‚Äî the word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the consumption of food, and so on.

original: lus kyi 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i lus kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba ni bskyed par bya ba'i lus kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe great elements of the body‚Äù are those of the body that is to be generated.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyis bshad pa ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyis bshad pa ni 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù ‚Äî the explanation by this very [verse] is ‚Äúfrom another world. ‚Äù

original: dgag ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ltar bcos pa'o /
analyzed: dgag ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ltar bcos pa'o /
translated: It is a mere semblance of the non-perception of intrinsic reality, because it is done in terms of negation.

original: de la / gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: de la / gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong phyir //
translated: In response to the statement, ‚ÄúBecause going and coming are not seen,‚Äù

original: zhes @48b bya ba'i sun 'byin pa 'chad par 'gyur bas the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes @48b bya ba'i sun 'byin pa 'chad par 'gyur bas the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: the refutation will be explained, so there is doubt.

original: skye ba snga ma'i 'thad pa bshad pa ni de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i 'thad pa bshad pa ni de ni mi bden te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the feasibility of prior birth is ‚ÄúThat is not true.‚Äù

original: pha ma'i lus 'ba' zhig las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha ma'i lus 'ba' zhig las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Birth is not only from the bodies of the father and mother.

original: 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi 'thad do //
translated: Inhalation and exhalation, etc. are not feasible without relying on their own type.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'thad ce na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'thad ce na ;
translated: Why is that not feasible?üîΩFrom the particular intrinsic reality characterized by movement, etc.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par las te de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par las te de de'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the reason.üîΩIf movement, etc. are made by the particular qualities of desire, etc.,

analyzed: gal te g-yo ba nyid dang 'dod pa'i khad par la sogs pa'i chos kyis byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las /
translated: the particular intrinsic reality

original: rang rigs la ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang rigs la ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: is without reliance on its own type.

original: snga ma'i nye bar len pa la ma ltos par mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa yin mod /
analyzed: snga ma'i nye bar len pa la ma ltos par mi 'thad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa yin mod /
translated: It is not tenable that the latter is not dependent on the former appropriation.

original: snga ma'i nye bar len pa ni pha ma'i goms pa nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: snga ma'i nye bar len pa ni pha ma'i goms pa nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the former appropriation is the mere habit of the parents,

original: g-yo pa la sogs pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: g-yo pa la sogs pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the verse says, ‚Äúand so on, including deceit and so on.‚Äù

original: gang la g-yo ba la sogs par bzhag pa de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gang la g-yo ba la sogs par bzhag pa de'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The nature of that which is posited as deceit and so on is

analyzed: sngar gyi blo dang dbang po la sogs pa de goms pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: the mere habit of the former mind, sense faculties, and so on.

original: rnam par bcad bya brjod pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par bcad bya brjod pa ni //
translated: The expression of the refutation is

original: pha ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the parents are not different from the child, and so on.‚Äù

original: bzlog pa la gnod pa brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdam pa ma yin pa'i skye bo dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: bzlog pa la gnod pa brjod pa ni de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba'o // dam pa ma yin pa'i skye bo dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: The expression of the contradiction is ‚ÄúIf that is not so, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would be the same as the parents.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf the child is not the same as the parents, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf that is not so, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence of the reversal is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would be different from the parents.‚Äù

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i bstan bcos mthong ba las pa las skyes pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid la sogs pa las zlog pa goms pa las chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa la sogs par 'gyur bas ni /
translated: The expression of the refutation of the absurd consequence of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf the child is not different from the parents, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would not be born from the parents.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the refutation of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf the child is not born from the parents, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would not be born from the parents.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the refutation of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf the child is not born from the parents, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the refutation of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would not be born from the parents.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the refutation of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the refutation of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIf the child is not born from the parents, and so on.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the absurd consequence of the refutation of the refutation of the refutation of the reversal is ‚ÄúIt would follow that the child would not be born from the parents.‚ÄùüîΩThe expression of the refutation of the absurd consequence of the

original: goms pa la sogs pa rnams kyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid du gsal 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: goms pa la sogs pa rnams kyi goms pa sngon du song ba can nyid du gsal 'debs par byed do //
translated: and the fact that they are habituated to such things as the practice of yoga is also clearly indicated.

original: de lta ma yin na pha ma'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na pha ma'i rang bzhin nyid rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the nature of the parents would be transmitted.

original: 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa mthong bas ni de yang de kho na bzhin goms par gyur pa yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa mthong bas ni de yang de kho na bzhin goms par gyur pa yin no zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: But when one sees that the nature of some things is transmitted, one is certain that that is due to the prior habituation to them.

original: gang dang gang g-yo bag dang chos dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos su gyur pa de thams cad ni sngon goms pas bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang g-yo bag dang chos dang ldan pa la sogs pa'i chos su gyur pa de thams cad ni sngon goms pas bskyed pa yin te /
translated: Whatever things are endowed with the attributes of movement, etc., all of them are produced by prior habituation.

original: dper na dbus kyi gnas skabs na rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa goms pa las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbus kyi gnas skabs na rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa goms pa las rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the middle stage of life, one becomes habituated to a different form of movement, and so on, and then one changes to a different form.

original: srog chags rnams kyi dang po'i gnas skabs kyi g-yo ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyi dang po'i gnas skabs kyi g-yo ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The movement, etc., of living beings in the first stage of life are also like that.

original: don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a reason based on effect.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The result of valid knowledge is stated: ‚ÄúTherefore,

original: ma yin par bkab pas rang @49a * //
analyzed: ma yin par bkab pas rang @49a * //
translated: it is not the case that the body of the son is covered by the body of the father and mother.

original: gi goms pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gi goms pa nyid las 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the case that the body of the son arises from the body of the father and mother.‚Äù

original: g-yo bag dang goms pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pas na ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: g-yo bag dang goms pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pas na ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Since movement and habit are established as the nature of cause and effect, it is not indeterminate.üîΩIf the body of the father and mother, etc. are tenable as causes,üîΩthen the body of the son would exist prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa rgyur 'thad ce na /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa rgyur 'thad ce na / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.üîΩIf the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.üîΩIf the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.

original: gal te bu chung gi rang bzhin de dag pha ma'i rang bzhin yod na ste /
analyzed: gal te bu chung gi rang bzhin de dag pha ma'i rang bzhin yod na ste /
translated: If the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.üîΩIf the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.üîΩIf the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.

original: pha ma'i rang bzhin nye bar gnas pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha ma'i rang bzhin nye bar gnas pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.

original: sngar srid pa gzhan du yod par 'gyur na /üîΩde'i tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid do zhes 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar srid pa gzhan du yod par 'gyur na / de'i tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid do zhes 'thad pa yin te /
translated: If the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.üîΩIf the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not arise from the body of the father and mother, etc.

original: gnyi ga rgyu yin yang skabs la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu yin yang skabs la gnod pa med do //
translated: If the body of the son exists prior to the body of the father and mother, etc.,üîΩthen the body of the son would not

original: yang na gal te bu chung gi 'dod pa la sogs pa thams cad sngar pha ma'i rang bzhin la yod par gyur na de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te bu chung gi 'dod pa la sogs pa thams cad sngar pha ma'i rang bzhin la yod par gyur na de'i tshe'o //
translated: Or, if all of the child‚Äôs desires, etc. existed previously in the nature of the parents, then at that time

original: lus la sogs pa yang zhes yang gi sgras ni srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa yang zhes yang gi sgras ni srid pa ma yin te /
translated: the body, etc. would not exist. The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is not possible.

original: ma dang pha'i lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid du srid par rtogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma dang pha'i lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid du srid par rtogs pa rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is reasonable to understand that the body, etc. of the mother and father are the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na rang la brten pa'i g-yo bag la sogs pa nang nas rang bzhin gang zhig skyed byed dag la yod par ma gyur pa de nyid goms pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rang la brten pa'i g-yo bag la sogs pa nang nas rang bzhin gang zhig skyed byed dag la yod par ma gyur pa de nyid goms pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the nature of the child‚Äôs movements, etc. which arise from within itself, would not exist in the parents who give rise to it. It would be said that it arises from habituation.

original: bu chung ri rang bzhin mtha' dag pha ma gnyis la gdon mi za bar gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bu chung ri rang bzhin mtha' dag pha ma gnyis la gdon mi za bar gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The entire nature of the child does not exist in the two parents without doubt.

original: de ma yin yang bzlog par dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de ma yin yang bzlog par dogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is not so, it is feared that it will be reversed.

original: 'on te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOr, if it is not so.‚Äù

original: sngar goms pa med pa na g-yo bag ma dmigs la /
analyzed: sngar goms pa med pa na g-yo bag ma dmigs la /
translated: When there is no prior habituation, movement is not observed.

original: goms pa yod na yod bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs ba gsum gyis grub ba yin no //
analyzed: goms pa yod na yod bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs ba gsum gyis grub ba yin no //
translated: Because of the experience of existence when there is habituation, here also the fact of cause and effect is established by the three: perception, non-perception, and the fact of non-existence.

original: 'dir 'di ma grub na ni gzhan du yang mi 'grub par thal lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di ma grub na ni gzhan du yang mi 'grub par thal lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if it is not established here, it follows that it is not established elsewhere.

original: 'di na 'jigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di na 'jigs pa yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no fear here‚Äù is ‚Äúthat also.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pas na rgyu mi dmigs bas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog bar grub par bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po grub pas na rgyu mi dmigs bas gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog bar grub par bstan pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since the fact of cause and effect is established, in order to demonstrate that the reason is established as the property of the subject by the non-perception of the cause, he says ‚ÄúIf it is established that habituation precedes . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te goms pa sngon du 'gro bar grub par de'i tshe rang gi goms pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te goms pa sngon du 'gro bar grub par de'i tshe rang gi goms pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If it is established that habituation precedes, then ‚Äúone who is devoid of one‚Äôs own habituation . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: rten med pa ni rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: rten med pa ni rgyu med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a basis‚Äù means without a cause.

original: des na rgyu mi dmigs pa thal ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges pa kho nar zlog par byed do //
analyzed: des na rgyu mi dmigs pa thal ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges pa kho nar zlog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of a cause is a reason that proves a consequence, and it is certain that it reverses from the position that is not in agreement with the reason.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba @49b rgyu med par 'byung na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba @49b rgyu med par 'byung na'o //
translated: then it would be a non-existent cause.

original: ngag las tha snyad du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag las tha snyad du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: It is to be understood that it is a convention that is made from speech.

original: dper na 'dir sngar zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pas ldog pa nges pa dang / goms pa yod na g-yo ba mthong ba na /
analyzed: dper na 'dir sngar zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pas ldog pa nges pa dang / goms pa yod na g-yo ba mthong ba na /
translated: For example, here, by the non-observation of a person who has previously entered, there is a determination of a reversal, and when there is a movement that is seen,

original: rim par 'byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis kyi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ltar /
analyzed: rim par 'byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis kyi rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ltar /
translated: then there is a realization of a forward pervasion, just as it occurs in a sequence of two direct perceptions.

original: gang du mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i mi dmigs pa srid pa der yang rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin cing phyis kyi mi dmigs pa rim par byung bas ni ldog pa 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba'i mi dmigs pa srid pa der yang rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin cing phyis kyi mi dmigs pa rim par byung bas ni ldog pa 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: And, where there is a possibility of a non-observation that is preceded by a direct perception, there also the forward pervasion is apprehended by the direct perception itself, and the reversal is apprehended by the subsequent non-observation that occurs in a sequence.

original: aar tsa tas ci ltar gtan la phab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: aar tsa tas ci ltar gtan la phab pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it was determined by Arcatta.

original: de'i phyir da ltar mig la sogs pa g-yo ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni g-yo ba'i rigs mthun pa g-yo ba'i gsal ba gzhan gang yin pa de goms pa de las byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa de sngon du 'groüîΩba can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar mig la sogs pa g-yo ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni g-yo ba'i rigs mthun pa g-yo ba'i gsal ba gzhan gang yin pa de goms pa de las byung ba'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa'i mig la sogs pa de sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the present eye, etc., which is endowed with movement, etc., is preceded by that which is of a similar type of movement, that is, by another manifestation of movement, which has the nature of arising from that which is habituated.

original: sogs ba'i sgras bsdus ba'i chos gzhan yang de bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs ba'i sgras bsdus ba'i chos gzhan yang de bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Other phenomena included by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be understood in the same way.

original: de 'dra ba'i du ba de ni gzhan med pa las kyang skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i du ba de ni gzhan med pa las kyang skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Such smoke does not arise from what is not another,

original: 'on kyang de lta bu nyid las yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bu nyid las yin te /
translated: but rather from just that.

original: rgyu rigs kyis mthun par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rigs kyis mthun par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established as similar by the type of cause.

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa las kyang rigs mi mthun pa ma yin pa 'byung na ni rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa las kyang rigs mi mthun pa ma yin pa 'byung na ni rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if what is not similar by type arose from what is similar by type, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no cause.

original: rgyu med pa yin na yang rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs kyi go skabs su thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin na yang rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs kyi go skabs su thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were causeless, it would be eternally existent or nonexistent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon gnyis bzhin du gcig tu rtogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon gnyis bzhin du gcig tu rtogs pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although the two are understood as one,

original: rigs gcig tu gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs gcig tu gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: it is not a reason for positing them as one type.

original: des na shin du rnam par phye ba'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bus ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: des na shin du rnam par phye ba'i rnam pa can gyi 'bras bus ni rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the cause is not mistaken regarding the effect that has a very distinct aspect.

original: 'o na ni skye ba dang po na yang khyad par gzhan nyid yod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ni skye ba dang po na yang khyad par gzhan nyid yod do snyam na /
translated: If you think that even in the first moment of birth, there is another difference,

original: goms pa las shes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms pa las shes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that it is known from habituation.

original: khyad par 'gyur ni 'dus byas pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'gyur ni 'dus byas pa ste /
translated: The transformation of the basis is conditioned.

original: bzlog pa goms pa las bzlog pa'i chos can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa goms pa las bzlog pa'i chos can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the quality of being the opposite of habituation.

original: skye ba dang por zhes bya ba ni bu chung la'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang por zhes bya ba ni bu chung la'o //
translated: The first moment of birth refers to the infant.

original: de bzhin gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di ldog pa'i chos can nyid du de bzhin du gnas so zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gnas zhes bya ba ni 'di ldog pa'i chos can nyid du de bzhin du gnas so zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Likewise, ‚Äúabiding‚Äù is to be construed as ‚Äúabiding as the subject of the phenomenon of reversal.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'bras bu tha mi dang par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu tha mi dang par brjod do //
translated: This is the expression of the nondifference of the effect.

original: des na rgyu tha dad par mi rtag go snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu tha dad par mi rtag go snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the cause is not different. This is the intended meaning.

original: du ba ni de lta bur gyur pa gzhan las ma yin @50a * //
analyzed: du ba ni de lta bur gyur pa gzhan las ma yin @50a * //
translated: Smoke is not like that, because it is not from another.

original: pa'i phyir rgyu tha dad par mthong ba las 'bras bu tha dad par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba la rag go //
analyzed: pa'i phyir rgyu tha dad par mthong ba las 'bras bu tha dad par rjes su dpog par 'gyur ba la rag go //
translated: Therefore, from seeing the cause as different, one infers the effect as different.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i 'du byed pa thams cad ni goms pas byas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba'i 'du byed pa thams cad ni goms pas byas pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, all the compositional activities of cyclic existence are only made by habituation.

original: de yang skyes ma thag pa dang mngal du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang skyes ma thag pa dang mngal du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since it is not the case that it is made by the one who is born or by the one who is in the womb,

original: skye nga gzhan gyis goms pa kho nas byas pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: skye nga gzhan gyis goms pa kho nas byas pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: it is established that it is only made by the one who is born elsewhere through habituation.

original: gal te 'dus byas pa 'di 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi dmigs pas gnod pa ma yin nam snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas pa 'di 'jig rten pha rol gyi goms pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di mi dmigs pas gnod pa ma yin nam snyam na /
translated: If this compositional activity is made by the habituation of another world, is it not undermined by the fact that it is not observed?

original: de zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can ci 'dra ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa mthong ba las de ltar grub pa de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin pa'i goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can kho nar mthong ba'i phyir de
analyzed: de zhes gsungs so // gal te goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can ci 'dra ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa mthong ba las de ltar grub pa de bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin pa'i goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can kho nar mthong ba'i phyir de
translated: He said this.

original: lta bu nyid 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol ni mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: lta bu nyid 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol ni mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that movement and so on are established in just that way, from seeing that they are preceded by habituation, then just like that, the world beyond is not established, because it is seen to be preceded by habituation, but not in this world.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because of that, he said,

original: 'du byed pa dang goms pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed pa dang goms pa gnyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that habituation and movement are the nature of cause and effect.

original: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni 'bras bu ni rgyu dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni 'bras bu ni rgyu dang lhan cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified: The effect does not exist simultaneously with the cause.

original: gal te de la rgyu nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gi 'brel par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te de la rgyu nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gi 'brel par 'gyur ba /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúSince the cause is not seen, how could it be related to the effect?

original: 'bras bu de'i 'bras nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i 'bras nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could that effect be the effect of that cause?‚Äù

original: rgyu ma mthong yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúEven though the cause is not seen,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar 'jig rten rgyang 'phan gyi 'dod pa bsal nas bzhad gad du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten rgyang 'phan gyi 'dod pa bsal nas bzhad gad du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted the assertions of the Lokayatas, in order to ridicule them,

original: de'i phyir 'dir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, here‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: glen pa gzhan gyis khyu mchog dang ma he dag ci lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir khyu mchog ri sgras ma he la brjod pa ste /
analyzed: glen pa gzhan gyis khyu mchog dang ma he dag ci lta ba bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir khyu mchog ri sgras ma he la brjod pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbull‚Äù is used to refer to a buffalo, because other fools are uncertain about the difference between a bull and a buffalo.

original: ma hi ra ring po gang yin pa de ma'i lto na ci ltar gnas te /
analyzed: ma hi ra ring po gang yin pa de ma'i lto na ci ltar gnas te /
translated: How could a buffalo, which is so large, fit in a mother‚Äôs womb?

original: de gnas na ma ci ltar mtsho snyam du bas mas pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas na ma ci ltar mtsho snyam du bas mas pa'o //
translated: If it did, how could the mother be a human?

original: nges na ma he gnas pa ci ltar srid pa dag smros shig ces dris pa na'o //
analyzed: nges na ma he gnas pa ci ltar srid pa dag smros shig ces dris pa na'o //
translated: If it did not, how could it be born from a human mother?

original: de lta bur gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni don 'di yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just like that‚Äù means the following.

original: dper na sngar skyes pa 'phel ba la sogs pa med par ma he de ltar tha snyad byed pa tsam bzhad gad kyi gnas yin pa de bzhin du sngon goms pa med pa nyid du skye ba dang po'i 'du byed pa la sogs pa la de ltar tha
analyzed: dper na sngar skyes pa 'phel ba la sogs pa med par ma he de ltar tha snyad byed pa tsam bzhad gad kyi gnas yin pa de bzhin du sngon goms pa med pa nyid du skye ba dang po'i 'du byed pa la sogs pa la de ltar tha
translated: Just as a buffalo is the object of ridicule because it is merely designated as such without any increase in size and so on, in the same way, the first moment of the formative factors of one who has no prior habituation is merely designated as such.

original: snyad tsam byed pa la bzhad gad kyi gnas yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snyad tsam byed pa la bzhad gad kyi gnas yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is a matter for laughter to impute it to mere convention.

original: 'on te gang las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But if it is from another,

original: de tsam gyis ni lan mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni lan mi 'thob ste /
translated: one does not get an answer,

original: yongs su gyur pa thams @50b cad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa thams @50b cad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all transformations exist.

original: des na khyad par de lta bu sems pa yin no snyam pas phan tshun zhes smras so //
analyzed: des na khyad par de lta bu sems pa yin no snyam pas phan tshun zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, thinking that such a distinction is made, he says, ‚Äúmutually.‚Äù

original: nam gyi sgras ni brjod pa'i phyogs mi 'dod par phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa'i don to //
analyzed: nam gyi sgras ni brjod pa'i phyogs mi 'dod par phyogs gzhan khas blangs pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù means that he does not accept the position expressed, but rather another.

original: dmigs zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs zhes bya ba ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means not as an object.

original: med pa'i tha snyad nyid kyi yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad nyid kyi yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is the domain of the convention of nonexistence.

original: / gal te bltar rung bar khas blangs na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin na nyes pa 'dir ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: / gal te bltar rung bar khas blangs na skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin na nyes pa 'dir ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one accepts that it is visible, this fault would ensue. But if it is not visible, what is the fault?

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù is the question.

original: 'di ni bltar rung ba ma yin pa des na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid ma yin no snyam du bas thas ba'o / de lta yin na zhes bya ba khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bltar rung ba ma yin pa des na med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid ma yin no snyam du bas thas ba'o / de lta yin na zhes bya ba khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin na'o //
translated: If it were like that, it would be a special case that is not visible.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du nges bar rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu nyid du nges bar rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeeing‚Äù means ascertaining the cause.

original: brtag par bya ba ni nges bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ni nges bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be investigated‚Äù means to be ascertained.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig la goms pa rgyur mthong ba ni de lta na yang yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid ci ste mi rtag snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig la goms pa rgyur mthong ba ni de lta na yang yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid ci ste mi rtag snyam na /
translated: If one sees that familiarity with something is the cause, then even if it is a transformation, why would it not be impermanent?

original: ma mthong ba rtog na ni zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: ma mthong ba rtog na ni zhes gsungs te ;
translated: If one imagines what is not seen, then‚Ä¶

original: gal te tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo dor nas chos kyi khyad par nyid brtag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo dor nas chos kyi khyad par nyid brtag par bya ba yin na /
translated: If one abandons the nature of an entity that is seen by valid knowledge and investigates a special quality of the object,

original: de'i tshe du ba yang sa'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par nyid kyis bskyed par 'gyur gyi mes bskyed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe du ba yang sa'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par nyid kyis bskyed par 'gyur gyi mes bskyed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time smoke would be generated by a special transformation of earth and not by fire.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni shin du brtag bar dka'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni shin du brtag bar dka'o //
translated: Because this is very difficult to analyze.

original: des na lus kyi 'byung ba rgyu ma yin la pha ma'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa des na 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni zhes mjug sdud pa'o //üîΩde ltar sngon gyi goms pa bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: des na lus kyi 'byung ba rgyu ma yin la pha ma'i rang bzhin yang ma yin pa des na 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni zhes mjug sdud pa'o // de ltar sngon gyi goms pa bsgrubs pas /
translated: Therefore, since the elements of the body are not the cause, and since they are not of the nature of the parents, the conclusion is that inhalation and exhalation are not the body.

original: ri mo mkhan gyi ri mo ltar 'bras sbu nyid yin pa'i phyogs sun phyung ba yin la /
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gyi ri mo ltar 'bras sbu nyid yin pa'i phyogs sun phyung ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the position that the body is the result of prior habituation is refuted, like the painting of a painting.

original: de nyid kyis rtsig pa'i ri mo dang aa mra'i smin pa ltar rang bzhin yin pa'i phyogs dang / chang gi nus pa ltar yon tan yin pa'i phyogs kyang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rtsig pa'i ri mo dang aa mra'i smin pa ltar rang bzhin yin pa'i phyogs dang / chang gi nus pa ltar yon tan yin pa'i phyogs kyang spangs pa yin no //
translated: By the same token, the position that the body is by nature is refuted, like the painting on a wall or the ripeness of the mango, and the position that the body is a quality is refuted, like the potency of the wine.

original: 'di'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag pas ni du ba ltar 'bras bu yin pa'i phyogs bkag cing srid pa snga ma yang bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin pa bkag pas ni du ba ltar 'bras bu yin pa'i phyogs bkag cing srid pa snga ma yang bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Since the result of the body is refuted, the position that the body is a result is refuted, like smoke, and prior existence is established.

original: de bzhin du 'chad bar 'gyur ba dag la yang ci rigs par dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chad bar 'gyur ba dag la yang ci rigs par dpag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the remaining positions should be refuted by analogy, as appropriate.

original: 'jig rten phyi ma sgrub pa'i don du skabs rtsom pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma sgrub pa'i don du skabs rtsom pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purpose of the composition is for the sake of establishing the next world.

original: 'bras bu 'du byed pa las so //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'du byed pa las so //
translated: The result is the performance of action.

original: rjes su dpag pa de bshad pa ni med pa gang gis so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de bshad pa ni med pa gang gis so //
translated: The inference is explained by ‚Äúby which.‚Äù

original: gang gis de skad brjod pa sngar mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa ci zhig mthong zhen //
analyzed: gang gis de skad brjod pa sngar mtshams sbyor ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa ci zhig mthong zhen //
translated: What is seen that has the power to connect that with the statement?

original: snga ma snga ma'i zhes @51a * //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i zhes @51a * //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúthe prior.‚Äù

original: gsungs so // mthong ba'i 'du byed pa las snga ma rjes su dpags shing rjes su dpags pa des ni de'i snga ma /
analyzed: gsungs so // mthong ba'i 'du byed pa las snga ma rjes su dpags shing rjes su dpags pa des ni de'i snga ma /
translated: The prior is inferred from the seen performance of action. By that inference, the prior of that is inferred.

original: de'i yang snga ma yang rjes su dpags pas rjes su dpags pa'i rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yang snga ma yang rjes su dpags pas rjes su dpags pa'i rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Since the prior of that is also inferred, the inference of the inference is stated by ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù and so on. Thus there is no beginning.

original: g-yer bag ste goms pas so //
analyzed: g-yer bag ste goms pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy habit‚Äù means by practice.

original: rang bzhin ji lta bu'i g-yer bag med pa las she na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta bu'i g-yer bag med pa las she na /
translated: From what kind of non-habit?

original: lus la ltos nas mi 'gul ba dang / sems la ltos nas zhan pa'o //
analyzed: lus la ltos nas mi 'gul ba dang / sems la ltos nas zhan pa'o //
translated: From non-movement in dependence on the body and from weakness in dependence on the mind.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag gi rgyu ba zhan pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //üîΩlnga na med pa'i sems can skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngag gi rgyu ba zhan pa la sogs pa gzung ngo // lnga na med pa'i sems can skye ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes those whose speech is weak and so on.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa dag tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
