analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa dag tu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBeings born in the five realms‚Äù are not established in the beginningless and endless.

original: g-yo bag can gyi g-yo bag med pa de nyid ston pa ni mi gzhan pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo bag can gyi g-yo bag med pa de nyid ston pa ni mi gzhan pa la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the movement of agitation‚Äù shows that they are not like others.

original: gnyi ga'i mjug sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;üîΩ/ gzhan ni mig mi gsal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mjug sdud pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ; / gzhan ni mig mi gsal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary of both is ‚ÄúTherefore, the first birth‚Äù and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are those with unclear eyes and so on.

original: gzhan dang ni mig mi gsal ba gzhan dang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dang ni mig mi gsal ba gzhan dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù are those with unclear eyes.

original: don la nye bar sbyor ba ni des na skye ba dang por yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don la nye bar sbyor ba ni des na skye ba dang por yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApplication to the meaning‚Äù is ‚ÄúTherefore, in the first birth‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is the other.

original: rdzas gzhan la zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //üîΩde nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan la zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o // de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn another substance‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: sngags dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngags dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is shown by ‚Äúmantra‚Äù and so on.

original: dpe 'di yang shin du rnyed sla'o snyam du dgongs nas dper na rmi lam lus la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dpe 'di yang shin du rnyed sla'o snyam du dgongs nas dper na rmi lam lus la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The example is easy to understand, so the root text says, ‚ÄúFor example, in a dream, the body . . .‚Äù

original: rmi lam du ni de'i dus kyi dngos por ma rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam du ni de'i dus kyi dngos por ma rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a dream, the body is not recognized as a real thing.

original: sad pa'i lus rnam par 'gyur ba ni tshig 'chol pa dang 'dar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa'i lus rnam par 'gyur ba ni tshig 'chol pa dang 'dar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body‚Äôs transformation in the waking state is the body‚Äôs trembling, shaking, and so on.

original: de bzhin skye ba gzhan du yang skye ba gzhan du byas pa'i goms pa las lus rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes lta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin skye ba gzhan du yang skye ba gzhan du byas pa'i goms pa las lus rnam par 'gyur ba yin no zhes lta'o //
translated: In the same way, in other lives, the body‚Äôs transformation is due to the habit of doing things in other lives.

original: bzhad gad kho na yod pas rtsod pa slong ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhad gad kho na yod pas rtsod pa slong ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the following:

original: rmi lam gyi lus ni mi bden la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus ni mi bden la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body in a dream is not real.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi lus ni bden pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi lus ni bden pa yin no snyam na /
translated: The body in other lives is real.‚Äù

original: bzhad gad nyid gsal bar byed pa ni shin tu te por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhad gad nyid gsal bar byed pa ni shin tu te por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúHow laughable!‚Äù

original: snang bzhin pa dang / don bya bar nus pa yin pa de lta na yang mi bden no snyam pa'i blun po la ltos shig snyam du dgongs pa ma rtog pa'i dman pa dag brgya la mi bden pa kho nar 'dzin du 'ong snyam pas /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa dang / don bya bar nus pa yin pa de lta na yang mi bden no snyam pa'i blun po la ltos shig snyam du dgongs pa ma rtog pa'i dman pa dag brgya la mi bden pa kho nar 'dzin du 'ong snyam pas /
translated: Consider the fool who thinks, Although it appears and is able to perform a function, it is not real.

original: bden dang bden min zhes bya ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bden dang bden min zhes bya ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said, the so-called real and unreal.

original: de ltar rtsod pa bsal nas thog ma med pa nyid bsgrubs shing snga na med @51b pa'i sems can skye ba yang bkag pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rtsod pa bsal nas thog ma med pa nyid bsgrubs shing snga na med @51b pa'i sems can skye ba yang bkag pa na /
translated: Having thus cleared away objections, and having established beginninglessness and refuted the arising of sentient beings without a prior cause,

original: du ba'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir mtha' med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i don du skye ba phyi ma sgrub pa rab tu sbyar ba'i rnam 'grel 'chad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba'i rgyun bzhin du rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir mtha' med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa bsal ba'i don du skye ba phyi ma sgrub pa rab tu sbyar ba'i rnam 'grel 'chad pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in order to clear away the objection, It is not without end because it is interrupted like a stream of smoke, the commentary explains the application of the proof of future birth, for that purpose, saying, Therefore...

original: nus pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the capacity means endowed with power.

original: tshang ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa tshogs pas so //
analyzed: tshang ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa tshogs pas so //
translated: Complete means complete with the collection of karma and afflictions.

original: 'dis ni nye bar len pa stobs dang ldan pa nyid brjod do //üîΩdu ba la ni skad cig so so la 'og nas 'og tu la 'grib pa yod pa'i phyir nye bar log pa mtshang bas na zad par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar len pa stobs dang ldan pa nyid brjod do // du ba la ni skad cig so so la 'og nas 'og tu la 'grib pa yod pa'i phyir nye bar log pa mtshang bas na zad par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the appropriating aggregates are powerful.

original: sems ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: sems ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Smoke is extinguished because it gradually diminishes from moment to moment, but the mind is not like that.

original: khyad par lhag dang lhag dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par lhag dang lhag dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is observed to be superior and superior.

original: 'ga' zhig la mi gsal bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la mi gsal bar gyur kyang /
translated: Even though it is unclear in some,

original: yang de kho na ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de kho na ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is seen again just as it was.

original: 'on te 'chi ka'i nad las 'og nas 'og tu 'grib pas mthar gtan chad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te 'chi ka'i nad las 'og nas 'og tu 'grib pas mthar gtan chad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is extinguished in the end because it gradually diminishes from moment to moment due to the illness of death,

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i stobs chung ba ni du ba bzhin du rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa'i stobs chung ba ni du ba bzhin du rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: this is not like the natural extinction of smoke because the power of the appropriating aggregates is weak.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni 'gal ba'i stobs kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni 'gal ba'i stobs kyis yin no //
translated: However, this is due to the power of an opposing factor.

original: sems las ni 'gal ba yang 'ga' yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems las ni 'gal ba yang 'ga' yod pa ma yin no zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, it will be explained that there is nothing that opposes the mind.

original: des na 'dis ni lus dang ngag mi gsal ba tsam du zad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni lus dang ngag mi gsal ba tsam du zad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is merely a case of the body and speech not being clear.

original: des na rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du mthar lus dang ngag nyid gtan chad par 'gyur gyi sems ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du mthar lus dang ngag nyid gtan chad par 'gyur gyi sems ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, like the body in a dream, the body and speech are ultimately cut off, but not the mind.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: rgyu mtha' dag nus pa dang ldan pa yin mod /
analyzed: rgyu mtha' dag nus pa dang ldan pa yin mod /
translated: The complete cause is endowed with the ability to produce the effect.

original: de las 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu gdon mi za bar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But the effect does not necessarily arise from it.

original: des na 'gal pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na 'gal pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas rgyu dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas rgyu dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The proponent of the tenets says, ‚ÄúCause and effect.‚Äù

original: de ltar gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how could the state of being cause and effect not exist?

original: 'bras bu rang dbang can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang dbang can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the effect would be independent.

original: de nyid ston pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni rgyu'i rang bzhin thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThe nature of all causes.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rang dbang yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rang dbang yin na'o //
translated: ‚Äú If that were so‚Äù means if it were independent.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu nus pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rgyu nus pa yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Even so‚Äù means even if the cause is able.

original: skabs kyi 'bras bu mi 'byung na'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi 'bras bu mi 'byung na'o //
translated: If the effect does not arise at that time.

original: 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It would not be an effect.

original: gzhan gyi tshe yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe yang 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even at another time, the effect would not arise,

original: rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be independent.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gtso bor gyur pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi /üîΩrjes @52a * //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gtso bor gyur pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin gyi / rjes @52a * //
translated: If you think that the state of being cause and effect is based on the preeminence of the reverse,

original: su 'gro ba'i gsos la ni mi ltos so snyam na /
analyzed: su 'gro ba'i gsos la ni mi ltos so snyam na /
translated: and that it does not depend on the preeminence of the forward

original: lan du de med na med do zhes bya ba ga las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du de med na med do zhes bya ba ga las zhes gsungs te /
translated: state, then the response is, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist when that does not exist, then why?‚Äù

original: de yod kyang 'bras bu med par khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod kyang 'bras bu med par khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because you accept that even when that exists, the effect does not exist.

original: de med na med do zhes bya ba ga las yin te /
analyzed: de med na med do zhes bya ba ga las yin te /
translated: If it does not exist when that does not exist, then why?

original: de ma yin pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: de ma yin pa kho na zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is not so.

original: / gal te de lta na rjes su 'gro ba la yang rten ci yod de /
analyzed: / gal te de lta na rjes su 'gro ba la yang rten ci yod de /
translated: If that is so, then what is the basis of the forward state?

original: gang gi phyir myu gu dang 'bras bu'i sa bon yang mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir myu gu dang 'bras bu'i sa bon yang mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Because the seed of the sprout and the seed of the effect are seen.

original: gzhan gyis gal te de yod na zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te de yod na zhes smras so //
translated: Thinking that, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf that exists.‚Äù

original: lan du de ltar yongs su zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lan du de ltar yongs su zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúBecause of the existence of the seed, the sprout is seen to arise.‚Äù

original: sa bon yod na myu gu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sa bon yod na myu gu skye bar mthong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of the existence of the seed, the sprout is seen to arise.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid du yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of the existence of the seed, the existence of the sprout is ascertained.

original: myu gu med pa'i sa bon ni myu gu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: myu gu med pa'i sa bon ni myu gu'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: A seed that is devoid of a sprout is not the cause of the sprout.

original: de lta bsnyad pa ni rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu mngon par 'dod pa mtha'i skad cig thob pa'i sa bon yang yin la /
analyzed: de lta bsnyad pa ni rgyu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // rgyu mngon par 'dod pa mtha'i skad cig thob pa'i sa bon yang yin la /
translated: Because it is said that the seed is the cause of the cause.üîΩThe seed is the cause of the sprout, and the sprout is the cause of the seed.

original: de las 'bras bu yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu yang mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that the seed, which is the cause of the sprout, is obtained in the final moment of the seed, and that the sprout does not arise from it.

original: de bas na rgyu yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba zhes rjes su 'gro ba yongs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba zhes rjes su 'gro ba yongs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the cause exists, the effect necessarily arises. The pervasion is ascertained.

original: gal te de ltar na sa bon dang bral ba'i zhing la sogs pa las myu gu mi skye ba'i phyir ldog pa yang sngar gyi mi dmigs pas yongs su bcad pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na sa bon dang bral ba'i zhing la sogs pa las myu gu mi skye ba'i phyir ldog pa yang sngar gyi mi dmigs pas yongs su bcad pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, since the sprout does not arise from a field, etc. that is devoid of a seed, isn‚Äôt the negative pervasion ascertained by the previous non-observation?

original: gal te bong bu la sogs pa de'i tshe ma dmigs pa de lta na yang myu gu ni de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te /üîΩsa bon nye bar 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: gal te bong bu la sogs pa de'i tshe ma dmigs pa de lta na yang myu gu ni de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin te / sa bon nye bar 'ongs pa na /
translated: Even if the donkey, etc. were not perceived at that time, still the sprout would not be subsequent to its cessation.üîΩBecause it arises in dependence on the mere ripening of the complete assemblage of causes and conditions,

original: tshogs pa yongs su smin pa tsam la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa yongs su smin pa tsam la ltos nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: when the seed is present.

original: snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Thinking this, he says,

original: de med na med do zhes bya ba 'di yang zhes smras so //
analyzed: de med na med do zhes bya ba 'di yang zhes smras so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis, that it does not exist when that does not exist,‚Äù

original: gal te yang da lta de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de lta na yang thams cad kyi tshe de lta yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang da lta de ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de lta na yang thams cad kyi tshe de lta yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were subsequent to the cessation of that, then it would be that way at all times.

original: ga las zhes grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dogs pa bsu nas thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: ga las zhes grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i dogs pa bsu nas thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes smras so //
translated: Why? Anticipating this qualm of the opponent, he says, ‚Äúat all times.‚Äù

original: de yod na yod pa la de ltar brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa la de ltar brjod par nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba der khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is possible to say that when that exists, this exists. The response that you would give to that would be appropriate here.

original: de ltar rtsod par smra bas rang gi gso ba'i bsam pas grub pa'i mtha' nyid brjod pa'i mjug sdud pas ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtsod par smra bas rang gi gso ba'i bsam pas grub pa'i mtha' nyid brjod pa'i mjug sdud pas ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the proponent of the dispute, having stated his own opinion, concludes with ‚ÄúTherefore.

original: gnyi ga mthong ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga mthong ba nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: ‚Äù The statement ‚Äúbecause both are seen‚Äù clarifies the above.

original: de yod na gdon mi za bar zhes @52b bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod na gdon mi za bar zhes @52b bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúif it exists‚Äù is the pervasion.

original: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun khyab par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang dag pa'i tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu dang 'bras bu dag phan tshun khyab par bstan to //
translated: This shows that cause and effect mutually pervade in terms of correct convention.

original: don dam pa la ltos nas rtsod pa dogs par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste khyab par ro //
analyzed: don dam pa la ltos nas rtsod pa dogs par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste khyab par ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthus‚Äù is the pervasion in terms of the ultimate.

original: mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag go //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it is not seen‚Äù is the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma dag go //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not the nature of cause and effect‚Äù is the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: rtsod pa de nyid sdud pa ni //
analyzed: rtsod pa de nyid sdud pa ni //
translated: The conclusion of the dispute is ‚ÄúTherefore.

original: rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The statement ‚Äúbecause of the forward and reverse pervasion‚Äù is the pervasion.

original: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gal te khyad par zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúif there is a difference‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: kha cig gcig las 'ga' la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba med do zhes las kyi drug pa gzhi tha dad par bya ste 'don to zhes bya ba ni phyir gyi don to //
analyzed: kha cig gcig las 'ga' la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba med do zhes las kyi drug pa gzhi tha dad par bya ste 'don to zhes bya ba ni phyir gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the basis of action and result is not different.

original: de ltar yin na ci grub snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ci grub snyam na /
translated: What is established by this?

original: 'jig rten gzhan zhes ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan zhes ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the other world.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba 'ba' zhig lus par 'dod pa la rnam pa shes pa 'ba' zhig lus par grub pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bsgrub bya dag gsal ba'i phyir rnyed pa chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'ba' zhig lus par 'dod pa la rnam pa shes pa 'ba' zhig lus par grub pa'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi bsgrub bya dag gsal ba'i phyir rnyed pa chen po thob pa'o //
translated: For one who maintains that only the elements remain, it is established that only consciousness remains. Thus, one has attained a great gain, since one has clarified one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô positions.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni mdo rnams ni brgal zhing brtag pa tsam lhur byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni mdo rnams ni brgal zhing brtag pa tsam lhur byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If, as you say, the other world does not exist,

original: don dam par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then in reality nothing exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am /
translated: The relation of cause and effect

original: 'byung ba ni tha snyad tsam du yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni tha snyad tsam du yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the elements exist only nominally.

original: lan du 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan du 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is that the other world is just like that.

original: tha snyad du yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is that it exists conventionally.

original: gal te rgyu'i dngos po tha snyad du yang khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i dngos po tha snyad du yang khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept the causal entity even conventionally,

original: de'i tshe 'byung ba dag las sems pa zhes bya ba dang / 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa'am ldog pa yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'byung ba dag las sems pa zhes bya ba dang / 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa'am ldog pa yang mi 'grub po //
translated: then you cannot establish that the mind arises or ceases in dependence on the elements, etc.

original: khas len na yang blo ni blo nyid las yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: khas len na yang blo ni blo nyid las yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: If you do accept it, then you have established that the mind arises from the mind itself.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúif‚Äù is a particle.

original: gal te tshad ma'i gegs yin pa'i phyir na tha snyad ces bya ba bslad pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i gegs yin pa'i phyir na tha snyad ces bya ba bslad pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is a conventional expression because it is an obstruction to valid cognition, is it not itself deceptive?

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol la bsnyon pa dang / bsgrub pa dag khyad par ci zhig yod na gang gis de grub pa'i tha snyad la gus she na /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol la bsnyon pa dang / bsgrub pa dag khyad par ci zhig yod na gang gis de grub pa'i tha snyad la gus she na /
translated: Then what is the difference between denying and establishing an afterlife? Why do you respect the conventional expression that establishes it?

original: 'khrul pa yin gyi 'og tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin gyi 'og tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is deceptive, but it is not like the following, he says.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This very thing is the characteristic of establishing an afterlife.

original: bla ste zhes bya ba ni cung zad 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: bla ste zhes bya ba ni cung zad 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: The word at most means a little.

original: gnyis su med pa'i gzhag pa la ltos na ni gnyis po 'ga' yang med @53a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i gzhag pa la ltos na ni gnyis po 'ga' yang med @53a * //
translated: In relation to the nondualistic placement, there is no duality at all.

original: do ; / de la ma ltos na ni 'jig rten pha rol bsnyon pa bas bsgrub pa nyid bsdam par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: do ; / de la ma ltos na ni 'jig rten pha rol bsnyon pa bas bsgrub pa nyid bsdam par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not rely on that, then the other world is refuted. The meaning is that it is to be concluded that it is established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhi ba dang zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, because of peace.

original: gnyes su med pa mngon du byas pa'i gnas skabs de der nyon mongs pa de'i las rnams rab tu nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyes su med pa mngon du byas pa'i gnas skabs de der nyon mongs pa de'i las rnams rab tu nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that state of the realization of the nondualistic, the actions of the afflictions are completely pacified.

original: mtho ris ni mngon par mtho ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtho ris ni mngon par mtho ba'i sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Heaven is to be expressed by the word high.

original: rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa kho na'o //
translated: It is completely established.

original: 'bras bu de gnyis ka dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de gnyis ka dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in accordance with both of those results.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gzhan nges pa'i yon tan brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gzhan nges pa'i yon tan brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the qualities of the ascertainment of the other world,

original: de ma nges pa'i nyes pa bshad pa ni ;
analyzed: de ma nges pa'i nyes pa bshad pa ni ;
translated: the fault of its nonascertainment is explained.

original: 'dod chags pa'i nor pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa'i nor pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The error of desire is said to be the error of desire.

original: 'jig rten pha rol nges na ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i tshogs las byang zhing grol bar byas pa'i don du 'bad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nges na ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i tshogs las byang zhing grol bar byas pa'i don du 'bad pa yin la /
translated: If there is a world beyond, then one strives to be purified and liberated from the mass of afflictions and so on.

original: de yang skye ba brgyud par goms pa mthar phyin pa na 'grub cing /
analyzed: de yang skye ba brgyud par goms pa mthar phyin pa na 'grub cing /
translated: Moreover, that is accomplished when the culmination of the practice through a succession of lives is reached.

original: bar du yang mi 'dod pa'i rang gi las la de rnams kyi rgyu ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bar du yang mi 'dod pa'i rang gi las la de rnams kyi rgyu ba 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: In the meantime, one prevents the occurrence of their causes, one‚Äôs own undesirable actions.

original: de ma nges na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nor pa byung rgyal du gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de ma nges na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nor pa byung rgyal du gzhag pa ni /
translated: If one is not certain about that, then one should not allow the occurrence of errors such as attachment.

original: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu phan pa mtha' dag dang mthong ba'i yon tan skye bo dam pa de dag nyams par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu phan pa mtha' dag dang mthong ba'i yon tan skye bo dam pa de dag nyams par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The result of both is the loss of all benefits and the loss of the good qualities that are seen in the holy beings.

original: dam pa'i lam du 'jug pa la ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i lam du 'jug pa la ni /
translated: To enter the path of the holy,

original: skye bo dam pa zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: one is called a holy being.

original: des na tha snyad la brten na ni tha snyad 'di la brten pa nyid bla'o //
analyzed: des na tha snyad la brten na ni tha snyad 'di la brten pa nyid bla'o //
translated: Therefore, if one relies on conventions, it is better to rely on this convention.

original: rmi lam du yang bde ba'i cha rkyen gyi rnam pa de 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang bde ba'i cha rkyen gyi rnam pa de 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Even in a dream, one desires the aspect of the condition of happiness.

original: 'jigs su rung ba'i rnam pa ni rtog par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba'i rnam pa ni rtog par mi 'dod do //
translated: The terrifying aspect is not asserted as imagination.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par byed pa nor pa yang ji ltar 'dod /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par byed pa nor pa yang ji ltar 'dod /
translated: If the establishment of the world beyond, such as the eyes, is mistaken, how is it asserted?

original: ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs la ni dbang po rnams glo bur du skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam gyi phyogs la ni dbang po rnams glo bur du skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In the position of mere awareness, the sense faculties arise adventitiously.

original: 'byung ba tsam rgyu yin pa la ni blo bzhin du ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'byung ba tsam rgyu yin pa la ni blo bzhin du ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro /
translated: In the cause of mere elements, there is the absurd consequence of being like the mind.

original: dbang po rnams ni blo bzhin du rigs mthun pa snga ma dang 'brel par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni blo bzhin du rigs mthun pa snga ma dang 'brel par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The sense faculties are not tenable as being related to a previous homogeneous cause, like the mind.

original: nad dang gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / rims kyis phal cher mig la sogs pa nyams pa srid pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nad dang gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / rims kyis phal cher mig la sogs pa nyams pa srid pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it is possible that the eyes and so on are mostly impaired by illness, harm from others, and fever.

original: de dag la yang dbang po 'thob pa ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de dag la yang dbang po 'thob pa ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the sense faculties are obtained again,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, In this way... and so on.

original: de skad @53b du yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de skad @53b du yang dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus it is said in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga:

original: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag rnam rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness that appears as objects, sentient beings, and the self

original: rab tu skye'o de don min //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu skye'o de don min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: arises clearly, but it is not those objects.

original: de bdag tu snang ba ni dbang por snang pa'o //
analyzed: de bdag tu snang ba ni dbang por snang pa'o //
translated: The appearance as the self is the appearance as the sense faculties.

original: gal te sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba nyid kyis rnam par rig pa'i nang du 'dus par rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te sngon po la sogs pa gsal ba nyid kyis rnam par rig pa'i nang du 'dus par rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable that blue and so on are included in consciousness because they are clearly evident.

original: rtag tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: But the sense faculties are always hidden.

original: dbang po go ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: dbang po go ji ltar snyam na /
translated: How can they be included in consciousness?

original: bden te lugs 'di la de ma thag ba'i nus pa'i khyad par nyid dbang po yin la /
analyzed: bden te lugs 'di la de ma thag ba'i nus pa'i khyad par nyid dbang po yin la /
translated: It is true that in this system the immediately preceding special power is the sense faculty.

original: de'ang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis rang bzhin yin pa des na skyon med do //
analyzed: de'ang de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis rang bzhin yin pa des na skyon med do //
translated: And since that is the nature of the immediately preceding condition, there is no fault.

original: dper na dbang po tha dad pa lta bur brtags pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes pa la dbang por snang ba zhes brjod do /
analyzed: dper na dbang po tha dad pa lta bur brtags pa de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis shes pa la dbang por snang ba zhes brjod do /
translated: Just as the different sense faculties are imagined to be, in the same way, the appearance as the sense faculties is said to be the nature of the consciousness that is imagined.

original: brtags pa'i dbang po yang bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dbang po yang bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam zhes brjod do //
translated: The imagined sense faculties are also said to be mere representations that depend on the power of habitual tendencies.

original: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i yod pa la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pas brtags pa'i yod pa la yang /
translated: Likewise, in terms of the existence imputed by the apprehension of an ‚ÄúI‚Äù and so on,

original: de snang ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de snang ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: the appearance of that and so on are posited.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa des na rnam pa de lta bu'i las kyi stobs kyis bag chags mi mthun par gyur pas /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa des na rnam pa de lta bu'i las kyi stobs kyis bag chags mi mthun par gyur pas /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means that because the eye and so on are based on the power of latent propensities, the power of karma is such that it creates latent propensities that are incompatible.

original: dbang po tshogs nyams par gyur kyang /
analyzed: dbang po tshogs nyams par gyur kyang /
translated: Even though the collection of faculties is impaired,

original: nges bskyed pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis dbang po nyams pa nyid las lus gzhan la mig la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges bskyed pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis dbang po nyams pa nyid las lus gzhan la mig la sogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the power of the latent propensities that generate the faculties does not contradict the arising of the eye and so on in another body due to the impairment of the faculties. This is the meaning.

original: da ni skabs su bab pa'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi gzhi 'dzugs pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni skabs su bab pa'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi gzhi 'dzugs pa ni de bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the establishment of the basis of the present topic of beginninglessness and endlessness is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: rnam pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i rgyu nye bar gnas pa gyur na yang mig la sogs pa nyams pa dang skye ba la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di nyid ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i rgyu nye bar gnas pa gyur na yang mig la sogs pa nyams pa dang skye ba la sogs pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äú This very aspect‚Äù means that even when such a cause is present, the eye and so on are impaired and arise and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rang gi ngo bos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rang gi ngo bos gnas pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is established by its own nature.

original: des na 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: des na 'khor ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, samsara is without beginning and end,

original: de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa snga ma snga ma mtha' dag ni snga ma snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa snga ma snga ma mtha' dag ni snga ma snga ma la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former part of it is dependent on the former part.

original: de lta na ni de kho na bzhin du tha ma yang med par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de lta na ni de kho na bzhin du tha ma yang med par 'gyur bas na /
translated: If that is so, then just as there is no beginning, there is also no end,

original: de kho na goms pa don med la /
analyzed: de kho na goms pa don med la /
translated: and it is pointless to cultivate reality.üîΩAnd it is fruitless to strive for another world for that purpose.üîΩAs long as there is noüîΩdirect perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.

original: de'i don du 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa yang 'bras bu med do snyam na /üîΩci srid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don du 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa yang 'bras bu med do snyam na / ci srid ces gsungs so //
translated: As long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.üîΩAs long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and end.

original: nor ba rab tu ma zhib //
analyzed: nor ba rab tu ma zhib //
translated: As long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,

original: zhes bya ba ni @54a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni @54a * //
translated: samsara is without beginning and end.

original: gnyis su med pa mngon sum tu ma gyur pa'o //üîΩde srid du ni zhes bya ba dus de srid gnas pa la ltos nas tham med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa mngon sum tu ma gyur pa'o //üîΩde srid du ni zhes bya ba dus de srid gnas pa la ltos nas tham med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As long as there is no direct perception of nonduality,üîΩsamsara is without beginning and

original: de ltar rnam par rig ba tsam la gnas pa la mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa 'gal ba med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rig ba tsam la gnas pa la mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pha rol sgrub pa 'gal ba med do zhes gnas so //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in maintaining that the one who abides in the mere representation of consciousness establishes the world of the eye, etc.

original: gal te bag chags kyi stobs la brten pas na de ltar 'gyur mod phyi rol don la go de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags kyi stobs la brten pas na de ltar 'gyur mod phyi rol don la go de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is so because of the power of the residual impressions, then how is it that the external object is understood?

original: mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúIs the eye, etc. true?‚Äù

original: bag chags kyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa nyid yin yang ngo //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa nyid yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is not the nature of the residual impressions,

original: phyi rol gyi don yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yin pa zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: the external object is said to be the collection of blue, etc.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du bden pa nyid dam /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du bden pa nyid dam /
translated: Or else, is the eye, etc. true as the nature of consciousness?

original: bems po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyi rol gyi don yin yang rung ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bems po'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyi rol gyi don yin yang rung ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, even though it is the external object, the nature of the inert?

original: rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yang nas yang 'jig pa dang / ma mthong ba'i stobs kyi dbang po la sogs pas nyams pa dag nyid las yang nas yang lus gzhan la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa yang nas yang 'jig pa dang / ma mthong ba'i stobs kyi dbang po la sogs pas nyams pa dag nyid las yang nas yang lus gzhan la 'byung ba'o //
translated: This nature is called beginningless because the eye, etc. are repeatedly destroyed and impaired by the power of not seeing the faculties, etc. and then again arise in another body.

original: gnyi ga la yang sems ni rgyun mi 'chad par grags pa dang mig la sogs pa rnams kyang mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang sems ni rgyun mi 'chad par grags pa dang mig la sogs pa rnams kyang mtha' med pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary meaning of both is that the mind is known to be uninterrupted and the eye, etc. are endless.

original: thog ma med pa nyid rnam par gnas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid rnam par gnas pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The establishment of beginninglessness is as before.

original: phyi rol la ni nor ba bdag tu lta ba yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol la ni nor ba bdag tu lta ba yin la /
translated: In the external, the error is the view of self.

original: bdag med pa mngon du byas pa ni mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa mngon du byas pa ni mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: The realization of selflessness is the culmination.

original: ji skad du srog chags bskyed pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par la sogs pa la dmigs pa med /
analyzed: ji skad du srog chags bskyed pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par la sogs pa la dmigs pa med /
translated: As it is said, the production of living beings and the distinctions that accord with them are not objects.üîΩThey are mere conceptualizations.

original: de rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes brjod pa de la smras pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes brjod pa de la smras pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To that, it is said: If that is so, then the view of self is not the cause of the afflictions, because the view of self is also a mere conceptualization.

original: sra ba nyid la sogs pas zhes bya bas ni 'jam pa nyid dam dring ba nyid la sogs pa ci ltar mthong ba'i khyad par rnams sdud pa'o //
analyzed: sra ba nyid la sogs pas zhes bya bas ni 'jam pa nyid dam dring ba nyid la sogs pa ci ltar mthong ba'i khyad par rnams sdud pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby means of solidity, etc.‚Äù includes the other specific qualities of earth, such as smoothness, roughness, etc.

original: drod gsher las skye ba zhes bya bas gseb nas drod gsher las skye ba dang / de'i rnam par 'gyur ba shing la sogs pa nas so //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba zhes bya bas gseb nas drod gsher las skye ba dang / de'i rnam par 'gyur ba shing la sogs pa nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom heat and moisture‚Äù refers to the growth of plants from the ground, and the growth of trees, etc., from their seeds.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom a womb‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings in the womb.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom transformation‚Äù refers to the spontaneous generation of living beings.

original: mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa yangs sa'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mngal du skye ba yin no //üîΩrdzus te skye ba la ni re zhig @54b log par rtogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa yangs sa'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mngal du skye ba yin no // rdzus te skye ba la ni re zhig @54b log par rtogs pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom a seed‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings from seeds.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom a cause‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings from a cause.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom a source‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings from a source.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúfrom a source‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings from a source.

analyzed: gal te rdo'i dkyil na yod pa'i srog chags kyang skye bar grags pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom a source‚Äù refers to the growth of living beings from a source.üîΩThe phrase

original: 'on kyang gzhan nyid brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan nyid brjod pa ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But the otherness is expressed by the words ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi srog chags kyis /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi srog chags kyis /
translated: By the living being who has that nature.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig gis bskyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid gcig gis bskyed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by its own nature.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni bstsags nas gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni bstsags nas gzhag pa'i zhes bya ba'o//
translated: This is expressed by the words ‚Äúhaving accumulated and stored.‚Äù

original: mgo dmar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgo dmar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúRed-headed‚Äù means

original: lus mdog gzhan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lus mdog gzhan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: having a body of one color and a head of another.

original: gzhan ni de dang mi 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni de dang mi 'dra ba'o //
translated: The other is not like that.

original: lus ser po ni mgo mdog gzhan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lus ser po ni mgo mdog gzhan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The yellow-bodied one has a head of another color.

original: de bzhin du lus sngon po la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus sngon po la sogs pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the blue-bodied one, and so on.

original: gal te las kyi dbye ba khas mi len na rnam pa de dag rgyu ci las byung snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te las kyi dbye ba khas mi len na rnam pa de dag rgyu ci las byung snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If you do not accept the division of karma, what is the cause of these different forms?

original: 'on te rgyu rigs mtshungs pa nyid las srog chags rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu rigs mtshungs pa nyid las srog chags rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the different forms of living beings arise from the mere similarity of causes,

original: nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúNever from a similar cause . . . ‚Äù

original: rang bzhin gcig ba can gyi padma dkar po la sogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa du ma dag bdag las dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi padma la sogs pa'i dbye ba nges pa med par 'ga' zhig gi tshe mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig ba can gyi padma dkar po la sogs pa'i sa bon la sogs pa du ma dag bdag las dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi padma la sogs pa'i dbye ba nges pa med par 'ga' zhig gi tshe mthong ba'am /
translated: The seed of a single lotus, for example, has many natures, but the lotus that arises from it is not seen to have many natures, such as white, red, and so on.üîΩ

original: 'dod pa yang ma yin nam ci /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang ma yin nam ci /
translated: Is it not the case that many seeds of a single nature, such as a white lotus, etc., are seen or desired at some times to have a definite differentiation of lotuses, etc., of a nature that is white, red, etc.?

original: 'dus byas pa las ni tha dad par 'gyur srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas pa las ni tha dad par 'gyur srid pa yin te /
translated: It is possible that they would be different from the compounded,

original: skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: like the fruit of the emblic myrobalan.

original: des na de'i rang bzhin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they have that nature.

original: chu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa bon rigs gcig las ni srog chags kyi dbye ba nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa bon rigs gcig las ni srog chags kyi dbye ba nges pa ma yin te /
translated: From a seed having the characteristics of water, etc., and of a single type, there is no definite differentiation of living beings,

original: 'on kyang sna tshogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sna tshogs pa kho na'o //
translated: but rather, they are just various.

original: des na gal te mthong ba'i khyad par yongs su rtogs par khas len na /
analyzed: des na gal te mthong ba'i khyad par yongs su rtogs par khas len na /
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that the difference in seeing is understood,

original: srog chags kyi dbye ba 'di la las nyid nges byed yin te rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags kyi dbye ba 'di la las nyid nges byed yin te rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then this differentiation of living beings is determined by karma itself, because of its various aspects.

original: skabs kyi mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The conclusion of this section is expressed by the words ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: sa la sogs pa'i sa gcig ci ltar g-yo bag can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su gyur pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i sa gcig ci ltar g-yo bag can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su gyur pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the earth, etc., are transformed into the nature of fluidity, etc.,

original: gzhan thams cad @55a * //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad @55a * //
translated: so too would all the other elements,

original: kyang 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kyang 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: gal te blo gnas kyang sngon yod pa'i mig 'chi ba'i dus na zhig pa'am gson bzhin du phyung ba des na /
analyzed: gal te blo gnas kyang sngon yod pa'i mig 'chi ba'i dus na zhig pa'am gson bzhin du phyung ba des na /
translated: If the mind is stable, then the eye that existed previously would be destroyed at the time of death or would be extracted while one is still alive.

original: srid pa 'dir 'bras bu la re ba rgyang ring ngo zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa 'dir 'bras bu la re ba rgyang ring ngo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the hope for a result in this existence is far away.

original: 'di las 'das nas ring du lon pa yang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di las 'das nas ring du lon pa yang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: We have already said that it is the producer of what has passed away a long time ago.

original: de lta ma yin na ma la gcig nas skyes ba gnyis kyi mig g-yo bag can dang / g-yo bag can ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ma la gcig nas skyes ba gnyis kyi mig g-yo bag can dang / g-yo bag can ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the distinction between the two eyes of a twin born from the same mother would not exist.

original: blo'i 'du byed pa las rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: blo'i 'du byed pa las rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the distinction is due to the formation of the mind,

original: blo yang rnam pa thams cad du 'gags par mthong ba'i der tshul ji ltar yin /
analyzed: blo yang rnam pa thams cad du 'gags par mthong ba'i der tshul ji ltar yin /
translated: How can the mind be seen to cease in every way?

original: de ci'i phyir ci ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i blo de ma thag ba'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i mig kyang mig gi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ci ltar 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i blo de ma thag ba'i rkyen yin pa de bzhin du 'gags nas yun ring du lon pa'i mig kyang mig gi rgyu yin no //
translated: Why? How can the mind that has ceased long ago be the immediately preceding condition of the present mind? In the same way, the eye that has ceased long ago is the cause of the present eye.

original: de pas mig la sogs pas ni rang gi rigs snga ma la rag las pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de pas mig la sogs pas ni rang gi rigs snga ma la rag las pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye, etc. are dependent only on their own previous type.üîΩTherefore, other worlds are certainly established.

original: de bas na 'jig rten gzhan dag gdon mi za bar grub po //üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten gzhan dag gdon mi za bar grub po // gzhan yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, the faculties that are based on the mental consciousness follow the formative forces of the other world, because the faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness. The faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.

original: de'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni'o //
analyzed: de'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni'o //
translated: The faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.üîΩThe faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the cause of the faculties, because the faculties are generated by the mental consciousness.

original: rang gi 'bras bu byed pa ni des skul ba kho nas khyad par du yul rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu byed pa ni des skul ba kho nas khyad par du yul rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculties are the effect of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is the dominant condition of the faculties.

original: gang las de rnams nyams pas yid kyi blo nyams par dogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang las de rnams nyams pas yid kyi blo nyams par dogs pa'am /
translated: The mental consciousness is the

original: spang bar 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa 'gog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang bar 'gyur ba mi 'dod pa 'gog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the undesirable, that is, the refutation of the fact that they are abandoned, is stated in the words ‚Äúbecause the mental consciousness itself . . . ‚Äù

original: yang na dbang po rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas 'bras bu byed par mthong gi /
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten nas 'bras bu byed par mthong gi /
translated: Or else, the faculties are seen to produce their effects in dependence on the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni de la brten nas byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni de la brten nas byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: But the mental consciousness is not seen to produce its effects in dependence on them.

original: des na dbang po la sogs pa ni shes pa kho na las yin par brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang po la sogs pa ni shes pa kho na las yin par brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the faculties and so on should be considered to exist only in consciousness.

original: dbus kyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: dbus kyi gnas skabs na /
translated: In the middle period,

original: byed pa de la rag las par mthong ba'i phyir skye ba dang por yang de las rag las par brtag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdes na 'di dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na las sam /

translated: because we see that their activity depends on that, we should consider that in the first period, their existence also depends on that.

original: rang gi rigs las skye ba yin gyis dang chu la sogs bdag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rigs las skye ba yin gyis dang chu la sogs bdag las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these faculties are born only from the mental consciousness or from their own class, and not from themselves, as in the case of water-crystals and so on.

original: des na de tsam las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: des na de tsam las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words ‚Äúnot from that alone‚Äù is that they are not born from themselves alone.

original: @55b mthong ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du spang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @55b mthong ba nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du spang ba ma yin no //
translated: But seeing itself is not to be abandoned at all.

original: 'jug pa gnyis pa la ni rnam 'grel 'di nyid 'dri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa gnyis pa la ni rnam 'grel 'di nyid 'dri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the second chapter, this very commentary will be asked.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same is stated by ‚Äúor else.‚ÄùüîΩThe collection of that is the collection of earth, water, etc.üîΩThe collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.

analyzed: de'i tshogs pa zhes bya ba la de'i sgras ni sa dang chu la sogs pa gzung ngo // dbugs phyung rngub la sogs pa ni zhes sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang po yang ngo //
translated: The collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.üîΩThe collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.üîΩThe collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.üîΩThe collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.

analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten rgyar 'phan pa'i 'dod pa skyong ba ste / de ltar yin yang nged kyi 'khor ba la chad pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
