original: ci ste de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: The collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.üîΩThe collection of that is the collection of the elements such as wind, fire, etc.

original: 'khor ba yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The collection of that is the

original: chos mngon pa las 'khor ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni log par lta bas nyams pas na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chad pa dang / de bsal bas de dag phyir 'brel ba'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las 'khor ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid la brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni log par lta bas nyams pas na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chad pa dang / de bsal bas de dag phyir 'brel ba'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: The cutting of the roots of virtue by wrong views, the reconnecting of those roots of virtue when the wrong views are eliminated,

original: chad pa spangs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po rtul bas na 'bras bu gnyis pa las nyams pa dang / skal pa mnyam pa'i sde las nyams pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: chad pa spangs pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / dbang po rtul bas na 'bras bu gnyis pa las nyams pa dang / skal pa mnyam pa'i sde las nyams pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ste /
translated: the degeneration of the result of nonreturn due to the weakness of the faculties, and the death and transmigration of those who have degenerated from the group of those with homogeneous character.

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i don dag yin pa dang / skye ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i skye ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba'i don dag yin pa dang / skye ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa'i skye ba rnams so //
translated: These are the meanings of the term death, and they are the births that fully grasp other births.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dbang po drug pa ni yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid dbang po drug pa ni yod do //
translated: The six sense faculties that are the nature of the mind consciousness that is the equivalent immediately preceding condition exist.

original: de tsam la brten pa'i shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de tsam la brten pa'i shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is based on that alone is the mental consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa la mi brten pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la mi brten pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not based on the eyes and so on, it is conceptual.

original: 'di la 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i khyad par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba'i khyad par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the differences between death and rebirth is as follows:

original: btang snyoms na ni skye 'chi dag //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms na ni skye 'chi dag // ces bya ba ste /
translated: Death and rebirth occur when there is equanimity.üîΩThe Abhidharmako≈õa explains the meaning of this verse as follows:

original: btang snyoms kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog par yod par gyur pa na 'chi ba dang skye ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ni chos mngon pa mdzod nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog par yod par gyur pa na 'chi ba dang skye ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ni chos mngon pa mdzod nas bshad pa'o //
translated: When the mode of equanimity exists, death and rebirth occur.

original: gzhan du ni srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod na skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes nges par byas so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni srid pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod na skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa yin no zhes nges par byas so //
translated: Elsewhere, it is determined that when the conception of existence exists, one takes rebirth.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'khor ba yin no zhes skabs bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa nyid 'khor ba yin no zhes skabs bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This establishes the point that conception itself is samsara.

original: lhag ma ni zhar yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhar yin no //
translated: The rest is commentary.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni des na yid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni des na yid ces gsungs so //
translated: The explanation of that is: therefore, it is called mind.

original: skabs kyis na @56a * //
analyzed: skabs kyis na @56a * //
translated: In the context of the verse,

original: rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means that which has conception.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i 'byung ba la brten pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i 'byung ba la brten pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not based on the primary elements that are the nature of the eye and so on.

original: de la brten nas 'khor ba nyid du mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'khor ba nyid du mi 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and on that basis, samsara itself is untenable.

original: rnam 'grel du yang yid ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam 'grel du yang yid ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi rnam pa'i 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma yin gyi /
translated: And in the Pramiirwvarttika it is explained that the mind does not depend on the elements in the form of the body together with the sense faculties,

original: 'byung ba rnams nyid ni de la brten pa dang des na 'khor ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams nyid ni de la brten pa dang des na 'khor ba yin par bshad do //
translated: but rather that the elements themselves depend on it, and that is why they are in samsara.

original: 'jug pa dang po la ni sbyar bslab kho na'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang po la ni sbyar bslab kho na'o //
translated: In the first stage of engagement, there is only the training in the application.

original: gal te bde bar gnas pa'i gnas skabs dag cu bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba las yid bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te bde bar gnas pa'i gnas skabs dag cu bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba las yid bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If one thinks that since the discrimination of mental pleasure, etc. arises from the experience of pleasure, etc. in the state of comfortable abiding,

original: ci ltar 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma yin te /
translated: it is not based on the elements,

original: de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because when they change, it changes.

original: de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, In the same way.

original: tshul de lta bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: tshul de lta bu nyid du'o //
translated: In just that way.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: bshad pa ga ba zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam bar 'gyur bar bya ba dbang po lnga'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa lus de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa ga ba zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam bar 'gyur bar bya ba dbang po lnga'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa lus de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on the body, which is the nature of the collection of the five sense faculties that are to be transformed by the mental consciousness.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: khyed kyi lugs gang zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bus bstan pa de yang rgyud nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis de la rtogs pa bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs gang zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bus bstan pa de yang rgyud nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bshad zin pa'i tshul gyis de la rtogs pa bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: that which is taught as the result of mental consciousness is also the result of mental consciousness in the continuum, because it is established by the previously explained method.

original: des na rgyud pa chol na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni shes pa snga ma nyid la brten nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyud pa chol na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni shes pa snga ma nyid la brten nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the continuum is severed, mental consciousness arises in dependence on a prior consciousness.

original: 'on te de'ang lus la brten par brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te de'ang lus la brten par brjod na /
translated: But if you say that it is based on the body,

original: lus kyang de bzhin du sems la brten pas na mtha' thug pa med do //
analyzed: lus kyang de bzhin du sems la brten pas na mtha' thug pa med do //
translated: then since the body is also based on the mind, there is no end.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid las so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid las so //
translated: It is from that very mental consciousness.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni som btang ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni som btang ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Elsewhere means in the state of suspended animation.

original: gzhan du mthong ba des na me de nyid las ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du mthong ba des na me de nyid las ma yin no //
translated: But it is not seen in any other way than that.

original: dbang bo ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba las gzhan du ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: dbang bo ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba las gzhan du ma mthong ngo //
translated: The sense faculty is not seen in any way other than as a transformation created by the mental consciousness.

original: des na mig la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: des na mig la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho na las yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on are only from the mental consciousness.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed ba ni dbang bo la sogs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed ba ni dbang bo la sogs pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by ‚Äúall of the sense faculties and so on.‚Äù

original: des na yid kyi rnam bar shes pa la brten pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs ba'o //
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam bar shes pa la brten pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that they are only based on the mental consciousness.

original: du ba de me de nyid las so //
analyzed: du ba de me de nyid las so //
translated: That smoke is from that fire.

original: mngon sum tshad ma 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma 'ga' yang med //
translated: There is no direct valid knowledge at all.

original: ces @56b pa ni de kho nar te /
analyzed: ces @56b pa ni de kho nar te /
translated: This is in reality.

original: yul dang dus gzhan las mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan las mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception does not engage with other objects and times.

original: kun rdzob tu ni dper na du ba me sngon du 'gro ba can du rtogs ba de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du rtog pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstod pa
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni dper na du ba me sngon du 'gro ba can du rtogs ba de bzhin du skabs su bab pa la yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid du rtog pa yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstod pa
translated: In the conventional sense, just as smoke is understood to be preceded by fire, in the same way, in the present context, it is understood that mental consciousness is preceded by the other five consciousnesses.

original: ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the verse is summarized.

original: dper na yongs su mthong ba de du ba gzhan du gcig tu byed pa'i ngo shes pa ste /
analyzed: dper na yongs su mthong ba de du ba gzhan du gcig tu byed pa'i ngo shes pa ste /
translated: For example, when one sees smoke, one recognizes it as fire.

original: thams cad gcig tu lhag par zhen pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad gcig tu lhag par zhen pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one conceives of everything as one.

original: dang po'i skye ba ni byis pa'i gnas skabs kyi lus so //
analyzed: dang po'i skye ba ni byis pa'i gnas skabs kyi lus so //
translated: The first birth is the body in the state of childhood.

original: der 'byung ba'i ngang tshul mig la sogs pa rnams ni yid kyi 'gyur ba yin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: der 'byung ba'i ngang tshul mig la sogs pa rnams ni yid kyi 'gyur ba yin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The eye and so on that arise from that are understood to be transformations of the mind.

original: mig la sogs pa ngo shes pa de dag ni zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ngo shes pa de dag ni zhes 'brel to //
translated: Those who recognize the eye and so on are connected.

original: ci ltar ngo shes pa dag ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar ngo shes pa dag ce na /
translated: How do they recognize?

original: g-yer bag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yid dang rjes su mthun par rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: g-yer bag la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yid dang rjes su mthun par rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is in accordance with the mind that is endowed with haughtiness, etc.

original: dbang po de dag ni de lta bu nyid de zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: dbang po de dag ni de lta bu nyid de zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du'o //
translated: Those faculties are just like that, i.e., in accordance with the mind consciousness.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni me'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni me'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Its effect is the effect of fire,

original: du ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: i.e., smoke.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yid kyi rnam bar 'gyur ba nyid du mthong ba 'khrul ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yid kyi rnam bar 'gyur ba nyid du mthong ba 'khrul ba med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the transformation of the mind is seen in this way, i.e., without error.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de las yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de las yin no //
translated: It is from that mind consciousness.

original: bu la sogs pa'i dbang po der te de la brten par ro //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa'i dbang po der te de la brten par ro //
translated: The faculties of the eyes, etc. are there, i.e., in the mind.

original: 'on te bu la sogs pa'i mig med par gyur kyang gdon mi za bar yid 'gyur ba ma yin ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te bu la sogs pa'i mig med par gyur kyang gdon mi za bar yid 'gyur ba ma yin ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if the eyes, etc. were absent, the mind would not necessarily be transformed.

original: de la brten pa ma yin no snyam na /üîΩnges pa gnyi ga la yang med //
analyzed: de la brten pa ma yin no snyam na / nges pa gnyi ga la yang med //
translated: Therefore, they are not based on it.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: In both cases, there is no certainty.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa de yang yid kyi rten ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de yang yid kyi rten ma yin no //
translated: And that eye, etc. is not the support of mind.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚Äú Because‚Äù is the reason.

original: de lta yin mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú But if that is so, what is the problem?‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú The six consciousnesses, such as the visual, etc.‚Äù

original: rten 'ga' zhig dang bar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba ni thams cad rten dang bcas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rten 'ga' zhig dang bar 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba ni thams cad rten dang bcas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚Äú There must be some support in between‚Äù because all are seen to have a support.

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid med pa'i phyir rten gyis ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid med pa'i phyir rten gyis ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Necessarily‚Äù means ‚ÄúWhat is the use of a support, since there is no heaviness?‚Äù

original: 'o na te mngon par zhen na zhes bya ba 'chel na'o //
analyzed: 'o na te mngon par zhen na zhes bya ba 'chel na'o //
translated: ‚Äú But if you insist‚Äù means ‚Äúif you are attached to that idea.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang ngo //üîΩkha cig las @57a * //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang ngo // kha cig las @57a * //
translated: ‚Äú And that‚Äù means ‚Äúeven though that is so.‚Äù

original: ni de'i tshe yang zhes 'don to //
analyzed: ni de'i tshe yang zhes 'don to //
translated: Some read ‚Äúat that time‚Äù for ‚Äúif you insist.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gi phyir khyed kyi lugs kyis thams cad rten dang bcas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba gang gi phyir khyed kyi lugs kyis thams cad rten dang bcas pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause, according to your system, all have a support.‚Äù

original: blo gnas ba gang yin pa de'i rten khyad par nges par ma bzung ba las kyi rang bzhin 'ga' gang yin pa de dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gnas ba gang yin pa de'i rten khyad par nges par ma bzung ba las kyi rang bzhin 'ga' gang yin pa de dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: The support of the mind is not necessarily a special kind of substance, but is the cause of the sense faculties, not all of them,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na dbang po rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na dbang po rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formless realm has no sense faculties.

original: las kyi rang bzhin de yang blo nyid la brten pa yin gyi dbang po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin de yang blo nyid la brten pa yin gyi dbang po la ni ma yin no //
translated: And that substance is the support of the mind, not the support of the sense faculties.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir blo las dbang po yin gyi dbang po dag las ni blo ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir blo las dbang po yin gyi dbang po dag las ni blo ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties arise from the mind, but the mind does not arise from the sense faculties.

original: 'di ga las shen /
analyzed: 'di ga las shen /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems pa'i las dang zhes yid dang des bskyed pa lus dang ngag gi las so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang zhes yid dang des bskyed pa lus dang ngag gi las so zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the karma of volition and the karma arisen from volition are mental karma and physical and verbal karma respectively.

original: de dag ni sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are preceded by volition.

original: yang ji ltar tshig 'di las dbang po la brten pa ma yin ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar tshig 'di las dbang po la brten pa ma yin ba nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do you know that the sense faculties are not the support of the mind?

original: sems ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúVolition is the mind.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is that?

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says: ‚Äúthat also. ‚Äù

original: 'di dang 'di yod pa'am bya'o zhes blo rnam par 'gyur pa ni snga ma dang mtshams sbyor ba ni rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di yod pa'am bya'o zhes blo rnam par 'gyur pa ni snga ma dang mtshams sbyor ba ni rang bzhin can no //
translated: The mind is transformed by the thought: ‚ÄúThis exists, that exists, this should be done, that should be done. ‚Äù The mind is natural in the sense that it is connected with the past.

original: blo nyid la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: blo nyid la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It arises in dependence on the mind itself,

original: de'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the attributes of the mind.üîΩIt is not based on the body,

original: lus la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: lus la brten pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: that is, it is not based on the body together with the faculties.

original: 'on kyang dbang po dag ni sems la brten ba'i blo la brten pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dbang po dag ni sems la brten ba'i blo la brten pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the faculties are based on the mind, that is, on the mind that is based on the mind.

original: gal te de ltar na gzugs med pa'i khams na sems yod pa'i phyir dbang po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gzugs med pa'i khams na sems yod pa'i phyir dbang po skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then in the formless realm, since the mind exists, it follows that the faculties would arise.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: He says: ‚Äúthat also. ‚Äù

original: lus de la mngon par dga' ba ni dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus de la mngon par dga' ba ni dga' ba nyid do //
translated: The body is delighted in that it is delighted.

original: de'i phyir blo dang dbang po la sogs ba la ni yid nyid rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo dang dbang po la sogs ba la ni yid nyid rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, the mind, the sense faculties, and so on are caused by the self-sufficient self.

original: des da lta ba'i yid rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin can gyis snga ma snga ma'i skye ba 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des da lta ba'i yid rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin can gyis snga ma snga ma'i skye ba 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: The present mind, which has the nature of discursive thought, projects the next birth.

original: de skad bshad pa na snga ma bzhin du skye ba phyi mar ci ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa ni gal te nga'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skad bshad pa na snga ma bzhin du skye ba phyi mar ci ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa ni gal te nga'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When this is explained, the doubt arises, ‚ÄúHow will the next birth come about, as before?‚Äù

original: nga'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /üîΩnga yid 'dzin ba la sogs pa yang bdag tu rtog ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste / nga yid 'dzin ba la sogs pa yang bdag tu rtog ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif I say ‚ÄòI‚Äô‚Äù is a reference to the self.üîΩThe phrase ‚ÄúI think‚Äù is a reference to the self.üîΩThe thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is a form of grasping the self.üîΩIn every way, the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the cause of grasping the self.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa de'i drung nas da lta nga'i skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa de'i drung nas da lta nga'i skye ba yin no //
translated: From that, the present birth comes about.

original: gtan tshigs nges 'di las @57b snga ma de dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nges 'di las @57b snga ma de dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: From this reason, the previous birth is inferred.

original: 'dis ni bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa ni skye ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa de'i gtso bo'i rgyu yin par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa ni skye ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin pa de'i gtso bo'i rgyu yin par brjod do //
translated: This passage explains that the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the primary cause of grasping another birth.

original: yid ni zhas bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa ste /üîΩlus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid ni zhas bya ba ni rtsod pa gnyis pa ste / lus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The second dispute is stated in the line: ‚ÄúThe mind is not the body.‚ÄùüîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position is that the body and mind are mutually dependent.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam 'grel gyi byed pa po gnyis kyis lan 'debs so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam 'grel gyi byed pa po gnyis kyis lan 'debs so //
translated: The two lines, ‚ÄúThe body is not the mind‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe mind is not the body‚Äù respectively reply to these two disputes.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bar ro //üîΩdon 'di nyid sbyor ba'i rgyas 'debs pa ni gang zhig ces ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bar ro // don 'di nyid sbyor ba'i rgyas 'debs pa ni gang zhig ces ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúChange‚Äù means change into a different state.üîΩThe meaning of this is also expressed in the commentary, which states, ‚ÄúIf the mind were the body, the mind would be subject to change.‚Äù

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyang byed pa'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi sems kyang byed pa'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes phyogs kyi chos bsdu ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The mind in its final state is not different from the mind in its initial state in terms of its nature of being a creator. This is the way to understand the inclusion of the property of the subject in the proof.

original: ma nges ba nyid ni de ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges ba nyid ni de ma yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is not indeterminate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na 'gal ba'i nyes pa yang med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na 'gal ba'i nyes pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of contradiction.

original: ma grub ba'i nyes ba spong ba ni mdun na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma grub ba'i nyes ba spong ba ni mdun na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fault of the reason not being established will be addressed later.

original: 'di la lan ni zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma 'chad pa'i mig la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma 'chad pa'i mig la sogs pa ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas in the case of the eyes, etc.‚Äù is an example of a dissimilar case.

original: dar 'dzin ba nyid 'di'i mtshan nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dar 'dzin ba nyid 'di'i mtshan nyid yin pas na de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since the possession of form is the defining characteristic of this realm, it is called that.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'i skabs kyis brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'i skabs kyis brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: This is stated in terms of the realm of samsara.

original: rnam par bcad pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not stated in terms of the meaning of the word ‚Äúform‚Äù itself.

original: dbang po la brten pa'i rnam bar rtog pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i rnam bar rtog pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no conceptual thought that is not based on the sense faculties.

original: dbang po dang bral ba gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs med ba de yang srid par lung las ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po dang bral ba gzugs med pa'i khams na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa de yod pa'i phyir dang / gzugs med ba de yang srid par lung las ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: And because that formless realm that is devoid of the sense faculties is also said to exist in the scriptures,

original: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i lung ni blang bar bya ba nyid du grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i lung ni blang bar bya ba nyid du grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the scriptures that are completely pure in the three respects are established as being worthy of acceptance.

original: yang na gzugs med pa'i khams srid bar rjes su dpag pas bstan ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzugs med pa'i khams srid bar rjes su dpag pas bstan ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is because the existence of the formless realm is indicated by inference.

original: gang dang gang goms par bya ba de ni gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang goms par bya ba de ni gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is cultivated becomes clear,

original: 'dod ma'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod ma'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: like the image of a woman.

original: lus kyi rnam pa dang bral ba btang snyoms tsam gyi sems kyang gzugs kyi 'dod chags zhi bar 'dod pas goms par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa dang bral ba btang snyoms tsam gyi sems kyang gzugs kyi 'dod chags zhi bar 'dod pas goms par bya ba yin no //
translated: The mind of equanimity, which is free from the image of the body, is also cultivated by one who desires to pacify attachment to form.

original: de la de dag thabs ma yin pa'i sems kyis mngon par mi sbyor ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de dag thabs ma yin pa'i sems kyis mngon par mi sbyor ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that they do not apply themselves with a non-skillful mind to that,

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i spyod pa med pas na thams cad kyi blo nyid kyas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i spyod pa med pas na thams cad kyi blo nyid kyas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not without that kind of practice, since they are always holding the mind.

original: thabs ma yin pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that they are without skill,

original: gal te 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gtan 'chad pa ma @58a * //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gtan 'chad pa ma @58a * //
translated: because even if the suffering of cyclic existence is not completely eliminated,

original: yin pa de lta na yang yun ring por da kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir de tsam nyid kyis don chen po yin no //
analyzed: yin pa de lta na yang yun ring por da kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir de tsam nyid kyis don chen po yin no //
translated: it is still a great benefit just by that, since they are not practicing for a long time.

original: de lta na yang sems ma rangs na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang sems ma rangs na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even so, if the mind is not pleased, it is said.

original: dus mtshungs pa dag ci skad phan tshun rgyu yin snyam na /
analyzed: dus mtshungs pa dag ci skad phan tshun rgyu yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that similar times are mutually causes,

original: gnyi ga phan tshun zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gnyi ga phan tshun zhes gsungs so ;
translated: Both are mutually, it is said.

original: / phan tshun phan 'dogs pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: / phan tshun phan 'dogs pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the mutual benefit:

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can dag gi tshogs pa ni phung po'i tshogs pa gzhan las zhes bya ba ni snga ma las so //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can dag gi tshogs pa ni phung po'i tshogs pa gzhan las zhes bya ba ni snga ma las so //
translated: The collection of the two, which are the causes of each other, is different from the collection of other aggregates, that is, from the former.

original: snga mas bskyed pa'i tshogs pa des kyang ngo //
analyzed: snga mas bskyed pa'i tshogs pa des kyang ngo //
translated: The collection generated by the former also is that.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: da lta bas snga ma'i lus dang yid gang yin pa de ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: da lta bas snga ma'i lus dang yid gang yin pa de ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin te /
translated: The body and mind of the former moment are the causes of each other,

original: de'i tshogs las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshogs las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are born from the collection of the two.

original: de bzhin du de'i snga ma 'phangs pa na yang de'i snga ma 'phen pa'i phyir thog ma med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i snga ma 'phangs pa na yang de'i snga ma 'phen pa'i phyir thog ma med pa kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, since the former impels the latter, it is beginningless.

original: da lta pa las phyi ma lus dang yid gang yin pa de'i phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid kyang tshogs pa las skyes pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: da lta pa las phyi ma lus dang yid gang yin pa de'i phan tshun gyi rgyu can nyid kyang tshogs pa las skyes pa nyid las yin no //
translated: The body and mind of the latter moment, which are the causes of each other, are also born from the collection of the two.

original: de bzhin der phyi ma phyi ma 'phen pas mtha' med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin der phyi ma phyi ma 'phen pas mtha' med pa kho na'o //
translated: Since the latter impels the latter, it is also endless.

original: dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúJust like the central case‚Äù means

original: gang la ltos pas snga phyi bsam pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang la ltos pas snga phyi bsam pa byas pa ste /
translated: that the prior and subsequent are imagined in dependence on each other.

original: ci ltar de phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩlus tsam la brten pa dgag pa la 'thad pa gzhan brjod pa ni gal te lus nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar de phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to // lus tsam la brten pa dgag pa la 'thad pa gzhan brjod pa ni gal te lus nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that they are the causes of each other, just like the central case.üîΩIn order to refute the body as the basis, another argument is stated:

original: de ni lus kyi rten ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi rten ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: If the body itself were the basis of the self, then the self would not be the basis of the body.

original: dus kyi dbye bas rang bzhin tha dad pa bzhin dang gzhan du gyur pa ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi dbye bas rang bzhin tha dad pa bzhin dang gzhan du gyur pa ni rim pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin a different time‚Äù is that the self would be different from the body in terms of its nature.

original: 'di la 'bras bu'i rim pa la ni rgyu'i rim pas khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu'i rim pa la ni rgyu'i rim pas khyab pa ste /
translated: In this case, the order of the effect is pervaded by the order of the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car byed par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car byed par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, it would follow, absurdly, that all effects would be produced simultaneously,

original: khyad par du byar med pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde nyid brjod pa ni de la re zhi gces bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du byar med pa ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // de nyid brjod pa ni de la re zhi gces bya ba'o //
translated: because that which has nothing to distinguish it cannot be said to depend on the simultaneous assemblage of causes.üîΩThis is what is being said:

original: 'dis ni khyab ba brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab ba brjod do //
translated: This is stating the pervasion.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa ni //üîΩlus las rim gyis blo 'gyur na //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa ni // lus las rim gyis blo 'gyur na //
translated: The reason is stated:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the mind gradually changes from the body‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te gang rim pa can de ni rgyu rim pa can gyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te gang rim pa can de ni rgyu rim pa can gyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning: Whatever is gradual is produced by gradual causes,

original: dper na rim can gyi 'bras bu gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rim can gyi 'bras bu gzhan bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the other gradual effects.

original: yid kyi blo yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi blo yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mind of the intellect also arises gradually.

original: 'di lus las 'byung bar khas len na nges par lus kyi rim pa gsal bar byed cing rjod par byed de ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lus las 'byung bar khas len na nges par lus kyi rim pa gsal bar byed cing rjod par byed de ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is accepted that this [mind] arises from the body, then it is definitely stated, expressed, and shown that the body is gradual.

original: gtan tshigs @58b ma grub pa nyid spong ba ni yid kyi blo 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs @58b ma grub pa nyid spong ba ni yid kyi blo 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason is not established. This is refuted by ‚ÄúThis mind of the intellect. . . .‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na te gang rim can ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na te gang rim can ma yin na'o //
translated: If it were not so, that is, if it were not gradual,

original: skye ba ril zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba ril zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúall arising‚Äù means up to destruction.

original: skye ba gzhan la ni rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan la ni rtsod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a dispute about other arisings.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù is another possibility.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gnas skabs mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gnas skabs mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression used here is ‚Äúnot apprehending the state.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gnas skabs can ma rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas skabs can ma rtogs she na /
translated: Why is it that the state-possessor is not apprehended?

original: khyab bya gnas skabs rnams gzung ba med par gnas skabs can gzhan khyab byed du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab bya gnas skabs rnams gzung ba med par gnas skabs can gzhan khyab byed du mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without apprehending the states, which are the pervaded, one does not apprehend the state-possessor, which is the pervader.

original: de'i gnas skabs khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin du'o //üîΩdes na 'di rtogs kyang rang dbang du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin du'o // des na 'di rtogs kyang rang dbang du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The state-possessor is the pervader, and the states are the pervaded.üîΩTherefore, even though it is apprehended, it is apprehended as independent.

original: de lta na yang 'di gnas skabs can nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di gnas skabs can nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But in that case, it is apprehended as the state-possessor.

original: de'i zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i zhes gsungs te /
translated: To this he says,

original: khyab byed kyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: khyab byed kyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe state-possessor is the pervader.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba khyab byed du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba khyab byed du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means as the pervaded.

original: de nyid ni khyab byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni khyab byed do //
translated: That is the pervader.

original: gzhan nyid ni khyab byed ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni khyab byed ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Difference is not the pervader.

original: spyir brjod na khyad par la sbyor ba ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyir brjod na khyad par la sbyor ba ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In general, the application of a particular to a universal is as follows.

original: gnas skabs can 'di'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs can 'di'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf this‚Äù is the state-possessor.

original: de las rang bzhin gzhan ni khyab byed nyid las rang bzhin gzhan du'o //
analyzed: de las rang bzhin gzhan ni khyab byed nyid las rang bzhin gzhan du'o //
translated: The nature that is different from that is the nature that is different from the pervader.

original: khyab byed nyid du ma rtogs pa des na gnas skabs can de la'o //
analyzed: khyab byed nyid du ma rtogs pa des na gnas skabs can de la'o //
translated: Since it is not understood as the pervader, it is in that case.

original: de'i phyir na dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i rtog pa gzhan skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i rtog pa gzhan skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the conception that has another time arises from another.

original: gnas skabs can ni dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas skabs can ni dmigs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The case is not the object of observation. This is the meaning.

original: ma grub pa spangs nas mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa spangs nas mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having abandoned the nonestablishment, the summary is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ma grub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gang zhig rim pa dang ldan pa de rim pa ma yin pa las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ma grub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin gang zhig rim pa dang ldan pa de rim pa ma yin pa las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not like that, therefore, whatever nature of thing that is in a sequence does not arise from that which is not in a sequence.

original: des na gang zhig rim pa dang ldan pa de ni rim pa dang ldan pa kho na las skye ba yin no zhes khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang zhig rim pa dang ldan pa de ni rim pa dang ldan pa kho na las skye ba yin no zhes khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, whatever is in a sequence arises only from that which is in a sequence. This is the pervasion.

original: de mi bzod nas gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: de mi bzod nas gal te zhes smras so //
translated: Unable to bear that, he says, ‚ÄúIf.‚Äù

original: tha mi dad pa nyid rigs gcig ba nyid do //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid rigs gcig ba nyid do //
translated: Sameness is the same type.

original: mi 'dra ba ni rigs mi gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni rigs mi gcig pa ste /
translated: Different means not of the same type.

original: me dang du ba bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: me dang du ba bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is like fire and smoke.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the conclusion.

original: mi 'dra ba'i phyir rim pa ma yin pa las 'bras bu rim can skye ba ma yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rigs pa'i stobs kyis yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i tshe nyid ni skad cig dang po nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i phyir rim pa ma yin pa las 'bras bu rim can skye ba ma yin no zhes ni mi brjod kyi 'on kyang rigs pa'i stobs kyis yin no zhes bya ba'o // de'i tshe nyid ni skad cig dang po nyid do //
translated: We do not say that a sequential effect does not arise from a nonsequential cause, because of being different, but rather because of the force of reasoning.üîΩAt that time means at the first moment.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po'i cho'o //üîΩyongs su rdzogs pa ni don bya @59a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba skad cig ma dang po'i cho'o // yongs su rdzogs pa ni don bya @59a * //
translated: At that time means at the time of the first moment.

original: ba mtha' dag byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba mtha' dag byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fully complete means that all objects to be known have been known.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnyis pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnyis pa'i tshe'o //
translated: At another time means at the time of the second moment.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bu gzhan gyi tshe ci ste ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bu gzhan gyi tshe ci ste ma yin snyam na /
translated: Even so, why is the effect not at another time?

original: gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it were, he says,

original: 'bras bu'i dus zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa'i dus de skad cig gang gi mod la 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa'i dus de skad cig gang gi mod la 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The time of the effect is the time of benefitting the effect, the time when the effect is produced.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni de'i dus 'dzin pa'o //
translated: At that time is the holding of that time.

original: gal te rol gyi nang du gyur pas kyang byed pa'i phyir rgyu dmigs pa ma nges pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rol gyi nang du gyur pas kyang byed pa'i phyir rgyu dmigs pa ma nges pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If the cause is not ascertained because it is in the process of ceasing,

original: bsam pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te /
translated: this is the intention.

original: gang gis de'i rjes su 'brangs pas ma mthong ba yang de ltar gzhag par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis de'i rjes su 'brangs pas ma mthong ba yang de ltar gzhag par 'gyur ba /
translated: If it is not seen because it is in the process of ceasing, it is posited in that way.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gdon mi za ba kho nar la lar dmigs ba dang gang du mthong ba der ni dus dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gdon mi za ba kho nar la lar dmigs ba dang gang du mthong ba der ni dus dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: The cause and effect are definitely seen somewhere, and where they are seen, there is conformity with time.

original: der rtogs pa lhur byas pa brjod pa ni gal te rtogs na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der rtogs pa lhur byas pa brjod pa ni gal te rtogs na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement emphasizing the realization is ‚ÄúIf it is realized.‚Äù

original: mthun pa'i dus lhur byas pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i dus lhur byas pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement emphasizing the appropriate time is

original: des na zhig pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhig pa'i 'og tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúafter its destruction.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù introduces another position.

original: 'on te rgyu rim gyis rtogs par 'dod pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu rim gyis rtogs par 'dod pa des na /
translated: But if you maintain that the cause is realized gradually,

original: 'bras bu'i dus gzhan dang gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus gzhan dang gzhan du rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do snyam na /
translated: then since the effect is seen to occur at other and other times, following after the cause, there is no fault.

original: lan du de lta na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i tshe yang 'bras bu rim gyi rgyu rang bzhin phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug par rtogs pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pas rim pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du de lta na zhes bya ba'o // de'i tshe yang 'bras bu rim gyi rgyu rang bzhin phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug par rtogs pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yin pas rim pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIn that case‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩAt that time, the effect is realized gradually, and the cause is not realized to be essentially different from the effect. Therefore, it is not the case that there is no order.

original: des na rim med pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rim can ldog pas na rgyu rim can la gnas pas na des khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba grub pas na ma nges ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rim med pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rim can ldog pas na rgyu rim can la gnas pas na des khyab pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba grub pas na ma nges ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the effect is seen to occur in a certain order, even though it arises from a cause that is not ordered, the cause is ordered, and since it is the case that the cause is ordered, it is pervaded by the effect. Therefore, since the relation is established, it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: sngar brjod pa'i phyogs khas ma blangs kyang ma nges pa'i skyon med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i phyogs khas ma blangs kyang ma nges pa'i skyon med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though one does not accept the position stated earlier, there is no fault of the reason being not established.

original: rim ma yin ba'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: rim ma yin ba'i rgyu las so //
translated: From a cause that is not ordered.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni rim ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni rim ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is not ordered.

original: 'o na ci skad brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci skad brjod ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúHowever, . . .‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de skad me brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad me brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said?

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //

original: ci'i phyir zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is it said? ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la'o //üîΩ'bras bus ni rgyu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu la'o // 'bras bus ni rgyu la gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su bya ba yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù refers to the effect and the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the effect and the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.

original: spyir brjod pa'i don skabs la sbyor ba ni gang yang zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'o //üîΩde lta bu @59b nyid ni rim ma yin pas so //
analyzed: spyir brjod pa'i don skabs la sbyor ba ni gang yang zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu'o // de lta bu @59b nyid ni rim ma yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.

original: de ni zhes bya ba 'bras bus so //üîΩgzhan dag rjes su 'gro ba 'bras bu la nye bar mi mkho bar ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba 'bras bus so // gzhan dag rjes su 'gro ba 'bras bu la nye bar mi mkho bar ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.

original: lan du gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du gal te zhes bya ba'o //

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa nyid gang las yin /
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa nyid gang las yin /
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is in the cause‚Äù is said because the effect is in the cause.

original: nus ba'i rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu med srid na rang rgyud 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus ba'i rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu med srid na rang rgyud 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the effect were possible, but its existence were impossible, then the reason would change.üîΩBut if the effect were impossible, then it would be reasonable to say that it arises even though the cause exists, because the effect is nonexistent.

original: 'on te 'bras bu med pa rang rgyud yin pa'i phyir rgyu yod kyang 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dir rigs so snyam ba'i dogs pa bsu nas de med pa 'di zhes gsungs so //

translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist, this . . .‚Äù

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba med na ldog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba med na ldog pa yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, if there is no positive concomitance, there is no negative concomitance.

original: de de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it would not be the cause of that.

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExplaining‚Äù means ‚Äúif . . .

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ldog pa srid pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu yin no snyam du dogs na de med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ldog pa srid pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu yin no snyam du dogs na de med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù If you think that even though there is no positive concomitance, it is possible that there is negative concomitance, and therefore that is the cause of that, then he says, ‚ÄúIf it does not exist . . .

original: yang gi sgra ni mi bzod pa tsam mo //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni mi bzod pa tsam mo //
translated: ‚Äù The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is just a particle.

original: yang na'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: yang na'i sgra yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù is a particle.üîΩHow is this not understood?

original: 'di ci ltar mi rtogs snyam na /üîΩci ltar de'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ci ltar mi rtogs snyam na /üîΩci ltar de'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúHow is that . . .üîΩ‚Äù

original: gal te re zhig dngos po med pa ni rang nyid 'gyur bas khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te re zhig dngos po med pa ni rang nyid 'gyur bas khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: If you accept that a non-thing is itself,

original: de bzhin du dngos po yang rang bzhin 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po yang rang bzhin 'gyur ba na /
translated: then in the same way, when a thing changes its nature,

original: rgyu nye bar gnas kyang res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu nye bar gnas kyang res 'ga' mi 'byung ngo snyam na /
translated: even if the cause is present, it sometimes does not arise.

original: don rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthings‚Äù is stated.

original: rgyu las zhes bya ba ni mtha'i skad cig thob ba las so //
analyzed: rgyu las zhes bya ba ni mtha'i skad cig thob ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom a cause‚Äù means from obtaining the final moment.

original: med na med pa nyid gang las zhes bya ba bshad nas phyed phyi mi bshad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med na med pa nyid gang las zhes bya ba bshad nas phyed phyi mi bshad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the meaning of ‚Äúif it does not exist, from what would it be nonexistent?‚Äù is explained, the latter half is not explained.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la rgyu yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra yang gang gi don du bsgyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la rgyu yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba nyid kyi sgra yang gang gi don du bsgyur bar bya'o //
translated: If, as you say, the cause exists, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù should be translated as ‚Äúof what.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te dngos po med pa ltos pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa ltos pa med pa yin na /
translated: If a non-thing is independent,

original: de'i tshe rgyu nus pa yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar zhes 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu nus pa yod na 'bras bu gdon mi za bar zhes 'gyur ro zhes bya ba mi rigs te /
translated: then it is not reasonable to say ‚Äúif the cause has the ability, the effect undoubtedly arises.‚Äù

original: rang rgyud yin pas na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rgyud yin pas na 'bras bu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be a self-sufficient entity, it would be without an effect.

original: lan du de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rgyu med pa de med na ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa de med na ste /
translated: If that non-existent cause does not exist,

original: rgyu'i bdag nyid yod na 'bras bu'i med pa gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i bdag nyid yod na 'bras bu'i med pa gnas pa yin no //
translated: if the nature of the cause exists, the non-existence of the effect would be established.

original: de ltar byas pas 'bras bu med pa ni rgyu med pas sbyar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas 'bras bu med pa ni rgyu med pas sbyar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is the case, the non-existence of the effect would not be connected with the non-existence of the cause.

original: des na 'bras bu de 'di'i 'bras bur ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu de 'di'i 'bras bur ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could that effect be the effect of this?

original: gang gi phyir med pa de med pas sbyar ba ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa de med pas sbyar ba ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because that non-existent effect is not connected with the non-existent cause, that is so.

original: gal te de ltar na yang der nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang der nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even if that is so, it is definite as that, becauseüîΩit is the effect of that.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin no snyam na gang zhig ces smos so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin no snyam na gang zhig ces smos so //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: rgyu des so //
analyzed: rgyu des so //
translated: That effect is the effect of that cause.

original: des na zhes bya @60a * //
analyzed: des na zhes bya @60a * //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThen‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ba nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not definite.

original: rang nyid mi 'byung ba des na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid mi 'byung ba des na'o //
translated: Because it does not arise by itself.

original: de'i rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu med pa rang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu med pa rang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the effect would exist even though the cause exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be no such things as causes and effects.

original: gal te rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lugs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lugs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the rule that causes do not necessarily possess effects,

original: bden to / rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa dag 'dra ba'i phyir tha snyad pa rnams gcig tu tha snyad byed pa'i phyir lugs 'di nyid yin la /
analyzed: bden to / rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa dag 'dra ba'i phyir tha snyad pa rnams gcig tu tha snyad byed pa'i phyir lugs 'di nyid yin la /
translated: we agree, but this is the rule only because causes and non-causes are similar, and conventional expressions are used indiscriminately.

original: de kho nar ni dpyad pa 'di yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de kho nar ni dpyad pa 'di yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But this is not the case in reality, so there is no fault in our analysis.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe 'bras bu med pa rgyu med pas sbyar ba yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe 'bras bu med pa rgyu med pas sbyar ba yin zhes dogs na /
translated: But if you think that when an effect does not exist, it is not produced by a cause,

original: gang gi tshe rgyu yod na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu yod na zhes gsungs so //
translated: we reply that it is said that when a cause exists,

original: de'i tshe de med pa nyid na 'bras bu rgyun 'chad pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe de med pa nyid na 'bras bu rgyun 'chad pa yin pas so //
translated: then at that time, if it does not exist, the effect is interrupted.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba yod na ldog pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba yod na ldog pa yang 'thad pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that if there is concomitance, then absence is also tenable.

original: gal te de med pa nyid na rgyun 'chad pa ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te de med pa nyid na rgyun 'chad pa ci ltar yin te /
translated: But if it is not absent, how can it be interrupted?

original: gang gi phyir rgyu yod na skyes ba ni rang nyid skad cig gzhan du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu yod na skyes ba ni rang nyid skad cig gzhan du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because if a cause exists, that which is produced does not remain in a different moment by itself.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even though it ceases by itself,üîΩif ultimately it is produced in other and other moments, it ceases by itself.

original: gal te don dam par skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad pa rnams gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don dam par skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skyes pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad pa rnams gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though that is so, because of the conventional conception of a single thing,

original: rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa yin te /
translated: the stream is understood as the entity of cause and effect.

original: skad cig la brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig la brtag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to investigate the moment.

original: des na de med pa nyid na rgyun chags par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de med pa nyid na rgyun chags par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when it does not exist, it is understood as a continuum.

original: 'bras bu'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of effects:

original: bum pa la sogs pa ltar skye ba tsam la gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa dang / gzhan te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ltar skye ba tsam la gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa dang / gzhan te /
translated: like a pot, etc., that which is produced merely by the activity of another, and

original: du ba la sogs pa ltar rgyun gnas pa na yang de la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa ltar rgyun gnas pa na yang de la ltos pa'o //
translated: different from that, like smoke, etc., that which depends on the endurance of the stream.

original: de la 'di ni rgyu gsal na rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir na de med pas byas pa yin no zhes bya bar gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni rgyu gsal na rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir na de med pas byas pa yin no zhes bya bar gsal ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the reason is clear: ‚ÄúIf the cause is clear, then the effect is clear, because the continuum is not interrupted. Therefore, it is produced by that.‚Äù

original: bum pa las sogs pa la ni sngar gyi mi dmigs pa'i byed pa nyid ldog pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa las sogs pa la ni sngar gyi mi dmigs pa'i byed pa nyid ldog pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a pot, etc., the previous non-observation of the cause is itself the proof of cessation.

original: de'i tshe ni gal te 'bras bu ma yin pa'i tshogs kyang ma dmigs pa de lta na yang gang zhig tsam nye bar 'o ngas pas 'bras bu dmigs pa de med bas 'di med par byas pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gal te 'bras bu ma yin pa'i tshogs kyang ma dmigs pa de lta na yang gang zhig tsam nye bar 'o ngas pas 'bras bu dmigs pa de med bas 'di med par byas pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: At that time, even if a collection that is not an effect is not observed, still, because of the mere proximity of the effect, it is established that ‚Äúthis is produced by the absence of that.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe sngar gyi mi dmigs pa la ltos pa na ni du ba la sogs pa la yang da kho na ltar yin no zhes bstan @60b pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngar gyi mi dmigs pa la ltos pa na ni du ba la sogs pa la yang da kho na ltar yin no zhes bstan @60b pa yin no //
translated: When it is dependent on the previous non-observation, it is taught that it is just like smoke, etc.

original: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pas na rgyu dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yod pas na rgyu dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du gnas so //
translated: Thus, because of the existence of positive and negative concomitance, the meaning is established as ‚Äúthere is a connection with the cause, but not with anything else.‚Äù

original: des na gang rim can yin pa des ni rgyu rim can gyis bskyed pa yin no zhes khyab pa grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang rim can yin pa des ni rgyu rim can gyis bskyed pa yin no zhes khyab pa grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is established that whatever is sequential is generated by sequential causes, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa zhes mjug sdud do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa zhes mjug sdud do //
translated: For that very reason, he concludes, ‚ÄúTherefore, it is not sequential.‚Äù

original: yang rtsa bas ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: yang rtsa bas ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Again, in order to eliminate the root indetermination, he anticipates an objection:

original: 'on te rim can ma yin pa las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rim can ma yin pa las zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is not sequential,‚Äù he says.üîΩWhy?

original: de la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is permanent.‚Äù

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that itself‚Äù means from the very distinction.

original: khyad par de ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par de ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat distinction‚Äù is the anticipation of an objection.

original: des byas pa'i 'bras bu ni rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des byas pa'i 'bras bu ni rtag pa nyid kyis byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The effect produced from that is produced by the permanent, that is the meaning.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúNo, because,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtag pa de la khyad par 'ga' zhig byas na khyad par de de'i zhes brjod pa yin nam /
analyzed: rtag pa de la khyad par 'ga' zhig byas na khyad par de de'i zhes brjod pa yin nam /
translated: If a distinction is made in that permanent thing, is that distinction called ‚Äúthat‚Äù?

original: 'on te khyad par ma byas kyang khyad par gyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pas na de skad brjod ces bya ba ni rtag pa gnyis kyi don to //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par ma byas kyang khyad par gyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pas na de skad brjod ces bya ba ni rtag pa gnyis kyi don to //
translated: Or, if you say that although there is no distinction, it is called that because it generates the understanding of distinction, then that is the meaning of the two eternalities.

original: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'ga' zhig las khyad par gyi rang bzhin skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la 'ga' zhig las khyad par gyi rang bzhin skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for ‚Äúbecause there is no distinction,‚Äù it is not tenable that anything arises with the nature of a distinction from an eternal [entity].

original: khyad par las khyad par zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i khyad par las khyad par tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par las khyad par zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i khyad par las khyad par tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As for ‚Äúfrom a distinction, a distinction,‚Äù the meaning is that a distinction is not different from the distinction of an eternal [entity].

original: tha dad na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis byas pa'i khyad par tha dad na'o //
analyzed: tha dad na zhes bya ba ni khyad par gyis byas pa'i khyad par tha dad na'o //
translated: As for ‚Äúif it is different,‚Äù it is a distinction that is made by a distinction.

original: thal ba snga ma ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par de la ltos pa'i 'bras bu ni de nyid las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thal ba snga ma ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par de la ltos pa'i 'bras bu ni de nyid las skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: As for ‚Äúit is not the former consequence,‚Äù the meaning is that the effect that depends on that distinction arises from that [distinction] itself,

original: rtag pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not from an eternal [entity].

original: khyad par de de'i yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin lan 'debs na /
analyzed: khyad par de de'i yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin lan 'debs na /
translated: As for ‚Äúif that distinction is of that,‚Äù and so on, the answer is the same as before.

original: sun dbyung ba yang snga ma kho na ltar ro //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba yang snga ma kho na ltar ro //
translated: The refutation is just as before.

original: des na rtag pa ni rim gyis 'bras bu byed par bsgrub pa la mthar thug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rtag pa ni rim gyis 'bras bu byed par bsgrub pa la mthar thug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the proof of the production of an effect by a permanent thing, there is no end.

original: rnam bar rtog pa gnyis pa ston pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam bar rtog pa gnyis pa ston pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second alternative is presented in the words, ‚ÄúOr, if it is different.

original: gal te rtag pa las khyad par yod na de'i tshe khyad par gyi rtogs pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa las khyad par yod na de'i tshe khyad par gyi rtogs pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù If there is a difference from the permanent thing, then it is possible to understand the difference.

original: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni khyad par med kyang de'i rtog pa yod pa yod pas na bya thabs ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni khyad par med kyang de'i rtog pa yod pa yod pas na bya thabs ci yod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that is so, then what can be done about the fact that the understanding of the difference exists even though there is no difference?

original: 'o na ni 'di ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di ni 'khrul pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Well then, this is just a mistake.

original: khyad par gyi rtogs pa rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi @61a * //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rtogs pa rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi @61a * //
translated: The understanding of the difference is not the characteristic that is accepted as the cause.

original: 'bad pa don med cing rim ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pa don med cing rim ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is useless to strive for it, and because it is not established as being nonsequential.

original: 'o na de la de ltar ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na de la de ltar ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: Well then, how is it understood in that way?

original: khyad par med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwithout a difference.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe khyod kyi lugs kyis khyad par mi rtogs par 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gnas ba de'i tshe rtag pa la tshad ma med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod kyi lugs kyis khyad par mi rtogs par 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gnas ba de'i tshe rtag pa la tshad ma med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: When, according to your system, there is no apprehension of a difference, and there is only error, then, in order to show that there is no valid cognition of the permanent, it is said:

original: khyad par la ni 'khrul na yang //üîΩrtag la tshang ma ga la zhig //
analyzed: khyad par la ni 'khrul na yang // rtag la tshang ma ga la zhig //
translated: Even if there is error with regard to a difference,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: how can there be a valid cognition of the permanent?

original: des na rtag tu khyad par rtogs pas na 'khrul ba khas blangs pa yang khas blangs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu khyad par rtogs pas na 'khrul ba khas blangs pa yang khas blangs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since there is always the apprehension of a difference, the acceptance of error is only a mere acceptance.

original: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The introduction to the objection of another is:

original: gal te khyad med rtogs na ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te khyad med rtogs na ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If there is the apprehension of a difference,üîΩthen there is the apprehension of a difference.

original: ngo shes pa la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo shes pa la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is recognition, etc.

original: don ni rtag pa la tshad ma yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //üîΩlan du de lta na bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni rtag pa la tshad ma yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o // lan du de lta na bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that there is a valid cognition of the permanent.

original: lhan cig byed pa la ltos par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa la ltos par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: The answer is: In that case, how can it be dependent on the cooperating conditions?üîΩWhy?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of what?

original: khyad par dang po'i don du ci ste mi ltos snyam na /
analyzed: khyad par dang po'i don du ci ste mi ltos snyam na /
translated: Why should it not be seen as dependent on the particular?

original: khyad par yang ni yong ba ma yin no zhes gsungs te /üîΩgang zhig khyad par du byed pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par yang ni yong ba ma yin no zhes gsungs te / gang zhig khyad par du byed pa'am /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúNor is there a particular.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi rnam par rtog par byed pa zhes brtags nas sun phyung ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rnam par rtog par byed pa zhes brtags nas sun phyung ba'o //
translated: Having examined whether there is a particular or a conception of a particular, it is refuted.

original: yang gi sgras ni rang la yod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni rang la yod pa yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúnor‚Äù means that it is not even in itself.

original: de lta na ltos ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la gsal bar byas pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //üîΩkhyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
analyzed: de lta na ltos ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba la gsal bar byas pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir na de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o // khyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
translated: In order to clarify how there is dependence in that way, and in order to teach in a way that accords with the world, the verse says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ces bya ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThere is no dependence on what is not a particular.‚Äù

original: khyad par med pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The commentary explains, ‚ÄúThere is no dependence on what is not a particular.‚Äù

original: des na 'bras bu rim can rtag pa las ldog pas na khyab pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu rim can rtag pa las ldog pas na khyab pa grub pa'o //
translated: Thus, since it is refuted that the effect is sequential, the pervasion is established.

original: des na phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa'i sgo nas phyogs kyi chos nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni lus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
