analyzed: des na phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa'i sgo nas phyogs kyi chos nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa ni lus las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the latter half of the verse is stated from the perspective of the inclusion of the property of the position, as in the statement, ‚Äúfrom the body.‚Äù

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni lus rim can ma yin na gang gis blo de'i rim pa byas pa /
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni lus rim can ma yin na gang gis blo de'i rim pa byas pa /
translated: If it were not so, then if the body were not sequential, by what would the order of that cognition be made?

original: yid kyi blo snga ma snga ma'i rang bzhin de rgyur gsal de /
analyzed: yid kyi blo snga ma snga ma'i rang bzhin de rgyur gsal de /
translated: The nature of the prior mental cognition is the cause of the latter.

original: tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is ascertained by valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: nyams myong snga ma snga ma zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: nyams myong snga ma snga ma zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, ‚Äúfrom the prior experience.‚Äù

original: snga ma snga ma'i myong ba tsam te /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i myong ba tsam te /
translated: It is merely the experience of the prior.

original: rnam par rtog pa can nam gzhan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can nam gzhan no //
translated: It is conceptual or other.

original: yid kyi blo de la 'jug par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don @61b to ;
analyzed: yid kyi blo de la 'jug par dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don @61b to ;
translated: The meaning is that it is the object of engagement of that mental cognition.

original: / gal te de lta na yang thog ma spyad pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te de lta na yang thog ma spyad pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it the very first experience?

original: nyams su myong ba de yang gzhan las de myong ba snga ma las /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de yang gzhan las de myong ba snga ma las /
translated: That experience is from another, from the prior experience of that.

original: de'i snga ma'i myong ba de yang snga ma las zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i snga ma'i myong ba de yang snga ma las zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The experience of the former is also said to be from the former.

original: thog ma med pa ni thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa ni thug pa med pa'o //
translated: Beginninglessness is endless.

original: gal te yang de ltar mthong ba dang / mthong ba yang dor bar mi nus pa de lta na yang blo de dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yang de ltar mthong ba dang / mthong ba yang dor bar mi nus pa de lta na yang blo de dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: Even if it is seen that way, and seeing is not able to be abandoned, still, the mind is together with that.

original: lus rim pa med pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du dogs na lan du de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus rim pa med pa nyid skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du dogs na lan du de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you suspect that the body is produced without order, the answer is: If that is so,

original: khyad par med par khas lan na sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med par khas lan na sngar bshad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if you accept without distinction, the previously explained fault will occur.

original: khyad par yod na yang phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir blo snga ma'i lhan cig byed pa'i can du 'gyur ba bsnyon par mi nus so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir blo snga ma'i lhan cig byed pa'i can du 'gyur ba bsnyon par mi nus so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a distinction, then because of mutual benefit, the mind is together with the former co-producer. It cannot be denied.

original: de la ltos nas brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la ltos nas brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression in dependence on that is therefore.

original: de ltar gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni blo dang lhan cig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba nyid ces bya ba ni blo dang lhan cig pa nyid do //
translated: That which is so is called together with the mind.

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig re rer ro //üîΩde nyid ni 'grel pa'i phyi ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩskad cig rgyu yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i skad cig re rer ro // de nyid ni 'grel pa'i phyi ma phyi ma'i zhes bya ba yin no // skad cig rgyu yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: and in each subsequent moment, the taste.üîΩThis is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúin each subsequent moment‚Äù in the commentary.üîΩThe word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is understood.

original: yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'dis gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi tshig 'dis gsal bar byas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúis‚Äù is supplied by the word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù in the reason.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga ma 'phen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù refers to the projection of a prior birth.

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDeath‚Äù refers to the characteristic of the coming of birth.

original: rgyu de 'dra ba nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin na 'bras bu shol bar ni bzod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de 'dra ba nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin na 'bras bu shol bar ni bzod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If such a cause were not capable of producing an effect, it would not be tenable that the effect is absent.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te lan gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te lan gcig rtogs pa'i rgyu thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù if the cause of the cognition of something were not always and everywhere present,

original: de'i tshe khyab pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu la ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyab pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir na rnam pa thams cad du rgyu la ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because the pervasion would not be understood, the effect would not be related to the cause in every way.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other way to understand the relation of cause and effect.

original: bzlog pa 'jig rten pha rol med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: bzlog pa 'jig rten pha rol med pa la yang ngo //
translated: The reverse is also true for those who deny the existence of a future world.

original: 'chi ba de'i sems yin pa'i phyir na'o //üîΩbzlog pas zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'chi ba de'i sems yin pa'i phyir na'o // bzlog pas zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba sgrub par byed pas so //
translated: Because the mind at death is the cause of rebirth.üîΩThe reverse is also true means that the proof of the existence of rebirth is also the proof of the existence of the mind at death.

original: bzlog pa yang zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i bsgrub pa'i sgrub byed kyang ngo //
analyzed: bzlog pa yang zhes bya ba ni mtshams sbyor ba'i bsgrub pa'i sgrub byed kyang ngo //
translated: The reverse is also true means that the proof of the existence of rebirth is also the proof of the existence of the mind at death.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba 'chi ba'i sems nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba 'chi ba'i sems nyid kyis so //
translated: By this means means by the mind at death itself.

original: de la med par smra ba gzhan la re zhig 'gal ba med pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la med par smra ba gzhan la re zhig 'gal ba med pa brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, the opponent who denies the existence of a future world first states the non-contradiction:üîΩThe mind at death.üîΩOh!

original: 'chi ba'i sems ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'o zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o //üîΩmtshams sbyor ba de'am /üîΩgang gis de med par sgrub par byed pa de'i yul dang 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ni zhes bya ba'o // 'o zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o // mtshams sbyor ba de'am / gang gis de med par sgrub par byed pa de'i yul dang 'gal ba ci zhig yod /
translated: is the cause of rebirth.üîΩWhat contradiction is there between that which is the cause of rebirth and that which is the cause of the non-existence of rebirth?

original: 'gal ba gang gis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba gang gis so //
translated: What contradiction is there between the cause of rebirth and the cause of the non-existence of rebirth?

original: gal te rdzas @62a * //
analyzed: gal te rdzas @62a * //
translated: If a substance is not produced, it does not exist.

original: gnyis lhan cig mi gnas ba'i 'gal ba yin pa de ltar na yang 'chi ba'i sems nyid dang mtshams sbyor ba gnyis ni ma yin te chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis lhan cig mi gnas ba'i 'gal ba yin pa de ltar na yang 'chi ba'i sems nyid dang mtshams sbyor ba gnyis ni ma yin te chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the mind of death and the mind that links with the next life are not mutually exclusive, because they are dharmas.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di glang po che'i lta bas btang snyoms su byas te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di glang po che'i lta bas btang snyoms su byas te /
translated: Nevertheless, this is like the elephant‚Äôs trance.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni 'chi ba'i sems nyid 'ongs na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i nyes pa brjod pa ni 'chi ba'i sems nyid 'ongs na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault of not having the characteristics of the mind of death and the mind that links with the next life is stated in the verse:üîΩ‚ÄúWhen the mind of death arises, the mind that links with the next life does not exist.‚Äù

original: mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa ni med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of linking is nonexistence.

original: rgyun gyi 'jug pa med par zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi 'jug pa med par zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that there is no continuity of the mind.

original: 'gal ba gnyis pa med pa brjod pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis pa med pa brjod pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the second contradiction is ‚ÄúFor that reason.‚Äù

original: yang 'dir ci ltar 'gribs te /üîΩgal te 'di dag gi don 'dzin pa yin na de lta na ni /
analyzed: yang 'dir ci ltar 'gribs te / gal te 'di dag gi don 'dzin pa yin na de lta na ni /
translated: Moreover, how is there a contradiction here?

original: de lta bur lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba nyid ma grub par rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bur lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba nyid ma grub par rigs so //
translated: If the meaning of these is that they grasp, then it is reasonable that the contradiction of not abiding together is not established.

original: de ste mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa mthong ba med pa zhes pa dag gi phyogs gcig 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba gnyi ga mthong ba la gdon mi za bar ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ste mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa mthong ba med pa zhes pa dag gi phyogs gcig 'dzin pa yin na ni de'i tshe phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba gnyi ga mthong ba la gdon mi za bar ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the apprehension of one part of the non-perception of the opposite of that, then at that time, there is no doubt that mutual exclusion is based on the perception of both.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin du kun du rtog pa la gnas par gcig la ltos nas de'i 'gal zla nges pa'i rtogs pa tsam gyis 'gal bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin du kun du rtog pa la gnas par gcig la ltos nas de'i 'gal zla nges pa'i rtogs pa tsam gyis 'gal bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like permanence and impermanence, the ascertainment of the contradictory is merely by the conceptual cognition that ascertains the contradictory based on one.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa ni gnyi ga mthong ba la ltos pa nyid de /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa ni gnyi ga mthong ba la ltos pa nyid de /
translated: Non-coexistence is based on the perception of both.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig yod na gzhan med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na bden te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig yod na gzhan med par nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na bden te /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not so, it would not be possible to ascertain that when one exists, the other does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni ngag gi don 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni ngag gi don 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Indeed, this is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúbecause of that very fact.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang zur gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on kyang zur gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir na /
translated: However, because it is taught in two parts,

original: don tha dad par sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: don tha dad par sbyar ba yin no //
translated: it is applied as a separate meaning.

original: 'di ltar 'dir ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning here is as follows.

original: 'chi ba'i sems 'ongs na zhes bya ba ni yid la 'dres par gyur na te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems 'ongs na zhes bya ba ni yid la 'dres par gyur na te /
translated: If the thought of death arises means if it is mixed with the mind.

original: 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog par gyur na zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It means if the thought of death occurs.

original: mtshams sbyar ba la bzlog bsam mthong ba'i phyir te mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba la bzlog bsam mthong ba'i phyir te mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thought of death is seen to be the opposite of rebirth, it is not clear.

original: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i sems kyi rnam par rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i sems kyi rnam par rtog par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if the thought of death occurs,

original: 'chi ba'i sems ma yin pa rnam par gcad par mthong gi mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ma yin pa rnam par gcad par mthong gi mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: the thought of death is seen to exclude a non-death consciousness, but it is not seen to exclude rebirth.

original: / des na de ni de nyid dang 'gal gyi mtshams sbyor ba dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / des na de ni de nyid dang 'gal gyi mtshams sbyor ba dang ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it contradicts that very thought of death, but it does not contradict rebirth.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa la yang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa gsal ba yin gyi 'chi ba'i sems nyid rnam par gcad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par rtog pa la yang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa gsal ba yin gyi 'chi ba'i sems nyid rnam par gcad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, the thought of rebirth excludes non-rebirth, but it does not exclude the thought of death.

original: de lta na mtshams sbyor ba dang mi sbyor ba @62b gnyis nyid phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta na mtshams sbyor ba dang mi sbyor ba @62b gnyis nyid phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Thus, rebirth and non-rebirth are mutually exclusive.

original: gang rtogs na gang rnam par gcad pa de nyid de dang 'gal bar rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rtogs na gang rnam par gcad pa de nyid de dang 'gal bar rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one realizes that, then that which is eliminated is just that which is incompatible with it.

original: mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su spangs te 'chi ba'i sems gang yin pa de gnas pa de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis pa med do /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su spangs te 'chi ba'i sems gang yin pa de gnas pa de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis pa med do /
translated: Since the mind of death that abandons that connection is not seen to abide in that way, there is no second incompatibility.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa sun 'byin pas 'chi ba'i sems nyid 'ongs nas mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa sun 'byin pas 'chi ba'i sems nyid 'ongs nas mtshams sbyor ba las bzlog pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir zhes gang brjod pa de ni ma grub ste /
translated: Since the mind of death itself is not seen to come and reverse the connection, it is not established that it is refuted by the incompatibility of not abiding together.

original: mtshams sbyor na snga ma bzhin gson par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor na snga ma bzhin gson par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it connects, then it would follow that it would be alive as before.

original: des na sngar rgyun gyis mtshams sbyor par gyur pa de ni 'chi ba'i sems dang 'brel na mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci ltar lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na sngar rgyun gyis mtshams sbyor par gyur pa de ni 'chi ba'i sems dang 'brel na mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ci ltar lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since that which previously connected through a continuum would finally come to an end if it were connected to the mind of death, how could it not be an incompatibility of not abiding together?

original: skye ba gzhan zhes smos so //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúanother birth‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being thought.

original: mtshams sbyor ba lus de la gnas pa'i 'tsho ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba lus de la gnas pa'i 'tsho ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The life of the being in the intermediate state is not the life of the body in the womb.

original: lus de nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i las zad na lus 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / nus pa'i sems kyang sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba yin te des na 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: lus de nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i las zad na lus 'jig par 'gyur ba dang / nus pa'i sems kyang sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ba yin te des na 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: When the action that produces the body is exhausted, the body perishes, and the mind that is capable of linking up with another mind does so.

original: mtshams sbyor ba de ni rang gis rig par bya ba yin yang gzhan gyis ni rig par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba de ni rang gis rig par bya ba yin yang gzhan gyis ni rig par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The linking up is known by the being itself, but not by others.

original: 'on te lus dang bcas pa'i sems kyis bskyed par bya ba ni lus dang bcas pa kho nar skye ba yin no zhes brjod na lus yang gal te de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa nye ba'i dbang gis shin du dang ba nyid kyis 'o skol lta bu'i spyod yulüîΩma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te lus dang bcas pa'i sems kyis bskyed par bya ba ni lus dang bcas pa kho nar skye ba yin no zhes brjod na lus yang gal te de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa nye ba'i dbang gis shin du dang ba nyid kyis 'o skol lta bu'i spyod yul ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the mind that is produced along with the body is produced only along with the body, then the body would be imperceptible, like the mind, because of the subtlety of the body produced by such a cause.

original: de lta na yang skye ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba ni snang du rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skye ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba ni snang du rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even if that were so, it would be well said that the linking up with another birth is not perceptible.

original: des na bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pa ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-observation of what is suitable to appear does not prove non-existence, it is not tenable that they do not co-exist.

original: gal te nged kyis mtshams sbyor ba med pa ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te nged kyis mtshams sbyor ba med pa ma grub na //
translated: If we do not establish the non-connection of the two,

original: 'o na khyod kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyis mtshams sbyor ba yang ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: then how do you establish the connection of the two?

original: 'bras bu nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThe effect itself . . .‚Äù

original: lus dang bcas pa'i sems ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan kho na'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa'i sems ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan kho na'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind that is associated with the body is the effect of just another mind that is similar to it.

original: 'bras bu de 'dra ba las snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu de 'dra ba nyid grub pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba grub pa ni rang dang 'gal ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa sel @63a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu de 'dra ba las snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu de 'dra ba nyid grub pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba grub pa ni rang dang 'gal ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa sel @63a * //
translated: The cause that is similar to the effect, which has the nature of the prior and subsequent, is established. The establishment of the connection is the elimination of the connection of the two that are mutually exclusive.

original: bar byed do zhes rigs so //
analyzed: bar byed do zhes rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that.

original: de med pa ste mtshams sbyor ba med pa med par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ste mtshams sbyor ba med pa med par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of that, the non-connection of the two, is established.

original: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar 'bras bu nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sgrub byed yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar 'bras bu nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sgrub byed yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: But even if that is so, how is it that the effect itself is the proof of the connection?

original: 'chi ba'i sems nyid gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems nyid gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind at death itself is the harm-doer.

original: 'dir gang bden par 'grub snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: 'dir gang bden par 'grub snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that one of these two is established as true,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i don la zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúin the case of mutually contradictory objects.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs shes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs shes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The reason is understood.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is an inference for the sake of others.

original: 'dis ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa de ni de yod par sgrub par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa de ni de yod par sgrub par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: This proves what was said, ‚ÄúThat which is related to something establishes the existence of that.‚Äù

original: rnam 'grel gyi phyed phyi ma la 'jug par byed pa ni gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi phyed phyi ma la 'jug par byed pa ni gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The introduction to the latter half of the Commentary is ‚ÄúIf here‚Äù and so on.

original: zhi ba des na'o //
analyzed: zhi ba des na'o //
translated: It is peace.

original: mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su spangs te'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba de yongs su spangs te'o //
translated: Having completely abandoned that connection.

original: gzhan gyis phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal bar sems pa ni yi ge 'dis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis phan tshun spangs pa'i 'gal bar sems pa ni yi ge 'dis byas pa yin te /
translated: The idea of mutual contradiction by others is done by this letter.

original: dngos po la ni med do zhes bstan zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po la ni med do zhes bstan zin pa kho na'o //
translated: This has been taught already.

original: de lta na yang bsag pa'i don du de yang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang bsag pa'i don du de yang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even so, it is not related to the meaning of accumulation.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems de dgag pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems de dgag pa nyid la'o //
translated: The arhat‚Äôs mind is just stopped.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal bar ni khyed cag nyid kyis khas blangs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal bar ni khyed cag nyid kyis khas blangs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you do not accept that the mind of death is incompatible with the mind of birth,üîΩthen how can you maintain that the arhat is without birth?

original: de ltar ma yin na dgra bcom pa mtshams sbyor ba med par ci ltar 'dod snyam na 'chi ba'i sems nyid ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na dgra bcom pa mtshams sbyor ba med par ci ltar 'dod snyam na 'chi ba'i sems nyid ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: The mind of death itself is not incompatible with the mind of birth.

original: 'gal bar khas blangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal bar khas blangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that it is not incompatible.

original: 'o na dgra bcom pa la ji ltar med snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na dgra bcom pa la ji ltar med snyam na /
translated: But how can it be that the arhat does not have the mind of birth?

original: nyon mongs pa dang zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang zhes gsungs so//
translated: The mind of death is free from afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba de gzhan gyi yang so so'i skye bo rnams la khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba de gzhan gyi yang so so'i skye bo rnams la khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: But we do not accept that ordinary beings are free from afflictions.

original: grub mtha' thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: grub mtha' thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù refers to the schools.

original: lung thams cad ni 'chi ba'i sems thams cad mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung thams cad ni 'chi ba'i sems thams cad mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: All scriptures are not proofs of the thesis that all minds at death are bound to a rebirth.

original: gang gi phyir 'khor ba pa'i skye ba la lar te kha cig la mtshams sbyor bar lung des bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khor ba pa'i skye ba la lar te kha cig la mtshams sbyor bar lung des bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the scriptures teach that in some births in cyclic existence, there is a rebirth.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs opinion.

original: gal te yang lung gis la /
analyzed: gal te yang lung gis la /
translated: Even if the scriptures teach that

original: la la mtshams sbyor ba yod par bstan pa de lta na yang 'di tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: la la mtshams sbyor ba yod par bstan pa de lta na yang 'di tshad ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: in some cases there is a rebirth, still they are not established as valid cognitions.

original: des na lung gi chos des tshad ma ma yin @63b pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na lung gi chos des tshad ma ma yin @63b pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, those scriptures are not valid cognitions.

original: des na dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med par grub pa na /
analyzed: des na dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med par grub pa na /
translated: Therefore, when it is established that the mind of the last arhat is not bound to a rebirth,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa des na mtshams sbyor ba dang 'chi ba'i sems gnyis 'gal ba srid pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa des na mtshams sbyor ba dang 'chi ba'i sems gnyis 'gal ba srid pa yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is possible that the two minds, the mind of rebirth and the mind of death, are contradictory. This is the meaning.

original: sun 'byin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the refutation is this.

original: tshul 'dis dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa la tshad mar byas pa'i lung de nyid 'khor ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba yod par sgrub pa la tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin na de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: tshul 'dis dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa la tshad mar byas pa'i lung de nyid 'khor ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba yod par sgrub pa la tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin na de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: This is saying that the scripture that is valid in regard to the non-relinking of the mind of an arhat is not valid in regard to the proof of the re-linking of the mind of samsara, and that is not correct.

original: de ni gcig tu tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur dgos pas re zhig tshad ma yin pa'i phyogs la gal te grub pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur dgos pas re zhig tshad ma yin pa'i phyogs la gal te grub pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs so //
translated: That scripture must be either valid or not valid, so first, in the case that it is valid, if it is said that it is a tenet,

original: des bstan pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i mngon sum gyis ma mthong bas na grub pa'i mtha' tshad mas gnod pa yin na'o //
analyzed: des bstan pa'i mtshams sbyor ba'i mngon sum gyis ma mthong bas na grub pa'i mtha' tshad mas gnod pa yin na'o //
translated: then the direct perception that it teaches, the re-linking, would not be seen, and so the tenet would be invalidated by valid knowledge.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa gnyis kyi sgo nas 'gal bar 'dod pa 'grub par gal 'gyur /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa gnyis kyi sgo nas 'gal bar 'dod pa 'grub par gal 'gyur /
translated: How could it be established that the two, the non-relinking of the mind of an arhat and the re-linking of the mind of samsara, are contradictory?

original: 'di la tshad mas grub pa'am gnod pa'i don yin pas na ma grub pa don can no //
analyzed: 'di la tshad mas grub pa'am gnod pa'i don yin pas na ma grub pa don can no //
translated: Here, it is not established in the sense of being established by valid knowledge or invalidated by valid knowledge, so it is not established in the sense of having a meaning.

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i don du rjes su 'brang 'am ci /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i don du rjes su 'brang 'am ci /
translated: Or do you follow the meaning that the mind of an arhat is not a link?

original: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgo nas 'gal bar mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sems mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i sgo nas 'gal bar mi 'grub bo //
translated: The mind of an arhat is not established as contradictory in the sense that it is not a link.

original: 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Desire‚Äù means

original: dper na khyed kyi 'ga' zhig tu tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na khyed kyi 'ga' zhig tu tshad ma yin la /
translated: just as for you, something is a valid cognition in some cases,

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni ma yin pa de bzhin du nga'i gnyis ka la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni ma yin pa de bzhin du nga'i gnyis ka la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not in other cases, in the same way, for me, it is both.

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du gzhan gyi bsam pa brjod pa ni 'on te nas zhe na'i bar ro //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du gzhan gyi bsam pa brjod pa ni 'on te nas zhe na'i bar ro //
translated: The meaning of the latter half of the verse is explained in the statement of the opponent‚Äôs opinion from ‚ÄúBut if‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not a link.‚Äù

original: dogs pa de'i rnam pa rnam 'grel nyid na yod pa brjod pa ni gal te nas ma yin na'i bar ro //
analyzed: dogs pa de'i rnam pa rnam 'grel nyid na yod pa brjod pa ni gal te nas ma yin na'i bar ro //
translated: The statement of the form of that doubt in the autocommentary is from ‚ÄúIf you say‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not a link.‚Äù

original: gal te dgra bcom pa 'chi ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa de lta na yang 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa 'chi ba'i sems mtshams sbyor ba ma yin pa de lta na yang 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If the mind of an arhat is not a link, then even so, it is not because it is a mind of death,

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather because its causes are incomplete.

original: gal te 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems mtshams sbyor ba med par grub na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi tshe yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi sems mtshams sbyor ba med par grub na ni de'i tshe gzhan gyi tshe yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established that the mind at the time of death does not link up, then at that time, the same would be true of the life of another.

original: lan du rgyu dang bral ba de nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: lan du rgyu dang bral ba de nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: In response, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of a cause.‚Äù

original: gal te 'di bsgrub bya ba sgrub par nus pa nyid du dmigs pa de lta yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di bsgrub bya ba sgrub par nus pa nyid du dmigs pa de lta yin na ni /
translated: If it were possible to observe that this is established,

original: 'chi ba'i sems ni chos can /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ni chos can /
translated: then it would be correct to say, ‚ÄúThe mind at death, the subject,

original: mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i chos can yin te rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i chos can yin te rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: is a phenomenon that does not link up, because of the absence of a cause,

original: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems bzhin no zhes brjod par rigs so zhes @64a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tha ma'i sems bzhin no zhes brjod par rigs so zhes @64a * //
translated: like the final mind of an arhat.‚Äù

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the response.

original: sgrub par byed pa 'di brjod kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nyid yang bzlas nas 'chad ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa 'di brjod kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir de nyid yang bzlas nas 'chad ba ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that even though this proof is stated, the intended thesis is not established, he repeats the same point: ‚ÄúOr, the mind at death does not link up with an intermediate existence, because of the absence of a cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu ste skyed byed bral ba ste na dal sogs pas nus pa med pa'i phyir na'o//
analyzed: rgyu ste skyed byed bral ba ste na dal sogs pas nus pa med pa'i phyir na'o//
translated: ‚ÄúCause‚Äù means a producer. ‚ÄúAbsence‚Äù means the absence of a cause, because of the absence of the ability of karma and so on.

original: bral ba gtan tshigs yin gyi ma nges pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i sems nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: bral ba gtan tshigs yin gyi ma nges pa'i phyir 'chi ba'i sems nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: because it is not certain that the mind at death is the one that is separated.

original: mtha'i tshig cis ma brjod ces pa'i cha kha bskangs nas 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: mtha'i tshig cis ma brjod ces pa'i cha kha bskangs nas 'chad pa ni /
translated: The remainder is supplied by reading the passage as follows:

original: 'dir lhag pa ni ci zhig brjod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir lhag pa ni ci zhig brjod ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the remainder here?‚Äù

original: gal te gtan tshigs gzhan brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs gzhan brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the reason stated?

original: des na ji ltar lhag ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar lhag ma brjod ce na /
translated: Then how can there be a remainder?

original: 'di yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The remainder is this.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: snga ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The former, etc.

original: lhag ma de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid du sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid du sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is just that, i.e., the reason. The statement ‚Äúbecause‚Äù connects it as the reason.

original: ci ltar sgrub par byed pa 'di ma grub snyam pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du yang de nyid rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar sgrub par byed pa 'di ma grub snyam pa'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du yang de nyid rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to remove the doubt that this proof is not established, he explains the reason in another way:

original: rgyu dang bral ba de'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba de'o //
translated: The absence of a cause is that.

original: nyid kyi sgra ni rim pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: nyid kyi sgra ni rim pa gzhan yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äújust‚Äù has a different meaning.

original: cis ma nyams te de ni nyams pa nyid de /
analyzed: cis ma nyams te de ni nyams pa nyid de /
translated: How is it not impaired? It is impaired.

original: ci zhig yod gyur gang med pa //
analyzed: ci zhig yod gyur gang med pa //
translated: What exists does not exist.

original: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
translated: What is not joined to what is later.

original: ces bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: ces bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: 'on te yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: But if, again, the word ‚Äúif‚Äù introduces the suspicion of another.

original: gal te yid snga ma rgyu yin na ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yid snga ma rgyu yin na ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the former mind is the cause, it would not be established.

original: rgyu ni lus yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni lus yin la /
translated: The body is the cause.

original: de yang nad la sogs pas ma tshang bar 'gyur bar srid pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nad la sogs pas ma tshang bar 'gyur bar srid pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: And that is possible to be incomplete due to illness, etc.üîΩThe refutation is this: If the body is the cause, it is reasonable. But that is not so.

original: sun 'byin par yang gal te lus rgyu yin na 'di rigs pa zhig na de ltar ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin par yang gal te lus rgyu yin na 'di rigs pa zhig na de ltar ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: de yang sngar brjod zin te /
analyzed: de yang sngar brjod zin te /
translated: That was said before.

original: 'di ni lhag pa brjod pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lhag pa brjod pa'i don du yin no //
translated: This is for the purpose of stating the remainder.

original: lus rnam pa gnyis pos zhes byas gzhan gyis smras pa nyid rjes su brjod nas so so'am gzhan du rgyu yin par 'gyur zhes rnam par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam pa gnyis pos zhes byas gzhan gyis smras pa nyid rjes su brjod nas so so'am gzhan du rgyu yin par 'gyur zhes rnam par brtags pa'o //
translated: By the two kinds of body, having repeated what was said by another, it is analyzed: ‚ÄúIf it is the cause, either individually or otherwise.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po sel ba ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po sel ba ni /
translated: There, the first conception is eliminated.

original: de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de blo bzhin du 'dzin 'gyur phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it would apprehend the object as the sense faculty does.

original: dbang po de'i blo yid kyi shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa de bzhin du yid kyi shes pas kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po de'i blo yid kyi shes pa las gzhan du gyur pa de bzhin du yid kyi shes pas kyang dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the sense faculty‚Äôs cognition is different from the mental consciousness, so too the mental consciousness would have a different object.

original: yang de'i blo bzhin du yid kyi shes pa dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pas yul 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de'i blo bzhin du yid kyi shes pa dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pas yul 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, just like the sense faculty‚Äôs cognition, the mental consciousness would apprehend the object by following the activity of the sense faculty.

original: de nas dbang @64b po byed pa med pa la yid kyi shes pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dbang @64b po byed pa med pa la yid kyi shes pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the sense faculty is inactive, the mental consciousness would not exist.

original: yang na de'i blo bzhin du zhes bya ba dbang po gyur na 'gyur ba nyid dang / yid kyi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na de'i blo bzhin du zhes bya ba dbang po gyur na 'gyur ba nyid dang / yid kyi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, just like the sense faculty‚Äôs cognition, the mental consciousness would be transformed when the sense faculty is transformed, and it would apprehend the object.

original: 'di thams cad ni bshad par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni bshad par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All of this will be clarified in the explanation.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bzlog pa ni shes ba skyed ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bzlog pa ni shes ba skyed ces bya ba'o ;
translated: The second conception is refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúIt would generate consciousness.‚Äù

original: / rnam par rtog pa gsum pa dbang po med pa la bshad pa ni sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa gsum pa dbang po med pa la bshad pa ni sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third conception, that the mental consciousness exists without a sense faculty, is refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúBecause there is no mind.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i nus pa de dang 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i rang bzhin du gyur ba'i nus pa de dang 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfaculty‚Äù is the power that has the nature of a faculty and the engagement that is based on it.

original: des na dbang po'i rang bzhin nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i rang bzhin nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the nature of a faculty.

original: byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid dbang yin no zhes bya ba'i lugs kyang ston par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed pa nyid dbang yin no zhes bya ba'i lugs kyang ston par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: It also shows the system that asserts the meaning of ‚Äúfaculty‚Äù is that which empowers.

original: 'di ni de la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in dependence on that system.

original: dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs ba'i yid shes pa yang de yin la gzhan yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su 'brangs ba'i yid shes pa yang de yin la gzhan yang yin pa ste /
translated: Mental consciousness that is concomitant with a faculty is also a faculty, but it is not only that.

original: de'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du 'di 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du 'di 'gyur te /
translated: It is a faculty that is similar in nature to that faculty.

original: gsal bas gcad pa'i rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal bas gcad pa'i rnam pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a faculty that has the aspect of being cut by a sharp instrument.

original: de lta ma yin na de dbang po las skye yang de ltar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dbang po las skye yang de ltar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If that were not so, then even though it arises from a faculty, it would not be like that.

original: de'i tshe dbang po de'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'byung nas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po de'i rgyu las de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa 'byung nas te /
translated: In that case, it would arise from the cause of that faculty without having its nature.

original: ci skang bshad pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: ci skang bshad pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If conceptual consciousness arises from sound,

original: rnam par rtog pa de'i rang bzhin de gang las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de'i rang bzhin de gang las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: What is the nature of that conception?

original: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be causeless.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi gal te zhes smras so //
translated: Here, the opponent says ‚Äúif‚Äù .

original: me las du ba dang / thal ba skye ba la tshogs tha dad pa yod pa yin te /üîΩbud shing la yod pa'i snying po ma yin pa me dang bcas pa ni thal ba skyed la /
analyzed: me las du ba dang / thal ba skye ba la tshogs tha dad pa yod pa yin te / bud shing la yod pa'i snying po ma yin pa me dang bcas pa ni thal ba skyed la /
translated: In the case of the arising of smoke and ash from fire, there is a difference in the collection.üîΩThe non-essential part of the fuel together with the fire produces ash.

original: shin du snying po ma yin pa ni du ba skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: shin du snying po ma yin pa ni du ba skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: The very inessential part produces smoke.

original: 'dir mi gcig shes pa mi 'dra ba gnyis bskyed pa la rten ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'dir mi gcig shes pa mi 'dra ba gnyis bskyed pa la rten ci yod snyam na /
translated: Here, what is the basis for the production of two different cognitions in one person?

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The difference in the collection.

original: rtsod pa 'di la de nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pas lan 'debs pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la de nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pas lan 'debs pa ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this objection, he says, ‚ÄúThat is not so,‚Äù explaining the same point in a different way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de blo bzhin du zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de blo bzhin du zhes gsungs so//
translated: For that very reason, he says, ‚Äúlike the mind.‚Äù

original: rang gi tshig le'ur byas pa dang bcas pa rtsa ba'i don gsal 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi tshig le'ur byas pa dang bcas pa rtsa ba'i don gsal 'debs pa ni /
translated: The root text and commentary clarify the meaning of the root text with its own verses.

original: dbang po'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the sense faculty.

original: de ltar dbang po las skyes par ro //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po las skyes par ro //
translated: Thus, it arises from the sense faculty.

original: dbang po las skyes pa de yin na'o //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa de yin na'o //
translated: It is that which arises from the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'brangs pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dbang po las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'brangs pa nyid gsal bar byed pa ni dbang po las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt does not follow the sense faculty‚Äù is clarified by the statement, ‚ÄúThe sense faculty. . .

original: @65a * // nye ba med pa ni nye bar mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @65a * // nye ba med pa ni nye bar mi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The absence of proximity is the absence of presence.

original: rtsod pa de nyid la yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pas lan du 'gyur par ston pa ni gang rnam par 'gyur yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa de nyid la yang rnam pa gzhan du bshad pas lan du 'gyur par ston pa ni gang rnam par 'gyur yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the objection is presented in another way in the statement, ‚ÄúEven though it is transformed. . .

original: gal te 'dzin 'gyur phyir zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin 'gyur phyir zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚Äù If you say that it is not because it is grasped,

original: de ci ltar na rnam par shes pas 'gyur ro zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na rnam par shes pas 'gyur ro zhes brjod ce na /
translated: how can you say that it is because it is cognized?

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam par shes pa nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that grasping is the same as cognizing.üîΩIf you say that it is not transformed because it is transformed,

original: ci ste de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mig btsum la yang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste de 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin na zhes bya ba ni mig btsum la yang rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, even when the eyes are closed, there would be no change in the form of the cognition because it would remain in a state of nondisappearance.

original: lan 'di nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyogs so sor sun byung ba nyid de tshogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan 'di nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyogs so sor sun byung ba nyid de tshogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This very answer is the refutation of each position, because there is no other collection.

original: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de tha dad pa ste /
translated: The capacity to generate consciousness is different,

original: so so so sor gyur pa'i phyir te gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so so sor gyur pa'i phyir te gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is individual, because it does not depend on another.

original: gal te gzhan la ltos nas nus pa yin na de'i tshe tshogs pa skyed byed yin pas na gcig med kyang tshogs pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la ltos nas nus pa yin na de'i tshe tshogs pa skyed byed yin pas na gcig med kyang tshogs pa med pa'i phyir yid kyi shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is a capacity in dependence on another, then at that time the collection is the producer, and even if one is absent, the collection does not exist, so mental consciousness would not arise.

original: kyang gi sgras ni zhes bya bas ni nus pa tha dad phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya bas so //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni zhes bya bas ni nus pa tha dad phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i de ma thag tu blta bar bya bas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúalso different‚Äù is to be supplied immediately after ‚Äúbecause of being different capacities.‚Äù

original: kun las kyang ni zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni kha bskangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun las kyang ni zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni kha bskangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The expression ‚Äúfrom all‚Äù is an addition.

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum po'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum po'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni sems nyid med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation in terms of the three alternatives is: because of the non-existence of mind itself.

original: skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa dbang po med pa las so //
analyzed: skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa dbang po med pa las so //
translated: [The reason] is not unestablished, because it is not established that the sense faculties are the cause of the sense consciousnesses.

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin te /
translated: That is precisely what is being asserted.

original: dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba ni spang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is devoid of sense consciousness cannot be rejected.

original: 'on te 'di gtan tshigs ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di gtan tshigs ci ltar yin te /
translated: But how can this be a reason?

original: ma nges pa'i nyes pas nyes chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i nyes pas nyes chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is faulty due to the fault of uncertainty.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show just that, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the mind is the cause of the sense consciousnesses, then the mind itself is the object to be established.‚Äù

original: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩgal te skra dang sen mo'i tse mo la sogs pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te / gal te skra dang sen mo'i tse mo la sogs pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúif you say that the mind is the cause of the sense consciousnesses‚Äù is this:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa med par sgrub na de'i tshe de nyid bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyang yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa med par sgrub na de'i tshe de nyid bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyang yin pas dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid do //
translated: If you establish the non-existence of the mental consciousness in relation to the tips of the hair and nails, etc., then at that time, since that very [mental consciousness] is both what is to be established and the means of establishment, it is just one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: tshor byed nyid ces bya ba ni tshor bar byed pa'i tshor ba de byed pa ste /
analyzed: tshor byed nyid ces bya ba ni tshor bar byed pa'i tshor ba de byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the experiencer‚Äù means that feeling is the experiencer, that is, the one who feels.

original: tshor ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshor ba can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthe one who feels.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe skye ba dang por skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs de las yid kyi shes pa skye ba yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba dang por skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs de las yid kyi shes pa skye ba yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs /
translated: How do you know that the mental consciousness arises from the tips of the hair and nails at the beginning of life?

original: dper na lus dang lce la @65b sogs pa shin tu nye ba na gnas pa las rang gi shes pa dang rjes su 'brel bar rtogs pas na gzhan gyi tshe shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes res 'ga' 'khrul brten par yang 'gyur ba
analyzed: dper na lus dang lce la @65b sogs pa shin tu nye ba na gnas pa las rang gi shes pa dang rjes su 'brel bar rtogs pas na gzhan gyi tshe shes pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang yin no zhes res 'ga' 'khrul brten par yang 'gyur ba
translated: For example, you know that the consciousness of the body and the tongue and so on is related to its own consciousness because it is located in the body and the tongue and so on, which are very close to it. Therefore, sometimes you think that the consciousness of the body and the tongue and so on is the material cause of the consciousness.

original: yin no // skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa ni de ltar rang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshor ba dang ldan par rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yin no // skra dang sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa ni de ltar rang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i tshor ba dang ldan par rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: But the tips of the hair and nails and so on are not known to be related to feeling, which arises and ceases in accordance with them.

original: gang gis res 'ga' de'i nye bar len pa'i tha snyad la brten par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis res 'ga' de'i nye bar len pa'i tha snyad la brten par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, why do you sometimes think that they are the material cause of feeling?

original: grang ba byed par nam yang ma dmigs pa'i me ni grang ba'i rgyu nyid du tha snyad bya bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grang ba byed par nam yang ma dmigs pa'i me ni grang ba'i rgyu nyid du tha snyad bya bar 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to designate fire as the cause of cold because it is never observed to make things cold.

original: de nas gzhan gyi tshe de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir skye ba ni dang po'i sems skye ba na de ltar yin pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de nas gzhan gyi tshe de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir skye ba ni dang po'i sems skye ba na de ltar yin pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Then, at another time, because it is not observed in that way, the arising of the first mind is to be established as nonexistent. Therefore there is no fault.

original: gal te de nyid kyi tshe sems med pa'i phyir sems mi skye bar brjod na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi tshe sems med pa'i phyir sems mi skye bar brjod na /
translated: If you say that the mind does not arise at that time because it is mindless,

original: de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i nyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i nyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would incur the fault of contradicting one part of your own thesis.

original: rang nyid 'thad pa gzhan 'chad pa ni de dang 'brel pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid 'thad pa gzhan 'chad pa ni de dang 'brel pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you explain the other reason, ‚Äúbecause they are not different,‚Äù it is connected to that.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la tha dad par gyur pa na tha dad pa ste so sor gnas pa tha mi dad pa ni so sor mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la tha dad par gyur pa na tha dad pa ste so sor gnas pa tha mi dad pa ni so sor mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Because they are not different means because they are not different, that is, not separate, they are not not separate, that is, not together.

original: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúthey are not different.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that so?

original: nus pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: nus pa de ltar gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o//
translated: Because the potency exists in that way.

original: las de'i nus pa ni ci ltar lhan cig nyid du gnas par byed pa de kho na ltar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las de'i nus pa ni ci ltar lhan cig nyid du gnas par byed pa de kho na ltar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The potency of that karma exists just as it was created.

original: slong ba ni g-yo ba med pa ste zhan pa zhes pa bya'i don to //
analyzed: slong ba ni g-yo ba med pa ste zhan pa zhes pa bya'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not shaken, it is weak.

original: don de gzung bar bya ba'i nges par rtogs pa tsam yog yin pa sgo'i gnas lta bu yin te des zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de gzung bar bya ba'i nges par rtogs pa tsam yog yin pa sgo'i gnas lta bu yin te des zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That meaning is to be grasped. The mere realization is like a door. The meaning is that by that.

original: gdung ba mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: gdung ba mi bzod pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcannot bear the pain‚Äù is explained.

original: gdung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis brdeg pa la sogs pa mi bzod pa de ltar mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gdung ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis brdeg pa la sogs pa mi bzod pa de ltar mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one does not desire to be unable to bear the pain caused by the reason for the pain, such as beating.

original: ci ltar mi bzod ce na de goms pas te gdung ba'i rgyu nyid goms pas so //
analyzed: ci ltar mi bzod ce na de goms pas te gdung ba'i rgyu nyid goms pas so //
translated: How is it that one cannot bear it? It is because of being accustomed to it, because of being accustomed to the cause of pain.

original: gang gi cho mi bzod ce na de yid la mnos pas na ste /
analyzed: gang gi cho mi bzod ce na de yid la mnos pas na ste /
translated: What is it that one cannot bear? It is that which is taken to mind.

original: gdung ba'i rgyu yid la mnos pas na'o //
analyzed: gdung ba'i rgyu yid la mnos pas na'o //
translated: It is because of taking to mind the cause of pain.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gi tshe mtshon brdeg pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas dmigs par gyur ba de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du bsgoms pas nge mi bzod pa ni yid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba gdung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshon brdeg pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas dmigs par gyur ba de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid du bsgoms pas nge mi bzod pa ni yid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba gdung ba'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no
translated: When one focuses on the mind that thinks of being struck by a weapon, etc., then, since one cultivates it as the cause of suffering, the intolerance of that is a mental transformation having the characteristic of torment, and not otherwise.

original: // 'di nyid gsal bar byed @66a * //
analyzed: // 'di nyid gsal bar byed @66a * //
translated: This is clarified:

original: ba ni yid kyi dmigs pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba ni yid kyi dmigs pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind focuses on the object.‚Äù

original: rang gi shes pas myong pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi shes pas myong pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: one experiences it with one‚Äôs consciousness.

original: gal te dmigs pa nyid rten ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa nyid rten ma yin nam /
translated: If the object is not the basis,

original: de ci ltar na rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be the basis?

original: dmigs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: ‚ÄúThe object is the basis.‚Äù

original: phyi rol ni nad la sogs pas nyams pa lta bu'i lus so //
analyzed: phyi rol ni nad la sogs pas nyams pa lta bu'i lus so //
translated: The external is the body, which is impaired by disease, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phyi rol lo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the external.

original: brjod bar 'dod pa'i lhag ma ston pa ni de med kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod bar 'dod pa'i lhag ma ston pa ni de med kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The remainder of what is intended is shown: ‚ÄúEven without that.‚Äù

original: ngal mtshon phog par 'ong ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam bar ro //
analyzed: ngal mtshon phog par 'ong ngo zhes bya ba'i rnam bar ro //
translated: The construction is: ‚ÄúThe mind is tormented by the thought that the external is struck by a weapon.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa yod kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pas sgro btags pa rnam pa phyi dang nang yang rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa yod kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pas sgro btags pa rnam pa phyi dang nang yang rig pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, even though there is an object of harm, the mental consciousness is aware of the aspect that is superimposed.

original: phyi'am nang gi gnod par byed pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'am nang gi gnod par byed pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig pa ma yin no //
translated: But the external or internal object of harm is not aware by its own nature.

original: des na sgro btags pa'i rnam pa de'i 'gyur bas yid de yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun phyi ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rnams der 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na sgro btags pa'i rnam pa de'i 'gyur bas yid de yid kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun phyi ma'i rang bzhin du gyur pa rnams der 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the mind, the mental consciousness, is transformed into the nature of the subsequent continuum by the transformation of that superimposed aspect.

original: rnal du gnas pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di tsam gyis ni rnam par 'gyur ba las sam /
analyzed: rnal du gnas pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ro // 'di tsam gyis ni rnam par 'gyur ba las sam /
translated: It is not in a state of normalcy.üîΩThis much is said:

original: rnam par 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang rung ste /
translated: whether it is from the transformation or the establishment of the transformation,

original: phyi'am nang gi rten ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'am nang gi rten ma yin te /
translated: it is not the external or internal basis,

original: sgro btags pa nyid rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa nyid rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: because the transformation is just a superimposition.

original: dngos po dmigs bzhin pa nyid rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin mod de lta na yang dmigs pa nyid ni rten ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dmigs bzhin pa nyid rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin mod de lta na yang dmigs pa nyid ni rten ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is the transformation of the mere apprehension of an entity, still, the object of apprehension is not the basis,üîΩbecause it is not the basis of the transformation.

original: bstan ma thag pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it is just as has been taught.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The support and the object.üîΩThen, it is not the support of that body.

original: de nas lus de'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yin yang yid kyi shes pa'i rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas lus de'i rten ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yin yang yid kyi shes pa'i rten ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is the object, it is not the support of mental consciousness.

original: des na nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyon mongs pa can te de nyid ni 'khor ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na nga dang nga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa nyon mongs pa can te de nyid ni 'khor ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the afflicted engagement in the aspect of I and mine, etc. and that itself is cyclic existence.

original: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin zhes na /
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten gang yin zhes na /
translated: Well then, what is the support of mental consciousness?

original: de'i rten gang yin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni'o //
analyzed: de'i rten gang yin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni'o //
translated: That which is its support is the foundation consciousness.üîΩThat is established by scripture.

original: lung las grub pa de yang rtags par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: lung las grub pa de yang rtags par yod pa yin te /
translated: It is also established by reasoning.

original: rten med pa ni bzod pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du bshad pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rten med pa ni bzod pa rjes su gzung ba'i don du bshad pa yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The explanation that it has no support is for the sake of those who are to be guided by the teaching of patience.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par dmigs pa dang / rten gyis stong par ston pa ni snga phyir sgro btags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dam par dmigs pa dang / rten gyis stong par ston pa ni snga phyir sgro btags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching that ultimately it is empty of objects and support is the superimposition of earlier and later.

original: nga de dang de zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma ni sgro btags pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: nga de dang de zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma ni sgro btags pa tsam yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ‚Äúthis‚Äù are mere reifications of the prior and subsequent.

original: dmigs pa yin te @66b de'i rnam par shes pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin te @66b de'i rnam par shes pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an objective referent because its consciousness appears.

original: de yang 'khrul pas na dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pas na dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: And that is mistaken, so there is no objective referent.

original: rten med pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brtags yod du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa brtags yod du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of a basis is because the store consciousness is a conceptual existent.

original: des na blo nyid blo'i rten no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: des na blo nyid blo'i rten no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the mind itself is the basis of the mind.

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni khyad par can te /
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba ni khyad par can te /
translated: The words ‚Äúits cause‚Äù are a specification.

original: bdag ldog pa sa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ldog pa sa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù is a reversal of the order of the words ‚Äúfrom that.‚Äù

original: dper na 'od dang du ba la sogs pa la sgron ma dang me la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'od dang du ba la sogs pa la sgron ma dang me la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying ‚Äúlamp‚Äù and ‚Äúfire‚Äù for light and smoke.

original: 'di yod na zhes bya bar gsungs pa ni bdun pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di yod na zhes bya bar gsungs pa ni bdun pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The words ‚Äúwhen this exists‚Äù are stated as the seventh case.

original: de nyid nas 'di skyes ba'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba'i chogs ni skyes phyir zhes bya bas mtshon to //
analyzed: de nyid nas 'di skyes ba'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba'i chogs ni skyes phyir zhes bya bas mtshon to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause this arises‚Äù indicates the word ‚Äúarising.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang 'di las skyes zhes bya ba yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di las skyes zhes bya ba yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the phrase ‚Äúarises from this‚Äù would also be stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid las lnga zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid las lnga zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said in the same text that there are five kinds of conditions.

original: rgyu log pas bzlog par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu log pas bzlog par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de'i phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The condition that is the opposite of the cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.

original: gang zhig res 'ga' zhes bya ba la lus kyi bsku byug la sogs pa ltar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig res 'ga' zhes bya ba la lus kyi bsku byug la sogs pa ltar ro //
translated: The condition that is the opposite of the object is like the body‚Äôs anointing with oil, etc.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.

original: 'di tsam gyi ni rang log pas zlog par byed pa nyid ni rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis khyab par brjod pa yin no //üîΩblo la ni lus de ltar ma yin par brjod pa ni lus yod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyid la rtag tu phan 'dogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //üîΩkhyab par byed par mi dmigs pa ma grub pa spang pa ni sems snga ma tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyi ni rang log pas zlog par byed pa nyid ni rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis khyab par brjod pa yin no // blo la ni lus de ltar ma yin par brjod pa ni lus yod pa ni zhes bya ba'o // yid la rtag tu phan 'dogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o // khyab par byed par mi dmigs pa ma grub pa spang pa ni sems snga ma tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.

original: lus snga ma kho na bzhin gnas kyang skrag pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas yid phyi ma 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus snga ma kho na bzhin gnas kyang skrag pa dang mya ngan la sogs pas yid phyi ma 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that is to be abandoned.üîΩThe condition that is the opposite of the absence of a cause is the one that is the counteragent to the result that

original: rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not always concomitant.

original: nye bar len pa'i sems des nye bar bstan pa de yongs su bzung ba las so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i sems des nye bar bstan pa de yongs su bzung ba las so //
translated: It is taught that the body is appropriated from the grasping mind.

original: de ltar lus med kyang yod par dogs pas na rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rang log pas ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus med kyang yod par dogs pas na rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir rang log pas ldog par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although the body does not exist, it is as if it does, and therefore it is not the case that it is reversed by its own reversal, because it is not always concomitant.

original: lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub pa'i tshad ma yang med do zhes bstan pa'i don du lus ni zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub pa'i tshad ma yang med do zhes bstan pa'i don du lus ni zhes bya ba'o /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no valid cognition that establishes the body and the mental consciousness as cause and effect, he says, ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of the mental consciousness.‚Äù

original: rang ngam gzhan 'ga'i sa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rang ngam gzhan 'ga'i sa zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúOf oneself or of another‚Äù is supplied.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni ma pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni ma pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn any other way‚Äù means in any other way than as cause and effect.

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'brel to //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge‚Äù is supplied throughout.

original: de la / de la skyes ba dang ma skyes ba'i phyogs sel ba ni de la re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la / de la skyes ba dang ma skyes ba'i phyogs sel ba ni de la re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: With regard to that, the elimination of the position that the body is produced from the mental consciousness is as follows.

original: gzhal zhes bya ba ni nga'i zhes rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa zhes 'grel to //
analyzed: gzhal zhes bya ba ni nga'i zhes rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa zhes 'grel to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the body is the object of the mental consciousness‚Äù means that it is not the case that the body is the object of the mental consciousness.

original: yang na @67a * //
analyzed: yang na @67a * //
translated: Or else,
