original: de ltar rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi ngo bo la dmigs pa'am /
translated: it should be explained that ‚Äúin that way‚Äù refers to the observation of its own nature,

original: gzhan la zhes bya bar tha dad par dmigs pa la'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya bar tha dad par dmigs pa la'o zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: or to the observation of something different, that is, something other than itself.

original: de rtogs pa nyid ni dmigs pa rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rtogs pa nyid ni dmigs pa rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: The very understanding of that is the very understanding of the object.

original: gzhan te dmigs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzhan te dmigs pa ma yin pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'o //
translated: The other is not the object, but is the relation of cause and effect.

original: gang zhig rtogs pa bkag pa de'i rnam par brjod pa ni bdag 'di las skyes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs pa bkag pa de'i rnam par brjod pa ni bdag 'di las skyes so zhes bya'o //
translated: The negation of the understanding of that is the expression ‚Äúarises from this self.‚Äù

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi de dag la yang rnam par rtog ba de dag nyid nyams ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi de dag la yang rnam par rtog ba de dag nyid nyams ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù refers to the fact that the other‚Äôs ideas are not undermined.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚Äú No‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba la nye ba'i phyir mi phyed ba nyid las yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid ces bya ba la nye ba'i phyir mi phyed ba nyid las yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the very understanding‚Äù means because of the very nondifferentiation.

original: mig phye ba nyid ces bya ba ni de las sngar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig phye ba nyid ces bya ba ni de las sngar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the very opening of the eye‚Äù means that it is not understood prior to that.

original: de'i tshe ni mig gi byed pa med la /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni mig gi byed pa med la /
translated: At that time, the eye has no function.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ldog pa bsgrubs pa mi dmigs pa'i byed pa bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ldog pa bsgrubs pa mi dmigs pa'i byed pa bstan pa yin la /
translated: Because there is no realization of blue, etc., the function of non-apprehension of the establishment of the counter-correlate is shown.

original: de ma thag tu gzugs mthong ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'dzin pa rim gyis byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis kyi byed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu gzugs mthong ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'dzin pa rim gyis byung ba'i mngon sum gnyis kyi byed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase immediately after, there is the realization of the seeing of form shows the function of the two direct perceptions that arise in sequence, which are the means of sustaining the student.

original: 'di yang sngar nyams su myong ba yod na 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di yang sngar nyams su myong ba yod na 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If there is prior experience of this, it occurs.

original: skye ba dang po'i sngon rol du ni nyams su myong ba srid pa ma yin no zhes zhe la bzhag nas skye ba dang por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i sngon rol du ni nyams su myong ba srid pa ma yin no zhes zhe la bzhag nas skye ba dang por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But prior to the first birth, experience is not possible, thinking this, he says in the first birth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: shes pa snga na med ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa snga na med ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says if there is no prior cognition.

original: gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase by another, etc. raises a second consideration: If...

original: de zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The phrase that... refers to the cause of the mental consciousness.

original: skye ba dang po las sngan yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa gzhan gyis kyang ga la rtogs te /
analyzed: skye ba dang po las sngan yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa gzhan gyis kyang ga la rtogs te /
translated: How could it be known by any other mental consciousness that existed previously, since it did not exist previously?

original: sems ni sngar med pa las lus yod na yod do zhes nges /
analyzed: sems ni sngar med pa las lus yod na yod do zhes nges /
translated: It is certain that the mind exists when the body exists, and that it does not exist when the body does not exist.

original: de ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not the domain of others.

original: de nyid phyir bltar rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir bltar rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not visible.

original: de ltar yin dang gnyid log pa la shes pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang gnyid log pa la shes pa yod pa yin la /
translated: If this were so, then consciousness would exist in one who is asleep,

original: de las sad pa las sngar shes pa dmigs su med pa na /
analyzed: de las sad pa las sngar shes pa dmigs su med pa na /
translated: and since it is not perceived prior to awakening,

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa med par rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa med par rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not be established that consciousness does not exist in the dream state.

original: gal te blta bar mi nus pa yang mthong ba tsam gyis 'gog na /
analyzed: gal te blta bar mi nus pa yang mthong ba tsam gyis 'gog na /
translated: If you refute the existence of consciousness merely on the ground that it is not visible,

original: de'i tshe rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi tshor ba yang 'gog par thal @67b lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi tshor ba yang 'gog par thal @67b lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that you are refuting the existence of the feelings that you experience in a dream.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If you say that

original: rang rig pa nyid ni rang gi dran pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ni rang gi dran pa kho na'o //
translated: self-awareness is simply memory of itself.

original: des na ma dran pa'i phyir rmi lam na blo yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na ma dran pa'i phyir rmi lam na blo yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-memory, there is no cognition in a dream.

original: cig yod kyang brjed pa 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cig yod kyang brjed pa 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Even if it exists, it is forgotten‚Äù means

original: gsal ba med pa'i phyir shes pa brjed pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba med pa'i phyir shes pa brjed pa'o //
translated: that the cognition is forgotten because of the absence of clarity.

original: gsal ba med na ni nyams su myong ba yod kyang brjed pa mthong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gsal ba med na ni nyams su myong ba yod kyang brjed pa mthong ba kho na'o //
translated: If there is no clarity, then even if there is an experience, it is seen to be forgotten.

original: 'di ltar sad pas byas pa ni rmi lam du mi dran te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pas byas pa ni rmi lam du mi dran te /
translated: Thus, what is done while awake is not remembered in a dream.

original: dran na ni de'i mod la rmi lam 'di gnas pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba na de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dran na ni de'i mod la rmi lam 'di gnas pa yin no zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba na de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were remembered, then it would be understood that the dream exists at that time, but that is not the case.

original: de lta na yang rmi lam gyi shes pa de ni sad pa'i shes pa de nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rmi lam gyi shes pa de ni sad pa'i shes pa de nyid las yin no //
translated: Even so, that dream cognition is from that very cognition of the waking state.

original: de bzhin du srid pa snga ma'i rnam par shes pa dran par ma gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa snga ma'i rnam par shes pa dran par ma gyur pa /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of the previous existence is not remembered,

original: bltar mi rung bas na dgag par mi nus pa las shes pa 'di 'byung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bltar mi rung bas na dgag par mi nus pa las shes pa 'di 'byung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: because it is not seen, it cannot be refuted. Thus, this cognition arises from that.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú But if‚Äù means

original: gal te yang gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pas sad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag tu skyes pa yin no zhes sus kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang sad ba na gnyid log pa las langs pa
analyzed: gal te yang gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs na rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pas sad pa'i rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag tu skyes pa yin no zhes sus kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa de lta na yang sad ba na gnyid log pa las langs pa
translated: But even if no one realizes that the consciousness in a dream state arises immediately after the consciousness of the waking state, still, when one awakens from sleep, one thinks, ‚ÄúI have arisen from sleep andüîΩnow I am awake.‚Äù

original: ste / nga las ni sad pa'i shes pa'i de ma thag kho nar rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa skyes par gyur to zhes rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ste / nga las ni sad pa'i shes pa'i de ma thag kho nar rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa skyes par gyur to zhes rtogs so zhe na /
translated: And one thinks, ‚ÄúImmediately after the consciousness of the waking state, the consciousness of the dream state arose.‚Äù

original: skye ba dang po'i lus thob pa 'di yang sad nas skye ba snga ma'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa 'di skyas so zhes bya bar mi rtogs zhes bya ba de ga las yin /üîΩgang gi tshe yang rung ste de 'dra ba'i smos pa'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can sad par gyur pa na skye ba gzhan rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i lus thob pa 'di yang sad nas skye ba snga ma'i rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa 'di skyas so zhes bya bar mi rtogs zhes bya ba de ga las yin /üîΩgang gi tshe yang rung ste de 'dra ba'i smos pa'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i mtshan nyid can sad par gyur pa na skye ba gzhan rtogs par bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: But why is it that one does not think, ‚ÄúThis body that I have obtained in this birth arose from the consciousness of a previous birth‚Äù?üîΩWhen one awakens from sleep, one thinks, ‚ÄúI have arisen from sleep,‚Äù and one thinks, ‚ÄúI will realize another birth.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore is a conclusion.

original: lus 'di log na'o //
analyzed: lus 'di log na'o //
translated: When this body is destroyed.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: But is that of another.

original: lci ba de'o //
analyzed: lci ba de'o //
translated: That is heavy.üîΩThe lotus is born from heavy earth, but later it is born from just a lotus, even though that is not heavy.

original: bsam pa ni lci ba las autpala skye ba yin la phyis ni de med kyang autpala nyid las skye ba yin zhing de lta na yang dang po'i lci pa med na mi skye ba kho na'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni lci ba las autpala skye ba yin la phyis ni de med kyang autpala nyid las skye ba yin zhing de lta na yang dang po'i lci pa med na mi skye ba kho na'o //
translated: But still, if the original heavy earth is absent, it is not born at all.

original: de bzhi na du dang po ni lus la sems skye la /üîΩphyis ni de med kyang sems las skye ba ni lus la sems skye la /
analyzed: de bzhi na du dang po ni lus la sems skye la / phyis ni de med kyang sems las skye ba ni lus la sems skye la /
translated: In the same way, the mind is born from the body in the beginning,üîΩbut later it is born from the mind alone, even though the body is absent.

original: phyis ni de med kyang sems las skye ba kho na'o //
analyzed: phyis ni de med kyang sems las skye ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that the mind is born from the body alone.

original: des na gang zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de rnam par shes pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du @68a * //üîΩ'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba de yang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa de rnam par shes pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du @68a * // 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba de yang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if a consciousness is mental consciousness, that consciousness is preceded by mental consciousness.

original: des na srid pa snga ma ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na srid pa snga ma ma grub po zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, a prior existence is not established.

original: lan du de yang gi na ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de yang gi na ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThat also is not so.‚Äù

original: lci ba de med par ni autpala las ma mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba de med par ni autpala las ma mthong ba nyid do //
translated: The heaviness is not seen in the lotus.

original: 'on te ma nges par brtsad pas srid pa snga ma ma grub pa la 'di ni dpe ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma nges par brtsad pas srid pa snga ma ma grub pa la 'di ni dpe ma yin no //
translated: But if the argument is inconclusive, then this is not an example of a prior non-established existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhes na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir shes pa de las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa de las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Because the cognition is the opposite of that.

original: dang po ci 'dra ba srid ba de 'dra ba kho na phyis kyang mthong pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po ci 'dra ba srid ba de 'dra ba kho na phyis kyang mthong pa yin no //
translated: Whatever the first is like, that is exactly what is seen later.

original: des na ci ltar dbus kyi gnas skabs na yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bzhin du skye ba dang bo'i yang yin te de 'dra ba yin ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na ci ltar dbus kyi gnas skabs na yid kyi rnam par shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de bzhin du skye ba dang bo'i yang yin te de 'dra ba yin ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the middle state is preceded by mental consciousness, so is the first birth, because it is like that.

original: 'chad pa ni ci 'dra pa'i autpala zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ci 'dra pa'i autpala zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is: ‚ÄúWhatever the lotus is like.‚Äù

original: autpala'i dpe des so //
analyzed: autpala'i dpe des so //
translated: By that example of the lotus.

original: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma bshad ba'i don du gzhan slong bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma bshad ba'i don du gzhan slong bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the remainder of the commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, he raises another point: ‚ÄúIf you say . . .‚Äù

original: mi gsung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsung ba yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it that he does not speak, because he possesses great compassion.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar sbyar zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sngar sbyar zin to //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is connected to the previous verse.

original: ngag gcig nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gcig nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that there is only one voice, he says, ‚Äúwhen this exists.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa zhes bya ba gyur na bdun pa nyid rgyu mtshan gyi don bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bshad pa yin te yod na zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par gzung ba lhur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa zhes bya ba gyur na bdun pa nyid rgyu mtshan gyi don bstan pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gyi bdun par bshad pa yin te yod na zhes bya ba 'di ni nges par gzung ba lhur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seventh case is called the ‚Äúcausal‚Äù because it shows the meaning of cause. The seventh case is explained as the causal when it is the cause of something. The word ‚Äúwhen‚Äù is used because it emphasizes the certainty.

original: de lta na yang rtag tu rjes su 'jug par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rtag tu rjes su 'jug par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Even so, how does it always follow?

original: gzhan du na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúotherwise‚Äù is stated.

original: gang zhig gang med par rgyun chags par mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu mtshan du grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par rgyun chags par mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu mtshan du grags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is well known that that which does not occur without something else is the cause of that.

original: lnga pa yang rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: lnga pa yang rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: The fifth case is always the follower.

original: rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni lnga ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni lnga ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse means that the cause is also the agent.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: 'byung khungs nyid kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'byung khungs nyid kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe source itself.‚Äù

original: skye ba byed pa po las 'byung ba zhes bya bya ba'i tshig 'dis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba byed pa po las 'byung ba zhes bya bya ba'i tshig 'dis shes par bya'o //
translated: This is understood from the statement, ‚ÄúThe source is the agent of arising.‚Äù

original: de la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don lhu ra gyur ba'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la yang 'byung khungs kyi ming du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba zhes bya ba'i don lhu ra gyur ba'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la yang 'byung khungs kyi ming du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: In that case, the meaning of ‚Äúarising‚Äù is the source, so the application of the term ‚Äúarising‚Äù and so on is also just the name of the source.

original: p'a ni ni mdor ni pra kri ta'i sga nye bar len pa'i rgyu brjod pa la sbyar ro //
analyzed: p'a ni ni mdor ni pra kri ta'i sga nye bar len pa'i rgyu brjod pa la sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse is connected to the brief statement of the cause of appropriation.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir @68b rgyu tsam 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir de'i gnas su 'byung ba'i sgra bzhag nas mtshan nyid bris so //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir @68b rgyu tsam 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir de'i gnas su 'byung ba'i sgra bzhag nas mtshan nyid bris so //
translated: Since this is an illustration, in order to grasp just the cause, the word ‚Äúsource‚Äù is placed in that position and the definition is written.

original: de lta na yang skabs la ci phan snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang skabs la ci phan snyam na /
translated: Even so, what is the point of the context?

original: 'byung yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe source itself.‚Äù

original: 'di las 'bras su rgyun chags su 'byung ba shes rab kyi don to //
analyzed: 'di las 'bras su rgyun chags su 'byung ba shes rab kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of wisdom is that the effect arises in continuity from the cause.

original: des na rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rtag tu rjes su 'brel pa bstan pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that the self is always related to the body.

original: de ltar rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis ni rang log pas log par byed pa nyid khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis ni rang log pas log par byed pa nyid khyab pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the pervasion is established that the self is the agent of action because it is always related to the body.üîΩBut the body is not the agent of action because it is not the self.

original: lus la ni de med pa'i phyir log par byed pa nyid med kyang 'jig rten pha rog srid pa tsam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus la ni de med pa'i phyir log par byed pa nyid med kyang 'jig rten pha rog srid pa tsam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Although the body is not the agent of action because it is not the self, the world is merely a possibility in the next world.

original: ci ltar rjes su 'brel pa'i bshad pa byas kyang ma rangs par rnam 'grel gyi ye shes dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du rang gi bshad pa dgod pa'i phyir yang na bdag cag gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su 'brel pa'i bshad pa byas kyang ma rangs par rnam 'grel gyi ye shes dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du rang gi bshad pa dgod pa'i phyir yang na bdag cag gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, although the explanation of the self as always related to the body is given, in order to set forth our own explanation in accordance with the wisdom of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, it is said, ‚ÄúOr, we say that the first arising of consciousness is . . . ‚Äù

original: skye ba dang po rnam par shes pa de ni'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang po rnam par shes pa de ni'o //
translated: The first arising of consciousness is the first arising of consciousness in this life.

original: rgyal 'gyur ro zhes rung ba nyid rjes su dpog na 'jig rten pha rol legs par bsgrub par 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan the tshom med par 'jig rten pha rol la zhugs pa yang legs pa na'o //
analyzed: rgyal 'gyur ro zhes rung ba nyid rjes su dpog na 'jig rten pha rol legs par bsgrub par 'gyur ba dang ; gzhan the tshom med par 'jig rten pha rol la zhugs pa yang legs pa na'o //
translated: And if one enters into a good rebirth without doubt, then it is good.

original: des 'di pa'i 'bras bu nyid la khur dgod pa bla'o //
analyzed: des 'di pa'i 'bras bu nyid la khur dgod pa bla'o //
translated: Therefore, it is better to place the burden on the result of this.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la re bas don stong pa la sogs pa dka' ba sna tshogs pa la brten pas ni go bcad do zhes 'bad pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la re bas don stong pa la sogs pa dka' ba sna tshogs pa la brten pas ni go bcad do zhes 'bad pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: Since one relies on various hardships, such as fasting, in the hope of a good rebirth, one is deceived. This is indicated by the word ‚Äúeffort.‚Äù

original: 'on te snga ma bzhin du rgyu ma tshang pa med pa nyid kyis 'byung ba'i srid par 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma bzhin du rgyu ma tshang pa med pa nyid kyis 'byung ba'i srid par 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if one asserts that, as before, existence arises only through the non-deficiency of causes,

original: 'o na ni rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not possible to infer that it is possible.

original: 'on kyang skye ba gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skye ba gzhan nyid do //
translated: But it is just another birth.

original: de lta mod kyi rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rgyu las 'bras bu rjes su dpog ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: In that case, it is said that the error of inferring the effect from the cause would occur.

original: 'dir bshad pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus khyad par ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pas zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase because it is engaged in that refers to a particular object and time.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon nyid kyis don gzhan go bar bya ba la 'bras bu nyid gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon nyid kyis don gzhan go bar bya ba la 'bras bu nyid gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: In this way, the master himself states, The effect itself is the logical reason for understanding another object.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because there is no error.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid yin na ci ltar 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid yin na ci ltar 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the cause of what is to arise, how can it be the effect?

original: lam du ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam du ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the path, etc.

original: da lta yod pa'i dngos po de 'byung ba'i dngos po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te de ni 'bras bu yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: da lta yod pa'i dngos po de 'byung ba'i dngos po'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te de ni 'bras bu yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the present thing is the effect of the thing that is to arise, it is the effect. This is the meaning.

original: gal te da ltar yod pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bur ci ltar 'gyur snyam @69a * //
analyzed: gal te da ltar yod pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bur ci ltar 'gyur snyam @69a * //
translated: If you think, how can the present be the effect of the future?

original: pa'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag nas don 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grub pa kho na'i zhes ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i dogs pa zhe la bzhag nas don 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grub pa kho na'i zhes ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having placed this doubt in mind, in order to demonstrate that this meaning is established only by mundane convention, he says, In this way, etc.

original: sems dang mig dang sna la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni gsal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / rmi lam gyi khyad par dmigs pa dang 'gul ba dang nyams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba dge legs la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dang mig dang sna la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni gsal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / rmi lam gyi khyad par dmigs pa dang 'gul ba dang nyams pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba dge legs la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The transformation of the mind, eyes, nose, and so on, which is characterized by clarity, mental satisfaction, the perception of special dreams, movement, and the experience of bliss, and so on, is the cause for the accomplishment of future virtue and so on.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dge legs la sogs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba de mthong la /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dge legs la sogs pa de'i rnam par 'gyur ba de mthong la /
translated: The transformation of that is seen as future virtue and so on.

original: de rnam pa bsgyur ba de yang 'bras bu nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de rnam pa bsgyur ba de yang 'bras bu nyid du brjod do //
translated: And that transformation is also called the result.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi sgras ni 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi sgras ni 'di skad brjod de /
translated: The term ‚Äúconvention‚Äù is used in the world in the following way.

original: ha kyang thal ba spangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyis mtshan byas ba gang yin pa de gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du byed na de'i tshe sngar 'byung ba la 'bras bu'i tha snyad du byed pa yang sus bzlog ces bya ba'o ;
analyzed: ha kyang thal ba spangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos kyis mtshan byas ba gang yin pa de gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du byed na de'i tshe sngar 'byung ba la 'bras bu'i tha snyad du byed pa yang sus bzlog ces bya ba'o ;
translated: If the treatise is called ‚Äúthe treatise of the one who has abandoned the ashes,‚Äù then when it is used as a worldly convention, who can refute the use of the term ‚Äúresult‚Äù for that which occurs earlier?

original: /'o na 'das pa zhes bya ba la rgyur mngon par 'dod pa rang gi dus la ltos nas ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: /'o na 'das pa zhes bya ba la rgyur mngon par 'dod pa rang gi dus la ltos nas ni byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But if the past is asserted to be a cause, it is not arisen or in the process of arising in dependence on its own time,

original: da ltar ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the present.

original: 'bras bu'i dus la ltos nas ni ci ltar 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus la ltos nas ni ci ltar 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa de bzhin du gzhan 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In dependence on the time of the effect, it is the past, just as it is the future.

original: des na de yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pa nyid yin pas na ci ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa yin ma yin te bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: des na de yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pa nyid yin pas na ci ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa yin ma yin te bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist at the time of the effect, how can it be a cause? The activity of a cause is other than that of an effect.

original: skabs kyis na sdar skyes ba'i rgyu ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyis na sdar skyes ba'i rgyu ni yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this context, the past is a cause because it exists.

original: lan du skye ba'i dus de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du skye ba'i dus de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe time of arising is that of the future.‚Äù

original: smras pa 'di'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: smras pa 'di'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The meaning of this response is as follows:

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir rgyu de'i dus na dus mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir rgyu de'i dus na dus mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since arising is a phenomenon that is an effect, it follows that it exists at the time of its cause.

original: 'on te 'bras bu skyed bar byed pa'i dus la skye pa'i dus su brjod par 'dod dang zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu skyed bar byed pa'i dus la skye pa'i dus su brjod par 'dod dang zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Or do you want to say that the time of the effect‚Äôs arising is the time of the cause‚Äôs arising?

original: gal te 'bras bu las snga rol zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las snga rol zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the cause is prior to the effect,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu med pa des na ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu yang med pas na ci ltar phan gdags par bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'bras bu med pa des na ci ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu yang med pas na ci ltar phan gdags par bya ba yin /
translated: then at that time the effect does not exist. Therefore, how could the non-existent cause be a benefactor? In the same way, the effect that will arise does not exist. Therefore, how could it be benefited?

original: des na med pa la ni phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na med pa la ni phan 'dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-existent is not benefited.

original: gzhan gyis de nyid kyi @69b phyir zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de nyid kyi @69b phyir zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúFor that very reason.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don ci zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas med pa byed do zhes bya ba'i don ci zhes dris pa'o //
translated: The proponent of the conclusion asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of ‚Äòthe non-existent is made‚Äô?‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis lan du de'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis lan du de'i de ma thag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent replies, ‚ÄúIt is the immediate antecedent.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ma thag pa de ni zhes so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ma thag pa de ni zhes so //
translated: The proponent of the conclusion says, ‚ÄúThat immediate antecedent . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù clarifies that.

original: de ma thag pa nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: The SautrƒÅntika replies: We accept the condition as immediately antecedent, but we do not accept that the condition as immediately antecedent is only that.

original: de ma thag pa med kyang rgyu nyid du gdon mi za bar 'gyur zhas gsungs pa ni de ma thag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa med kyang rgyu nyid du gdon mi za bar 'gyur zhas gsungs pa ni de ma thag pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The author of the commentary says: Even if there is no condition as immediately antecedent, it must be a cause.

original: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na ni rang ngam gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'am med par des pa ni ma yin zhing sad pa'i dus su gdon mi za bar de ltar dran pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs na ni rang ngam gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'am med par des pa ni ma yin zhing sad pa'i dus su gdon mi za bar de ltar dran pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In the state of deep sleep, it is not certain that there is or is not consciousness of oneself or another, and it is not remembered as such at the time of waking.

original: de skad du yang ste dngos po med pa'i rig pa ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang ste dngos po med pa'i rig pa ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained in the verse: ‚ÄúHow can there be cognition without an object?‚Äù

original: rgyu de nyid du nges pa ni ring du spangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid du nges pa ni ring du spangs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is only when it is definitely the cause that it is excluded.

original: yod pa dang med bar the tshom za ba'i phyir sha za ni du ba'i rgyur nges ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med bar the tshom za ba'i phyir sha za ni du ba'i rgyur nges ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is uncertain whether it exists or not, the smell is not ascertained as the cause of smoke.

original: lus ni mthong yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de la lus ni zhes bya ba ste shes pa de la'o //
analyzed: lus ni mthong yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de la lus ni zhes bya ba ste shes pa de la'o //
translated: The body is not the cause, even though it is seen. This is explained in the verse: ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of that consciousness.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de ni sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the prior consciousness.

original: 'di snyam du lus ni shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du lus ni shes pa'i rgyu ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But it is not the body that is the cause of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang 'das nas ring du lon pa'i rig pa nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'das nas ring du lon pa'i rig pa nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: Rather, the prior consciousness is the cause.

original: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs su ni rnam par shes pa yod dam med the tshom za ba'i phyir na rgyu'am rgyu ma yin pa nyid du rnam par bzhag pa la nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyid stug po log pa'i gnas skabs su ni rnam par shes pa yod dam med the tshom za ba'i phyir na rgyu'am rgyu ma yin pa nyid du rnam par bzhag pa la nus pa ma yin no //
translated: In the state of deep sleep, it is uncertain whether or not consciousness exists, and so it is not possible to determine whether or not it is the cause.üîΩThe Lokayatikas assert that the body is the cause of consciousness, and they assert that the prior consciousness does not exist.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa ni lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin par bsgrub pa'i don du dbus su de med par 'dod pa yin na de med par khas blangs kyang lus rgyu yin par ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phan pa ni lus rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin par bsgrub pa'i don du dbus su de med par 'dod pa yin na de med par khas blangs kyang lus rgyu yin par ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: But even if one accepts that the prior consciousness does not exist, it is not established that the body is the cause.

original: 'das nas ring du lon pa nyid rgyu yin par tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'das nas ring du lon pa nyid rgyu yin par tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Because it is established by valid cognition that the prior consciousness is the cause.

original: 'di nyid gsal par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal par byed pa ni /
translated: This is what it means.

original: lus de 'dra ba'i nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus de 'dra ba'i nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified in the line ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of consciousness.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe na tshod dang rgyags pa la sogs pas lus mtshungs pa gnyis gnyid mthug pos log pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na tshod dang rgyags pa la sogs pas lus mtshungs pa gnyis gnyid mthug pos log pa na'o //
translated: When two bodies are equal in terms of age, intoxication, and so on, and they both fall asleep in deep sleep.

original: gal te de'i tshe yang khyad par phra mo 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe yang khyad par phra mo 'ga' zhig yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that even then, some subtle difference will occur,

original: de lta na 'o na shes pa la yang mtshon par dga' pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur na shin du yang rigs mi mthun par ni mthong pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na shes pa la yang mtshon par dga' pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur na shin du yang rigs mi mthun par ni mthong pa yin no //
translated: then in that case, there will be a difference in terms of the pleasure of knowing, but it is seen that they are very different.

original: de'i phyir 'das nas ring du lon pa las skyes pas @70a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das nas ring du lon pa las skyes pas @70a * //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the difference in the speed of the arising of the effect is due to the difference in the speed of the arising of the cause.

original: rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: It is reasonable.

original: tshogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig las ni myur ba dang bul ba'i khyad par du gyur kyang de tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin te de'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig las ni myur ba dang bul ba'i khyad par du gyur kyang de tsam gyis rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin te de'i rgyu mtshan rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there is a difference in speed due to some difference in the collection, that alone does not establish the relation of cause and effect, because the reason is the same in terms of following and reversing.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de nyid mjug sdud pas de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu de nyid mjug sdud pas de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: The very cause of arising is summarized at the end, therefore.

original: 'byung 'gyur la yang zhes yang gi sgras ni 'das ma thag pa dang 'das nas ring du lon pa sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur la yang zhes yang gi sgras ni 'das ma thag pa dang 'das nas ring du lon pa sdud pa'o //
translated: The word also in in the future includes the immediately past and the distant past.

original: khyad par gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid dam de ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid dam de ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: The word another means prior or immediate.

original: bdun pa dang lnga pas ni rgyu snga ma'i dngos por bstan pa yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba 'di gnyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa dang lnga pas ni rgyu snga ma'i dngos por bstan pa yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba 'di gnyis grub pa yin no //
translated: The seventh and fifth lines indicate the prior state of the cause. These two analyses are established.

original: snga ma'i dngos po de las phyi ma'i dngos por yang dang pos kyang bstan pa yin ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i dngos po de las phyi ma'i dngos por yang dang pos kyang bstan pa yin ste /
translated: The first line also indicates the subsequent state of the cause from the prior state of the cause.

original: dang po ni bsgrub bya'i rnam par dbye ba yin no //üîΩrgyu mtshan tsam zhig ces bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: dang po ni bsgrub bya'i rnam par dbye ba yin no // rgyu mtshan tsam zhig ces bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The first line is the analysis of the probandum.üîΩBy the words merely the reason,

original: lung las ni 'di rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam du bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung las ni 'di rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam du bzhed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it means that the scriptures accept this as merely the causal state.

original: de bzhin du ma skyes pa la skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma skyes pa la skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: So too, it is not tenable to say that what has not arisen arises, because this has the characteristic of ‚Äúthis arises because that has arisen.‚Äù

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚Äú Well then‚Äù is a conclusion.

original: zhig pa skye bar yang zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa ltos pas yin no //
analyzed: zhig pa skye bar yang zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid gnyis pa ltos pas yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Arising of what has perished‚Äù is the second characteristic, which is based on a distinction.

original: yod pa'am skyes par gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa'am skyes par gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists or has arisen,

original: lan du 'byung bar 'gyur pa 'di yang yod pa'am skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan du 'byung bar 'gyur pa 'di yang yod pa'am skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: the response would be that this arising would exist or arise.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba snga na med pa dang ngo //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba snga na med pa dang ngo //
translated: Arising is not prior.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po'i thun mong rgyu mtshan tsam zhig mtshon pa yin te bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po'i thun mong rgyu mtshan tsam zhig mtshon pa yin te bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The prior and posterior states are merely indicated as the mere reason for the existence of the present.

original: sngar gyi dus de'i tshe yod pa nyid ni bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi dus de'i tshe yod pa nyid ni bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not taught that it exists at the time of the past.

original: gal te rgyu mtshan tsam zhig bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mtshan tsam zhig bstan pa yin na /
translated: If it is merely indicated as the reason for existence,

original: gang gi dngos pos zhes bya ba'i mdos bdun pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dngos pos zhes bya ba'i mdos bdun pa yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the seventh case, the genitive, by the rule that states, ‚ÄúThe genitive is used to show cause and time‚Äù?

original: de yod pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the genitive because it exists.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan tsam gyi dngos pos 'bras bu 'byung pa'i dngos po mtshan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu mtshan tsam gyi dngos pos 'bras bu 'byung pa'i dngos po mtshan pa yin te /
translated: Because the effect is characterized by the mere cause, the mere cause is the genitive.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu mtshan tsam gyis rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu mtshan tsam gyis rab tu sbyar ba yin no zhes mtshon pa'o //
translated: The effect is applied by the mere cause, the genitive.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid ji ltar brjod snyam na 'byung ba'i yod pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid ji ltar brjod snyam na 'byung ba'i yod pas kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If that is so, then how can the future be called the cause? The future is the cause because it exists.

original: dper na char pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur na @70b grog ma 'pho ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na char pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur na @70b grog ma 'pho ba bzhin te /
translated: For example, when rain falls, ants move.

original: grog ma 'pho ba ni char 'bab par 'gyur bas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grog ma 'pho ba ni char 'bab par 'gyur bas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The movement of the ants is caused by the falling rain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'chi ltas ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'chi ltas ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why the text says, ‚ÄúThe signs of death.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi bas phung po'i rtags 'chi ltas kyis rnam par 'gyur ba mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'chi bas phung po'i rtags 'chi ltas kyis rnam par 'gyur ba mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The signs of death in the future are the characteristics of the aggregates that are affected by death.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Master teaches this:

original: 'dis skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la brjod pa ni skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya bas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la brjod pa ni skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya bas kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that this arises because of that, then this is said: because of that, this arises.

original: byed pa po nyid med pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni 'o na 'das pa yang rgyur mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba de nyid kyis rtogs mod kyis yang brjod par ni khyad par brjod pa'i don du yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po nyid med pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di ni 'o na 'das pa yang rgyur mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba de nyid kyis rtogs mod kyis yang brjod par ni khyad par brjod pa'i don du yin no //
translated: If it is said that the agent does not exist, then how is it that the past does not become a cause? This is understood by that very statement. However, it is stated again in order to express a distinction.

original: de bzhin du gzhan du yang de ltar srid par blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan du yang de ltar srid par blta'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be seen that this is possible in other cases as well.

original: khyad par nyid brjod pa ni ci ltar myu gu skye zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par nyid brjod pa ni ci ltar myu gu skye zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The distinction itself is expressed: how does the sprout arise?

original: myu gu la sogs pa la blo la gnas pas byed pa po nyid du khas len na 'byung bar ba 'di ni blo la gnas pas byed pa nyid yin pa de bya rog gis ma zos so //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa la blo la gnas pas byed pa po nyid du khas len na 'byung bar ba 'di ni blo la gnas pas byed pa nyid yin pa de bya rog gis ma zos so //
translated: If the sprout and so on are accepted as agents because they exist in the mind, then this arising is the agency that exists in the mind, which the crow has not eaten.

original: gting du chung pa'i sa bon rgyu yin zhes de ltar brjod na'o //
analyzed: gting du chung pa'i sa bon rgyu yin zhes de ltar brjod na'o //
translated: If it is said that the seed that is deeply buried in the ground is the cause, then that is so.

original: ma dmigs pa ci ltar rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa ci ltar rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How can something that is not perceived be a cause?

original: gal te sngar dmigs rgyu'i rgyu mtshan yin na de'i rigs sngar gang dmigs pa de nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te sngar dmigs rgyu'i rgyu mtshan yin na de'i rigs sngar gang dmigs pa de nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the cause is the reason that was perceived previously, then only that which was perceived previously of that type would be the cause.

original: de'i rigs yin yang de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir gting du chud pa'i sa bon ni rgyu yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs yin yang de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir gting du chud pa'i sa bon ni rgyu yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the seed that is hidden is not the cause, because although it is of that type, it is not perceived in that way.

original: yod par ni rtogs kyi sngar yod par ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod par ni rtogs kyi sngar yod par ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is understood to exist, but it is not understood to have existed previously.

original: yod pa mtshon pa yin gyi sngar yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa mtshon pa yin gyi sngar yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the existence that is indicated, not the previous existence.

original: yod pa mtshon pa yin pa de lta na yang ngo //
analyzed: yod pa mtshon pa yin pa de lta na yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is the existence that is indicated,

original: don gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: don gang yin snyam na /
translated: what is the meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù?

original: 'di yod na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yod na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúif this exists.‚Äù

original: yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid don yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po gang yin pa de nyid don yin no //
translated: That entity which is the reason for existence is the meaning of ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po de yang mi 'khrul ba'i yul nyid yin pa dang mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po de yang mi 'khrul ba'i yul nyid yin pa dang mi 'bral lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that entity which is the reason is not divorced from being the nonerroneous object. This is the meaning.

original: ha kyang thal ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang 'di yang mtshan nyid ma yin no brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ha kyang thal ba'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang 'di yang mtshan nyid ma yin no brjod pa ni /
translated: Because of the fault of the consequence of non-existence, this also is not the definition.

original: gang zhig sngar dmigs pa de rgyu yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar dmigs pa de rgyu yin no zhes khong nas dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat which was previously observed is the cause‚Äù is the definition.

original: de nyid cis bya ba mi 'khrul ba de nyid do //üîΩci 'gal zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi zhen pa las ma rtogs pa dngos po'i skyon ni 'ga' yang med de ha kyang thal ba @71a * //
analyzed: de nyid cis bya ba mi 'khrul ba de nyid do // ci 'gal zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi zhen pa las ma rtogs pa dngos po'i skyon ni 'ga' yang med de ha kyang thal ba @71a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat very non-erroneous‚Äù is the definition.

original: la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the contradiction? There is no fault in the object of your attachment, because there is no consequence of non-existence, etc.

original: 'on te 'gal ba med pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gal ba med pa kho na yin na /
translated: If there is no contradiction,

original: de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: then the statement ‚ÄúThe previous and subsequent entities‚Äù and so on is easy to understand.

original: gzhan gyi te sa ba gzhan gyis bsams pa yang 'dogs par byed pa ni snga ma nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi te sa ba gzhan gyis bsams pa yang 'dogs par byed pa ni snga ma nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe other‚Äôs thought‚Äù is the other‚Äôs conception.

original: 'bras bu de don du gnyer ba rnams rgyu len pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de don du gnyer ba rnams rgyu len pa yin no //
translated: Those who seek the effect take up the cause.

original: rgyu 'dod pa phyi ma las 'bras bu las rjes su dpog par brjod pa'i rjes dpag de ni nus pa las 'gyur ba yin gyi 'bras bu las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu 'dod pa phyi ma las 'bras bu las rjes su dpog par brjod pa'i rjes dpag de ni nus pa las 'gyur ba yin gyi 'bras bu las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The inference that is stated to infer the effect from the cause is from the potential, not from the effect.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol ni tshe phyi ma pa'i 'dod pa'i bu'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pha rol ni tshe phyi ma pa'i 'dod pa'i bu'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The future world is the effect of the desire of the one who will be born in the next life.

original: da ltar ba'i 'jig rten ni 'jig rten 'di'i las bzang po'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i 'jig rten ni 'jig rten 'di'i las bzang po'o //
translated: The present world is the effect of the good karma of this world.

original: phyed snga ma bshad nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed snga ma bshad nas sun 'byin par byed pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the first half, he refutes it with ‚ÄúThat is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: dper na skye bo gcig nyid /üîΩ'ga' zhig ltos nas skyed bar byed pa dang / pha yang yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gcig nyid gzhan med na mi 'byung bas 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na skye bo gcig nyid / 'ga' zhig ltos nas skyed bar byed pa dang / pha yang yin pa de bzhin du dngos po gcig nyid gzhan med na mi 'byung bas 'bras bu yin la /
translated: For example, a single personüîΩis a father in relation to some, and a son in relation to others.

original: des mi 'khrul bar byas pa yin pas na rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: des mi 'khrul bar byas pa yin pas na rgyu yang yin no //
translated: In the same way, a single thing is an effect because it does not occur without another, and it is a cause because it is not mistaken with respect to that.

original: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la da ltar ba rgyu yin pa'i phyir len par rig par yin no //
analyzed: des na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la da ltar ba rgyu yin pa'i phyir len par rig par yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the future is the effect of the present cause, it is known to be appropriated.

original: gzhan yang brjod pa ni rgyu nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brjod pa ni rgyu nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúif it is a cause‚Äù is the objection.

original: lan pa ni thob par bya ba'i phyir yin na de'i 'bras bus kyang rgyu nges par thob pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lan pa ni thob par bya ba'i phyir yin na de'i 'bras bus kyang rgyu nges par thob pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The response is that if it is for the sake of obtaining, then the cause is definitely obtained by the result.

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter half is explained by ‚Äúwhatsoever.‚Äù

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The refutation is ‚Äúthat is not so.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa bla'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la ni rjes su dpag pa bla'i /
translated: It is better to infer a result,

original: rgyu yin na ni spyad pa gzhan 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yin na ni spyad pa gzhan 'ong ba yin no //
translated: but if it is a cause, then another practice comes.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore is the conclusion.

original: 'di la slob dpon gyis ma gsungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon gyis ma gsungs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since this is not stated by the master,

original: 'di ni bshad pa byed pa'i rang dga' nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bshad pa byed pa'i rang dga' nyid yin no //
translated: this is the mere personal preference of the author of the commentary.

original: don gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir de ni rang bzhin yin par 'dod /
analyzed: don gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'i phyir de ni rang bzhin yin par 'dod /
translated: Since it does not depend on another object, it is asserted to be a nature.

original: gtan tshigs kyang rnam pa gzhan du khungs btsugs so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang rnam pa gzhan du khungs btsugs so //
translated: The reason is also established in another way.

original: de ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: That is also contradictory.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // zhes bya ba dang / phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
analyzed: med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // zhes bya ba dang / phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
translated: and ‚Äúbecause the nonexistent is not a cause, and because the existent does not arise again.‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no zer ba ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no zer ba ni ma 'brel te /
translated: This is not a proper explanation.

original: 'di ltar re zhig ma gsungs pa tsam ni nyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig ma gsungs pa tsam ni nyes pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a fault merely to not explain something.

original: bshad par bya ba dang bshad pa gnyis @71b yi ge gcig nyid du gang du yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba dang bshad pa gnyis @71b yi ge gcig nyid du gang du yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: We never see the object to be explained and the explanation as being the same thing.

original: de'i tshe ni po ti gzhan tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni po ti gzhan tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, it would be merely another book.

original: 'chad par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar cung zhing bye brag bshad dgos so //
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar cung zhing bye brag bshad dgos so //
translated: The commentator must explain the difference without doubt.

original: rnam 'grel las bshad pa'i khyad par thams cad phyogs kyi glang po'am gsung rab las dngos su yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las bshad pa'i khyad par thams cad phyogs kyi glang po'am gsung rab las dngos su yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: All the differences explained in the Pramiirwvarttika are not explicitly in the scriptures.

original: des na grub pa'i mtha' dang bzhed pa dag dang 'gal ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na grub pa'i mtha' dang bzhed pa dag dang 'gal ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should avoid contradicting the tenets and the assertions.

original: de la grub mtha' dang ni 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la grub mtha' dang ni 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: It does not contradict the tenets.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don lnga dang mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don lnga dang mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no incompatibility with the five desired objects.

original: bzhed pa dang 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bzhed pa dang 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there any contradiction with what is accepted.

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu brjod na sun 'byin pa'i 'bad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu brjod na sun 'byin pa'i 'bad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the cause of occurrence in some place is stated, then there is no need to make an effort to refute it.

original: gang yang / med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa der ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba dgag pa lhur byed pa yin te ci skad du des na don rang gi blo lhan cig 'byung min zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang / med pa sngar nus med phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa der ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis lhan cig 'byung ba dgag pa lhur byed pa yin te ci skad du des na don rang gi blo lhan cig 'byung min zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúbecause the nonexistent is not able to produce,‚Äù and so on, there the focus is on the refutation of the simultaneity of cause and effect, as stated: ‚ÄúTherefore the object does not occur simultaneously with the mind.‚Äù

original: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thams cad sngar yod yin //
translated: ‚ÄúAll causes exist prior to the effect‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi 'byung ba nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi 'byung ba nye bar mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: is a way of illustrating that they do not occur simultaneously.

original: gal te tha dad pa yin na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa yin na khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are different, then the pervaded and the pervader are the nature of cause and effect.

original: yang gzugs kyi 'bras bu yin pa des na ji ltar lhan cig rgyu yin bar 'gog ce na 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gzugs kyi 'bras bu yin pa des na ji ltar lhan cig rgyu yin bar 'gog ce na 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: Again, since form is the effect of consciousness, how can you refute the fact that they are coexistent causes?

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos pa yin na lhan cig 'byung ba la ni rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du 'jig rten de ltar tha snyad byed pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la brten pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos pa yin na lhan cig 'byung ba la ni rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du 'jig rten de ltar tha snyad byed pa gang yang med do //
translated: We think as follows: The existence of cause and effect based on the correct conventional is dependent on mundane conventions. But there is no mundane convention whatsoever that posits coexistent things as cause and effect, like the right and left horns of an ox.

original: 'di la dgongs nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du zhes lan cig ma yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du zhes lan cig ma yin par gsungs so //
translated: With this in mind, Candrakirti says more than once that he is speaking in terms of mundane convention.

original: lhan cig byas par nges pa ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pa nyid las 'grub bo //
analyzed: lhan cig byas par nges pa ni rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pa nyid las 'grub bo //
translated: The fact that they are co-produced is established by the fact that the attributes of the cause are inferred in the effect.

original: des na lhan cig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lhan cig pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, coexistent things cannot have the relation of cause and effect.

original: des na rnam 'grel gzhan 'di ni de 'gog ba yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: des na rnam 'grel gzhan 'di ni de 'gog ba yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, this other commentary on the Prajfullamitiila is a refutation of that.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis lhan cig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni lung la brten nas yin gyi 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis lhan cig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni lung la brten nas yin gyi 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the fact that something is a simultaneous cause and effect is based on scriptural authority, not on mundane convention.

original: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gang yin pa @72a * //
analyzed: phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min // zhes bya ba ni gang yin pa @72a * //
translated: It is not a cause because it arises later.

original: der ni rgyu nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der ni rgyu nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it is not ascertained to be a cause.

original: spyir btang bas grub pa'i tshul de ni /
analyzed: spyir btang bas grub pa'i tshul de ni /
translated: This is a general statement.üîΩThe specific refutation is stated in the line:

original: ci zhig yod gyur gang med pa //
analyzed: ci zhig yod gyur gang med pa //
translated: What exists and what does not exist

original: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
translated: are not connected later.

original: ces bya ba 'dis dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: This is not a fault because it is a general statement.

original: 'dis ni 'das pa dus gcig pa rnam rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'das pa dus gcig pa rnam rtogs kyi /
translated: This refutes the assertion that past states that are simultaneous with a thought

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin to /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma yin to /
translated: are its cause, but not future states.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of error‚Äù is also a refutation.

original: ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis ni rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te 'on kyang 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis ni rgyu ma yin pa ma yin te 'on kyang 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that future states are not causes because they are future, but because they are erroneous.

original: 'das pa la mi 'khrul na ni rjes su dpag par mngon par 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la mi 'khrul na ni rjes su dpag par mngon par 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is not mistaken with respect to the past, then it is just what is accepted as inference.

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
translated: It is said to be the nature of that.

original: ces bya ba ni log pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas rung ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag par bshad la de yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni log pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas rung ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag par bshad la de yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: This is explained as inference in terms of the false conventional, and that is accepted.

original: 'bras bu la rnam pa gzhan du ni rjes su dpag par ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rnam pa gzhan du ni rjes su dpag par ma gsungs so //
translated: But in terms of the effect, it is not said to be inference in any other way.

original: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas ni de sun dbyung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob la ltos nas ni de sun dbyung ba yin no //
translated: In terms of the correct conventional, it is refuted.

original: de ltar gsung rab kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu las thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gsung rab kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu las thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the definition of scripture is established from the effect, omniscience.

original: 'o na rnam pa 'di yang de nyid du ci ste ma bstan zhen /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa 'di yang de nyid du ci ste ma bstan zhen /
translated: Well then, why isn't this aspect taught in that very text?

original: mang po'i ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'di kho na dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po'i ma yin pa'i phyir dang 'di kho na dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not for the many, and because it is just for this purpose.

original: phyogs 'di ni ma gsungs pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs 'di ni ma gsungs pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: And this position is not even unstated.

original: don gyis gsungs pa yang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis gsungs pa yang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated by implication.

original: 'di ltar rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa can 'bras bu med na mi 'byung bar bstan bcos mdzad pa mi bzhed na ci ltar 'bras bu mi dmigs pa tshad mar mdzad /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa can 'bras bu med na mi 'byung bar bstan bcos mdzad pa mi bzhed na ci ltar 'bras bu mi dmigs pa tshad mar mdzad /
translated: If the author of the treatise does not accept that a cause that is an unobstructed potency is not a non-arising of an effect, then how could he accept that the non-observation of an effect is a valid cognition?

original: tha dad gyur par 'brel par brjod pa nyid 'bras bur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad gyur par 'brel par brjod pa nyid 'bras bur brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey are related as different‚Äù is itself a statement of the effect.

original: 'o na rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But in that case, it would be the nonobservation of the cause.

original: de kho nar de ni de kho na ltar yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar de ni de kho na ltar yin no //
translated: That is exactly so.

original: 'on kyang blo rtsing po'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu mi dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo rtsing po'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la ltos nas rgyu mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu mi dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in terms of the conventions of the coarse intellect of the world, the aspect of the nonobservation of the cause is called the nonobservation of the effect.

original: gang yang 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab pa dang mi ldog pas na de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab pa dang mi ldog pas na de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med pas na de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: Someone might say, ‚ÄúThat effect is pervaded by and does not recede from the cause. Therefore, since it is not different from the nature of the cause, the nonobservation of that is explained to be the nonobservation of the nature.‚Äù

original: slob dpon chos mchog gis bshad pa'i de yang ma 'brel te /
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gis bshad pa'i de yang ma 'brel te /
translated: The explanation of that by Master Dharmottara is also not related.

original: 'di ltar gal te rgyu khyab pa dang rgyu las tha dad par mi 'gyur @72b pas zhes brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu khyab pas zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad rgyu med par mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ldog
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rgyu khyab pa dang rgyu las tha dad par mi 'gyur @72b pas zhes brjod par 'dod na ni de'i tshe rgyu khyab pas zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba'i 'bras bu thams cad rgyu med par mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ldog
translated: As such, if you assert ‚Äúbecause the cause and the pervader are not different,‚Äù then at that time, since the cause and the pervader are not different, it is not the case that ‚Äúno effect arises without a cause.‚ÄùüîΩ

original: pa med par bstan pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: pa med par bstan pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: As such, if you assert that ‚Äúthe effect would not be different from the cause,‚Äù then at that time, what is the point of teaching that ‚Äúthe effect does not arise without the cause‚Äù by stating ‚Äúthe effect is not different from the cause‚Äù?

original: 'on te ldog pa med pas de'i bdag nyid brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ldog pa med pas de'i bdag nyid brjod pa yin na /
translated: If you say that the effect is not different from the cause,

original: de lta na 'bras bu thams cad de'i bdag nyid du thal lo //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu thams cad de'i bdag nyid du thal lo //
translated: then it follows that all effects would be the same as the cause.

original: 'o na te de med par rgyu mi 'byung bar brjod pa des na de'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de yang de'i rang bzhin du thal lo //
analyzed: 'o na te de med par rgyu mi 'byung bar brjod pa des na de'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir de yang de'i rang bzhin du thal lo //
translated: But if you say that the cause does not occur without the effect, then the cause would be the same as the effect because the cause does not occur without the effect.

original: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows that the reason of effect would be the same as the reason of nature.

original: me du ba tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me du ba tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fire is merely related to smoke.

original: 'on te tha dad pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pas 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs su brjod na /
translated: But if you say that the reason is the effect because it is different from the cause,

original: de lta na 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid du smos shig des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid du smos shig des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: then you should say that the effect is not perceived.üîΩTherefore, this is a mere quibble.

original: des na gzhan du bshad par bya ste 'bras bu de ni rgyus khyab pa ste /
analyzed: des na gzhan du bshad par bya ste 'bras bu de ni rgyus khyab pa ste /
translated: Therefore, we will explain it differently: the effect is pervaded by the cause.

original: khyab par byed pa nyid du de las mi ldog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nyid du de las mi ldog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the pervader, it does not turn away from it,

original: khyab par byed pa de las ldog par byed pa'i phyir te bya ba byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de las ldog par byed pa'i phyir te bya ba byed kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: because it is the activity of the nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med par zhes 'dir de'i sgra ni rgyu 'dzin pa ste rgyu dang khyad par med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang khyad par med par zhes 'dir de'i sgra ni rgyu 'dzin pa ste rgyu dang khyad par med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúit‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúwithout distinction of nature or attribute‚Äù refers to the cause. The meaning is ‚Äúwithout distinction from the cause.‚Äù

original: 'di lta rgyu'i khyab byed yin pa'i phyir na rgyu zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta rgyu'i khyab byed yin pa'i phyir na rgyu zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the cause is called a cause because it is the pervader of the effect.

original: de bzhin du de med na rgyu mi 'byung bas na khyab byed yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu zhes ci ste mi brjod /
analyzed: de bzhin du de med na rgyu mi 'byung bas na khyab byed yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la rgyu zhes ci ste mi brjod /
translated: Similarly, because the effect does not occur without the cause, why not call the cause the effect because it is the pervaded?

original: 'on te rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i dus na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cause is not a cause because the effect does not exist at the time of the cause,

original: 'o na rgyu yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pa'i phyir rtsod pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu yang 'bras bu'i dus na med pa'i phyir rtsod pa de nyid yin no //
translated: then the argument is the same, for the cause does not exist at the time of the effect.

original: 'on te sngar yod pa rgyu yin te des na 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid ma yin no snyam na 'dir rgyu nyid gang yin /
analyzed: 'on te sngar yod pa rgyu yin te des na 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid ma yin no snyam na 'dir rgyu nyid gang yin /
translated: But if you say that the cause is what existed previously, and that the effect is not a cause, then what is a cause here?

original: 'bras bu'i dus na med pa ni 'gas kyang rgyu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na med pa ni 'gas kyang rgyu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: No one conceives of something that does not exist at the time of the effect as a cause.

original: 'on te de yod pa ma yin na 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes de ltar de dang 'brel par rtogs pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de yod pa ma yin na 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes de ltar de dang 'brel par rtogs pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that one conceives of it as a cause because one conceives of it as related to the effect in the sense that this would not occur if that did not exist,
