original: de lta na 'di ni 'bras bu la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na 'di ni 'bras bu la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then the same is true of the effect.

original: gal te 'chi bar mi 'gyur na 'chi ltas 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes 'chi ba dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'chi bar mi 'gyur na 'chi ltas 'di yang mi 'byung ngo zhes 'chi ba dang 'brel par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not conceive of the signs of death as related to death in the sense that if death did not exist, the signs of death would not occur.

original: tha snyad de ltar ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad de ltar ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But that convention does not exist.

original: don gyi tha snyad med na brjod pa tsam ni med kyang mi skyon no //üîΩ'on te 'ga' zhig tu khyad par @73a * //
analyzed: don gyi tha snyad med na brjod pa tsam ni med kyang mi skyon no // 'on te 'ga' zhig tu khyad par @73a * //
translated: If the conventional is not the object, then it is not a fault if there is no expression.

original: ma mtshon pas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid du bsnyad pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ma mtshon pas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu nyid du bsnyad pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that the effect is not called the cause because the distinction is not indicated,

original: 'di ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par la yang 'bras bu'i spyi la ltos nas rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par la yang 'bras bu'i spyi la ltos nas rgyu ma yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: then this is the very reason why the effect is not accepted as the cause, even though it is the cause of what is accepted as the cause.

original: de skad du de med par yod pha ni de las slu ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa dang / des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung na ni 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes yang de'i rgyu nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du de med par yod pha ni de las slu ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa dang / des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung na ni 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes yang de'i rgyu nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThat which exists without this is not the cause, because it is deceptive in regard to this,‚Äù and it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is accepted as the cause of what is produced by this is the cause of this.‚Äù

original: yang na ma gus pa spangs pa'i don du 'bras bu la rgyu nyid du brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na ma gus pa spangs pa'i don du 'bras bu la rgyu nyid du brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the effect is not called the cause in order to avoid disrespect,

original: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar skyes bu'i bu pha'i phar gyur pa'i phyir pha la brnyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gdon mi za bar skyes bu'i bu pha'i phar gyur pa'i phyir pha la brnyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: for if it were not so, then the son of a man would be the father of that man, and so the son would be despised by the father.

original: de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that the non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality?

original: 'di la bshad pa phyogs gcig sbyar bas de skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa phyogs gcig sbyar bas de skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: The answer is: it is said in this way because of the application of a part of the explanation.

original: dper na 'jigs sde la 'jigs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jigs sde la 'jigs pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the case of the expression ‚Äúfearful army‚Äù .

original: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the non-apprehension of its intrinsic reality is called the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i zhes bya ba 'dis rgyu bzung ba'i phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi de dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba 'dis rgyu bzung ba'i phyir rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi de dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúits‚Äù refers to the cause, so the meaning is: the apprehension of that which is the intrinsic reality of the cause.

original: yang 'di las 'byung bas na rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang 'di las 'byung bas na rang bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, it is intrinsic reality because it arises from that.

original: rang 'byung ba ni rang bzhin te rang gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung ba ni rang bzhin te rang gi rgyu'o //
translated: Intrinsic arising is intrinsic reality, which is its own cause.

original: des na de mi dmigs pa ni rang gi rgyu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de mi dmigs pa ni rang gi rgyu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of its own cause. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na 'o na de mi dmigs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na de mi dmigs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid do zhes brjod par bya'i /
translated: If that is so, then the non-apprehension of that is the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyis ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyis ci bya zhe na /
translated: Why mention the distinction of its own nature?

original: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi phyogs yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid kyi phyogs yin gyi /
translated: This is our own position.

original: gzhan rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But the others do not accept this, and so they are not at fault.

original: des na 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of effect is a type of non-apprehension of cause.üîΩMoreover, if one does not accept this, then the following statement of Vasubandhu's would be contradicted:

original: gzhan yang de ltar mi 'dod na ni de rgyu zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel 'di ldog par byed pa zhes khong nas drangs nas kyang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzhan yang de ltar mi 'dod na ni de rgyu zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel 'di ldog par byed pa zhes khong nas drangs nas kyang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If one does not accept this, then the statement 'this is its cause' would be meaningless.

original: / ci ltar bshad pa yang de ma thag pa'i rnam 'grel gyi don yin pa'i phyir don med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / ci ltar bshad pa yang de ma thag pa'i rnam 'grel gyi don yin pa'i phyir don med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And the statement this is its effect would be meaningless, because the meaning of the immediately preceding statement is just as explained.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems nges par bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu da lta ba las de'i rjes su dpog pa la rjes su dpag pas kyang de nges pa'i phyir phan @73b tshun bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sems nges par bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu da lta ba las de'i rjes su dpog pa la rjes su dpag pas kyang de nges pa'i phyir phan @73b tshun bsten pa yin no //
translated: But even if this is so, the ascertainment of the future mind is from its present effect, and the inference of that is also the ascertainment of that, so there is mutual dependence.

original: 'on te / ci zhig yod 'gyur gang med pa //
analyzed: 'on te / ci zhig yod 'gyur gang med pa //
translated: then what is nonexistent

original: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: gang gis phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
translated: will not be produced later.

original: ces bya ba'i shes pa phyi ma 'grub na /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i shes pa phyi ma 'grub na /
translated: If the subsequent cognition is established,

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: then what is the use of inference?

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni spyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems tsam sems phyi ma med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis khyab par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni spyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems tsam sems phyi ma med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis khyab par bsgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Because this is a form of proof that generally pervades the mere afflicted mind with the non-arising of a subsequent mind.

original: khyad par can gyi yul la ni rjes su dpog pa la ni rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yul la ni rjes su dpog pa la ni rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a specific object, it is inference.

original: 'di ltar gang dang gang tha mal pa'i sems yin pa de dang de ni sems phyi ma med par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang gang tha mal pa'i sems yin pa de dang de ni sems phyi ma med par mi 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, whatever is an ordinary mind, that does not arise without a subsequent mind.

original: dper na sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngar gyi gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the previous state.

original: lam po che'i skyes bu 'chi ba'i sems kyang tha mal pa'i sems yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lam po che'i skyes bu 'chi ba'i sems kyang tha mal pa'i sems yin no zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The mind of death of a person on the highway is an ordinary mind. This is a syllogism of effect.

original: gang gis phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa'i nges par 'gyur ba 'dir rjes su dpag pas 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i sems bsgrubs pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis phan tshun bsten pa'i nyes pa'i nges par 'gyur ba 'dir rjes su dpag pas 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i sems bsgrubs pas de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The fault of mutual dependence is certain to arise here, since the mind is established by inference. Nor is it certain that it is the result of that,

original: chags pa sngar rab tu bsgrubs pas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa sngar rab tu bsgrubs pas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment is already established as prior to it.

original: de ltar bkod pa na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'dogs par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bkod pa na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'dogs par yang mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, when it is arranged, it should not be designated as a natural reason,

original: gang dang gang du du ba yin pa de dang de ni me las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang du du ba yin pa de dang de ni me las skyes pa yin te zhes bya ba 'dir yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would also follow that ‚Äúwherever there is smoke, there fire arises from it‚Äù here.

original: de ltar khas len na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshig sa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar khas len na yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshig sa med par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one accepts that, the reason of effect would be groundless.

original: de ltar yang dpyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang dpyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it would be analyzed.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gsung rab kyi khungs drangs te brjod pa 'di ni ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu nyid du gzhung gzugs pa gtsor byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i spyi'i mtshan nyid gsung rab kyi khungs drangs te brjod pa 'di ni ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu nyid du gzhung gzugs pa gtsor byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement of the general characteristic of the cause, citing the scriptures, is primarily for the sake of establishing the cause in the future.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir mi 'khrul bas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir mi 'khrul bas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the summary is: ‚ÄúTherefore, because it is non-erroneous. ‚ÄùüîΩWith respect to that, the explanation that is dependent on the former explanation is: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned the meaning that has already been explained in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, it is the meaning that is to be established by the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika, which is to be connected with the meaning of the statement, ‚Äòit is the transformation of the basis. ‚Äô‚Äù

original: de la bshad pa snga ma la ltos nas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin pa'i don yal bar dor nas don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi tshad dang sbyor bar byed pas rnam pa ci zhig ltar don dang
analyzed: de la bshad pa snga ma la ltos nas 'chad par 'gyur ba ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin pa'i don yal bar dor nas don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi tshad dang sbyor bar byed pas rnam pa ci zhig ltar don dang
translated: In what way does it have a meaning?

original: bcas pa nyid ston par byed pa ni lus las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa nyid ston par byed pa ni lus las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is: ‚ÄúThe body. ‚Äù

original: re zhig ces bya ba rten gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba rten gyi sgo nas phan 'dogs pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the time being‚Äù is the mere benefit by way of the basis.

original: dpe 'grel par byed pa ni me la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe 'grel par byed pa ni me la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The example is: ‚ÄúFire, etc. ‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dmar po nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dmar po nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The redness, etc. of the pot, etc.

original: 'dis ni @74a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni @74a * //
translated: This

original: grub pa la yon tan gzhan sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa la yon tan gzhan sgrub pas phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: says that the benefit is the establishment of another quality in that which is established.

original: dpe gzhan brjod pa ni gser la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dis ni ji skad bshad pa'i res 'ga'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las bzlog pas rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: dpe gzhan brjod pa ni gser la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o // 'dis ni ji skad bshad pa'i res 'ga'i phan 'dogs par byed pa las bzlog pas rtag tu rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ;
translated: The example is stated in ‚Äúgold, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThis shows that the effect is not reversed when the occasional benefactors are reversed, because the effect always follows.

original: gang med par rgyun gnas pa mi 'byung ba de nyid log nas 'bras bu ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang med par rgyun gnas pa mi 'byung ba de nyid log nas 'bras bu ldog pa yin te /
translated: The effect is reversed when that which is the cause of the continuity of the effect is reversed.

original: dper na mar me dang me la sogs pa log na 'od dang du ba la sogs ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mar me dang me la sogs pa log na 'od dang du ba la sogs ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when a lamp and fire, etc., are reversed, their light and smoke, etc., are reversed.üîΩThe effect is not reversed when the occasional benefactors are reversed.

original: res 'ga' ba'i phan 'dogs par byed pa log pas ni ldog pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar brjod do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i phan 'dogs par byed pa log pas ni ldog pa ma yin no zhes gsal bar brjod do //
translated: This is stated clearly.

original: lus ni byed pa po nyid du yang nges par mi nus na rgyun gnas par byed pa nyid du lta ci smos snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus ni byed pa po nyid du yang nges par mi nus na rgyun gnas par byed pa nyid du lta ci smos snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The body cannot be ascertained as the agent, so how much less can it be the cause of the continuity of the body?

original: des na 'chi ba'i dus su de log kyang ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'chi ba'i dus su de log kyang ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the body dies, the effect is not reversed when the body is reversed.

original: 'o na ci ltar ldog ce na /üîΩgang zhig ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ldog ce na / gang zhig ces gsungs te /
translated: How then is the effect reversed?üîΩ‚ÄúWhen the opponent‚Äù is stated.

original: rgol ba gang gis ltar na'o //
analyzed: rgol ba gang gis ltar na'o //
translated: The opponent is the one who argues.

original: de mtshang ba las zhes bya ba ni sems mtshang ba las so //
analyzed: de mtshang ba las zhes bya ba ni sems mtshang ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the fault in the mind‚Äù means from the fault in the mind.

original: lus 'ga' zhig rgyu yin pa la 'gal bar brjod pa ni rig par rang ngam gzhan gyis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lus 'ga' zhig rgyu yin pa la 'gal bar brjod pa ni rig par rang ngam gzhan gyis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The contradiction in the cause of some body is stated by ‚Äúwhether by oneself, by another, or by both, or by chance, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta na 'o na ldog pa nyid med de /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ldog pa nyid med de /
translated: If that is so, then there is no cessation.

original: log pa'i lus ni zlog byed ma yin la rgyur 'dod pa'i sems ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: log pa'i lus ni zlog byed ma yin la rgyur 'dod pa'i sems ni yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The body that has ceased is not the cause, and the mind that is asserted as the cause exists.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad du chad pa log pa yin na ni de'i tshe ldog par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad du chad pa log pa yin na ni de'i tshe ldog par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: If it is a complete cessation, then at that time there is only cessation.

original: des na mi mthun pa 'ga' zhig las lus de las ldog pa gzhan du 'phro ba'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa 'ga' zhig las lus de las ldog pa gzhan du 'phro ba'i rgyu yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is a cause for the body to cease from some incompatibility and to continue in another way.

original: tha na gnad du na ba la sogs pas lus de la btang snyoms 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha na gnad du na ba la sogs pas lus de la btang snyoms 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even at the end, by the pain in the vital parts, etc., the body is indifferent.

original: de ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas yul 'ga' zhig nye bar len pa yin pa la yang nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir gzhan yang brjod pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas yul 'ga' zhig nye bar len pa yin pa la yang nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir gzhan yang brjod pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the side that benefits, he also states the faults of the side that appropriates some object, saying, ‚ÄúMoreover, . . .‚Äù

original: 'on te yang sems ni dbugs phyung ba dang rngub pa dag gi yang 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang sems ni dbugs phyung ba dang rngub pa dag gi yang 'bras bu yin te /
translated: But the mind is also the effect of inhalation and exhalation.

original: des na 'chi ba'i gnas skabs de nyid med pa'i phyir ldog pa med par thal pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'chi ba'i gnas skabs de nyid med pa'i phyir ldog pa med par thal pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since that state of death does not exist, it follows that there is no reversal.

original: sems de nyid las 'byung rngub yin gyi /
analyzed: sems de nyid las 'byung rngub yin gyi /
translated: The mind arises from inhalation and exhalation,

original: sems de nyid ni 'byung rngub dag las ma yin no zhes bzlas te sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems de nyid ni 'byung rngub dag las ma yin no zhes bzlas te sbyar ro //
translated: but inhalation and exhalation do not arise from the mind.

original: des na rjod byed pa'i thal bam spangs pa nyid du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rjod byed pa'i thal bam spangs pa nyid du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the fault of the reductio is not applicable.

original: 'byung ba rngub pa dag @74b sems kyi 'bras bu'o zhes ci ltar nges snyam na /
analyzed: 'byung ba rngub pa dag @74b sems kyi 'bras bu'o zhes ci ltar nges snyam na /
translated: How do you know that inhalation and exhalation are the effects of the mind?

original: sems de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exist when the mind exists.

original: bzlog par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlog par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not exist when the mind is reversed.

original: 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: dbang 'gyur phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang 'gyur phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it is subject to control.

original: bshad pa ni thal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni thal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚ÄúIf it were to leave the body, etc.‚Äù

original: 'o na gang gi tshe ldog pa med par thal snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe ldog pa med par thal snyam na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhen would it be impossible for it to leave?‚Äù

original: lus de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bskyed par mngon 'dod pa sngar gyis rang bzhin rnam par mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can de lta bur gyur pa nyid gnas pa na'o //üîΩldog pa'am zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su sems ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: lus de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bskyed par mngon 'dod pa sngar gyis rang bzhin rnam par mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can de lta bur gyur pa nyid gnas pa na'o // ldog pa'am zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su sems ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way that the body is‚Äù means that the body is in the same condition as the consciousness that is generated, and it is in the same condition as the body that is desired.üîΩ‚ÄúIt would not leave‚Äù means that the mind would not leave at the time of death.

original: / lus gzhan du 'gyur ba gnas pa na yang log par mi 'thad do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: / lus gzhan du 'gyur ba gnas pa na yang log par mi 'thad do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that it would leave the body‚Äù means that it is not tenable that it would leave the body in the state of remaining.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang ldog par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang ldog par mi 'thad do zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it not tenable that it would leave in either way?‚Äù

original: gnas skabs mtha' dag tu rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas skabs mtha' dag tu rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: it is because it would follow that it would be present in all states.

original: nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs du mar sems rjes su 'gro bar ni sngar dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs du mar sems rjes su 'gro bar ni sngar dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The mind is seen to follow the various states of deterioration and growth, etc.

original: des na gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos pa ma yin na /
analyzed: des na gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the mind does not depend on the special states,

original: de bas na gnyi ga ltar yang ldog par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga ltar yang ldog par mi 'thad do //
translated: then it is not tenable that either of them ceases.

original: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: In the state of death,

original: gnad du gzer ba la sogs pa'i gdung ba'i khyad par las sems ldog pa kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gnad du gzer ba la sogs pa'i gdung ba'i khyad par las sems ldog pa kho na'o snyam na /
translated: the mind definitely ceases due to the special torment of the vital parts being struck.

original: gdung pa'i sdug bsngal ni sems kyi chos yin pa'i phyir lus la ci zhig byung /
analyzed: gdung pa'i sdug bsngal ni sems kyi chos yin pa'i phyir lus la ci zhig byung /
translated: Since the suffering of torment is a mental phenomenon, what happens to the body?

original: lus kyang des rnam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyang des rnam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The body is transformed by that.

original: de lta na ni lus kyis rten de yin gyi de'i rten ni lus ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta na ni lus kyis rten de yin gyi de'i rten ni lus ma yin te //
translated: If that is so, then the body is the support of the mind, but the mind is not the support of the body,

original: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for the mind to benefit or harm the body.

original: shes pas mi mthun lus rgyu min //üîΩzhes bya ba yang rnam par spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pas mi mthun lus rgyu min // zhes bya ba yang rnam par spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body is not the cause of consciousness.üîΩThis is also how you should understand the statement, ‚ÄúThe body is not the cause of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir lus sems kyi rgyu yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus sems kyi rgyu yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the body is the cause of the mind,

original: de dang de 'dra ba shi pa las kyang 'byung bar thal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de dang de 'dra ba shi pa las kyang 'byung bar thal ba kho na'o //
translated: and it would follow that they would occur even when one is dead.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lus ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi yang rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lus ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi yang rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the body is not the cause of inhalation and exhalation.üîΩBut they are due to the mind alone, because they do not occur when the mind is absent.

original: 'on kyang sems nyid yin te sems med na de dag mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sems yod na de dag yod pa'i phyir te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems nyid yin te sems med na de dag mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sems yod na de dag yod pa'i phyir te zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause they exist when the mind exists‚Äù is that inhalation and exhalation do not occur when the mind is absent.

original: bzlog pa 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las ni sems ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las ni sems ma yin no //
translated: The mind is not due to inhalation and exhalation.

original: sems de'i dbang nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems de'i dbang nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is not under their control.

original: 'on te de dag sems la rag las pa nyid ma yin no snyam na de dag ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩrlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te de dag sems la rag las pa nyid ma yin no snyam na de dag ni zhes gsungs so // rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni /
translated: If you think that inhalation and exhalation are not dependent on the mind, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThey are not independent of the mind.‚Äù

original: @75a * // 'ba' rtsol med par gang las yin //
analyzed: @75a * // 'ba' rtsol med par gang las yin //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúWhere do exhalation and inhalation occur without effort?‚Äù

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩrnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang sems kyi dbang du gyur par ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang sems kyi dbang du gyur par ston pa ni /
translated: This will be explained.

original: gal te gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIf they are due to another mind,‚Äù in order to demonstrate that inhalation and exhalation are under the control of the mind from another perspective.

original: 'o na sems de dag ci yin par 'os she na /
analyzed: 'o na sems de dag ci yin par 'os she na /
translated: What are these minds?

original: sems ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe mind that is . . .‚Äù

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid las zhes nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid las zhes nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom them‚Äù does not specify that they arise from those very same minds.

original: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na ni sngar yang de kho na ltar yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan tshun phan 'dogs par byed pa yin na ni sngar yang de kho na ltar yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa nyid do //
translated: If they assist each other, then they would have existed in that same manner from the very beginning, and there would be no beginning of cyclic existence.

original: gzhan las skyes kyang zhes kyang gi sgra ni srid pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan las skyes kyang zhes kyang gi sgra ni srid pa la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúeven if they arose from something else‚Äù indicates that this is also the case with existence.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i dgongs pa ni 'di srid pa ni tshang mar spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i dgongs pa ni 'di srid pa ni tshang mar spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The intended meaning of the treatise is that existence is completely abandoned.

original: gal te de dag sems kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de dag sems kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: If you think that these elements are not the result of mind,

original: gnyid kyi gnas skabs na sems med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du dogs ba bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gnyid kyi gnas skabs na sems med kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro snyam du dogs ba bsu ba ni /
translated: because they exist even when there is no mind, such as during the state of composure that is a cessation,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúEven if . . .

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs na sems med par khas blangs kyang /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs na sems med par khas blangs kyang /
translated: The treatise intends to show that, even though it is accepted that there is no mind during the state of composure that is a cessation,

original: de'i dus su 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi 'bras bu nyid nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dus su 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi 'bras bu nyid nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, the exhalation and inhalation are the result of the mind itself, and there is no fault.

original: sngar gyi sems las zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las so //
analyzed: sngar gyi sems las zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i gnas skabs kyi sems las so //
translated: From the previous mind means from the mind of the waking state.

original: gzhan du gyur pa las zhes bya ba ni drag tu 'byung ba goms pa las ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur te drag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa las zhes bya ba ni drag tu 'byung ba goms pa las ni gzhan nyid du 'gyur te drag tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: From the transformation means from the transformation of the practice of forceful exhalation, there is another state, which is the forceful exhalation.

original: / rgyu ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni don gyis te /
analyzed: / rgyu ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni don gyis te /
translated: Non-cause means in fact.

original: dngos su ni rlung 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems la rag las pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: dngos su ni rlung 'byin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems la rag las pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: In reality, the statement exhalation and inhalation depend on the mind is shown by the words exhalation and inhalation and so on.

original: sems kyi khyad par 'bad rtsol med par ro //
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par 'bad rtsol med par ro //
translated: The mind's distinction is without effort.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu yin na /
translated: Moreover, if exhalation and inhalation are the result,

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las sems kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las sems kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
translated: from the increase and decrease of those exhalations and inhalations, the mind also would increase and decrease.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol med par de gnyis 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bad rtsol med par de gnyis 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not so, i.e., they do not occur without effort.

original: gal te 'bad rtsol med par 'byin pa dang 'dren pa mi 'byung bas de dag rgyu'i 'bras bu nyid yin mod /
analyzed: gal te 'bad rtsol med par 'byin pa dang 'dren pa mi 'byung bas de dag rgyu'i 'bras bu nyid yin mod /
translated: If it is argued that since the occurrence of exhalation and inhalation without effort is not possible, they are the effect of a cause,

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag go //
translated: the exhalation and inhalation are the effect of the cause, the life faculty.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de dag ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, they are the effect of the life faculty.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag go //
translated: The exhalation and inhalation are the effect of the life faculty.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni de dag gi chos kyi rang bzhin 'byin pa dang 'dren pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni de dag gi chos kyi rang bzhin 'byin pa dang 'dren pa nyid yin no //
translated: Or, their nature is exhalation and inhalation.

original: 'o na de dag gi rang bzhin gang las skyes snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag gi rang bzhin gang las skyes snyam na /
translated: But if it is asked, from what is their nature born?

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las zhes smras @75b so ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las zhes smras @75b so ;
translated: It is said, from another cause.

original: / sems de las ni'o //
analyzed: / sems de las ni'o //
translated: The mind is from that.

original: sun 'byin pa'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of the refutation is this.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las yin no zhes gang smas pa de la gzhan gnas pa'i rlung ngam lus yin par brtag / dang po'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rgyu gzhan las yin no zhes gang smas pa de la gzhan gnas pa'i rlung ngam lus yin par brtag / dang po'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation from the perspective of the first is stated in ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: gnas pa de ni'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de ni'o //
translated: That abiding is

original: de las 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: from that, exhalation and inhalation would occur.

original: de las sems de las kyang 'byin pa dang 'dren par 'gyur zhing yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhi ba las sems ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las sems de las kyang 'byin pa dang 'dren par 'gyur zhing yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba'i phyir zhi ba las sems ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: From that, the mind would also be emitted and drawn in, and would again become just like that, so the mind would not turn away from peace.

original: gnas pa'i rlung gtan du thams cad la yod par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rlung gtan du thams cad la yod par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the abiding wind is established as existing for all time.

original: gnas pa'i rlung rgyu yin no zhes de skad du smra snyam na gal te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rlung rgyu yin no zhes de skad du smra snyam na gal te zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you think that the abiding wind is the cause, then ‚Äúif‚Äù is stated.

original: phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúthe second position.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe yang skabs kyi nyes pa nyid yod do zhes ston pa ni gal te gnas pa'i rlung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang skabs kyi nyes pa nyid yod do zhes ston pa ni gal te gnas pa'i rlung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, the fault of the context still exists. This is shown in ‚ÄúIf the abiding wind‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe ldog pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ldog pa med pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: At that time, it is said, ‚Äúthere is no turning back.‚Äù

original: lus las 'byung rngub de las sems de las 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir lus 'di nyid rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lus las 'byung rngub de las sems de las 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir lus 'di nyid rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Because exhalation and inhalation arise from the body, and the mind arises from that, and because the mind is drawn out from that, this very body is the fundamental cause.

original: des na ldog pa med par thal ba so na 'dug go //
analyzed: des na ldog pa med par thal ba so na 'dug go //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of no turning back remains.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever,‚Äù refers to the first half of the verse.

original: rgyu yin na zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa ste gnas pa'i rlung nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu yin na zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa ste gnas pa'i rlung nyid la brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the cause‚Äù refers to the indirect cause, which is the life-sustaining wind itself.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de med pas na sems ldog par 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi thob ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa de med pas na sems ldog par 'dod pa gang yin pa de mi thob ste /
translated: If one asserts that the mind turns back due to the absence of that exhalation and inhalation, that is not obtained,

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa nyid mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because exhalation and inhalation themselves do not turn back.

original: de ltar rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam 'grel gyi phyed snga ma bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the first half of the Commentary,

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the second half is explained: ‚Äúexhalation and inhalation.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag las rnam par shes pa 'phel ba dang 'grib par ni mtha' med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag las rnam par shes pa 'phel ba dang 'grib par ni mtha' med do //
translated: There is no end to the increase and decrease of consciousness from the increase and decrease of inhalation and exhalation.

original: des na de dag ni sems kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag ni sems kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the primary cause of mind.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyur khas blangs kyang brjod pa'i thal ba mi ldog go zhes brjod pa ni de dag la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag sems kyi rgyur khas blangs kyang brjod pa'i thal ba mi ldog go zhes brjod pa ni de dag la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that even if inhalation and exhalation are accepted as the cause of mind, the stated consequence is not averted.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la yang thal ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la yang thal ba mtshungs so //
translated: The consequence is the same for inhalation and exhalation.

original: de'i rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i lus gnas pa'i phyir na sems ldog pa med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshang ba med pa'i lus gnas pa'i phyir na sems ldog pa med pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the mind does not cease because the body, which is its cause, remains.

original: 'di nyid ni gtsor 'chad pa ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni gtsor 'chad pa ni 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the primary explanation.

original: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig rkang lhag ma gsum rnam par @76a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig rkang lhag ma gsum rnam par @76a * //
translated: The remaining three lines beginning with ‚ÄúIf you think‚Äù are explained in the commentary.

original: 'grel ba'o // ci ltar lus yod na 'byung ba la sogs pa mi ldog pas na sems yod par thal ba de ltar sbyor bar byed pa ni sems ni gnas pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel ba'o // ci ltar lus yod na 'byung ba la sogs pa mi ldog pas na sems yod par thal ba de ltar sbyor bar byed pa ni sems ni gnas pa nyid na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the existence of the body is not averted by the elements, etc., so the existence of mind is not averted by the consequence.üîΩThe mind, when it is present, is not averted by the desire for the arising of the consequence.

original: thal bar 'gyur ba skye 'dod pa'i sems la ltos nas snga ma 'chi kha ma'i sems tha ma yang de'i snga ma 'dod na ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ba skye 'dod pa'i sems la ltos nas snga ma 'chi kha ma'i sems tha ma yang de'i snga ma 'dod na ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The prior mind at the time of death is not averted by the desire for the prior mind.

original: tha ma dang nye ba ni lus kyi gnas so //
analyzed: tha ma dang nye ba ni lus kyi gnas so //
translated: The prior mind is the basis of the body.

original: tha ma na 'byung rngub kyi gnas yin no //
analyzed: tha ma na 'byung rngub kyi gnas yin no //
translated: The prior mind is the basis of inhalation and exhalation.

original: lus de la srid pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i las de de'i ming can no //
analyzed: lus de la srid pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i las de de'i ming can no //
translated: In that body, the karma that functions simultaneously with existence is named.

original: 'dis ni srid pa dang las bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni srid pa dang las bstan to //
translated: This teaches existence and karma.

original: rmongs pa yang nye bar mtshon pa bya pa yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa yang nye bar mtshon pa bya pa yin no //
translated: Delusion is also to be illustrated.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ni 'du byed ces bya ba bag chags kyi sa bon yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ni 'du byed ces bya ba bag chags kyi sa bon yin no //
translated: That very nature of ignorance, etc., is called the seed of the latent tendencies.

original: 'du byed de skye bar 'dod pa la snga ma'i sems las sad par byas pa gang yin ba der gyur pa na snga ma ci lta ba bzhin du lus de las sems skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed de skye bar 'dod pa la snga ma'i sems las sad par byas pa gang yin ba der gyur pa na snga ma ci lta ba bzhin du lus de las sems skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: When that formation is about to arise, then, just as before, it causes the mind to arise from that body,

original: gzhan du ste skye ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ste skye ba gzhan du skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: or elsewhere, that is, it causes it to arise in another birth.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: From what is this distinction known?

original: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúfrom the latent impressions.

original: gang zhig sad pa na lus de nyid la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba'i bag chags 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig sad pa na lus de nyid la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba'i bag chags 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: ‚Äù There are some latent impressions that, when awakened, cause the experience of pleasure, pain, etc. in just that body.

original: gang zhig sad pa'i lus gzhan la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba'i bag chags 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sad pa'i lus gzhan la bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa nye bar spyod par 'gyur ba'i bag chags 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: There are also some latent impressions that, when awakened, cause the experience of pleasure, pain, etc. in another body.

original: de la dang po ni phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis /
analyzed: de la dang po ni phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis /
translated: The first of these is the cause of the special benefits.

original: lus de la skye 'dod pa gzhan dang gzhan la ltos nas snga ma snga ma'i sems la sad par byed la /
analyzed: lus de la skye 'dod pa gzhan dang gzhan la ltos nas snga ma snga ma'i sems la sad par byed la /
translated: The other minds that are the basis of the desire to be born in that body are awakened by the prior mind that is the basis of the desire for another body.

original: gnyis pa ni gnad du na ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnad du na ba la sogs pas /
translated: The second is the mind that is the basis of the desire to be born in a body that is sick, etc.

original: skye bar 'dod pa'i sems la ltos nas snga mar gyur pa tha ma'i sems las sad par byed do //üîΩde bzhin du bag chags kyi sa bon ji skad bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa'i sems la ltos nas snga mar gyur pa tha ma'i sems las sad par byed do // de bzhin du bag chags kyi sa bon ji skad bshad pa ni /
translated: It is awakened by the prior mind that is the basis of the desire for a body, which is the final mind.

original: sna tshogs bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the seeds of the various propensities should be seen as explained.

original: bag chags thog ma med pa nyid ni bsnyon par mi 'os te /üîΩmthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags thog ma med pa nyid ni bsnyon par mi 'os te / mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The beginninglessness of propensities is not to be denied,üîΩbecause it is seen.

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is like the case of the various consciousnesses.

original: 'dis ni shes pa sna tshogs par dngos su bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa sna tshogs par dngos su bshad pa yin no //
translated: This directly explains the various consciousnesses.

original: bag chags sna tshogs ba ni shugs kyis so //
analyzed: bag chags sna tshogs ba ni shugs kyis so //
translated: The various propensities are implied.

original: de bzhin du bag chags @76b sad par byed pa'i rkyen yang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bag chags @76b sad par byed pa'i rkyen yang rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the conditions that awaken the propensities should be inferred.

original: sems sna tshogs pa de don sna tshogs pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems sna tshogs pa de don sna tshogs pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That various consciousnesses are produced by various objects is not so.

original: don gyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyis stong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of meaning.

original: gzhan du snang ba'i phyogs la yang bag chags su smra ba ni sbang bar dka'o //
analyzed: gzhan du snang ba'i phyogs la yang bag chags su smra ba ni sbang bar dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to refute the position that appearances are other, since they are asserted to be habitual propensities.

original: 'di ltar don mi nye ba'i phyir na mi snang ba nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar don mi nye ba'i phyir na mi snang ba nyid dam /
translated: Since the object does not appear, it is not seen.

original: phyin ci ma log par shes pa nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur zhes spyad pa na /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par shes pa nyid du ci ste mi 'gyur zhes spyad pa na /
translated: Or, why is it not the case that it is a nonerroneous consciousness?

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa'i rgyud 'dus byas pa'i khyad par shes pa las skyes pa'i bdag gi yon tan khas blang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa'i rgyud 'dus byas pa'i khyad par shes pa las skyes pa'i bdag gi yon tan khas blang bar bya ba'am /
translated: In that case, you must accept that the continuum of consciousness that has that aspect is a special conditioned phenomenon arisen from the consciousness itself.

original: bdag med na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis nus pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis nus pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, if there is no self, it is a special potency of the immediately preceding condition.
